1702  char buf[32];
1703  sprintf(buf, "%d/%d", (int)(progress_saturated * 1753), 1753);
1704  ImGui::ProgressBar(progress, ImVec2(0.f, 0.f), buf);
1705  ImGui::TreePop();
1706  }
1707 
1708  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Color/Picker Widgets"))
1709  {
1710  static ImVec4 color = ImVec4(114.0f / 255.0f, 144.0f / 255.0f, 154.0f / 255.0f, 200.0f / 255.0f);
1711 
1712  static bool alpha_preview = true;
1713  static bool alpha_half_preview = false;
1714  static bool drag_and_drop = true;
1715  static bool options_menu = true;
1716  static bool hdr = false;
1717  ImGui::Checkbox("With Alpha Preview", &alpha_preview);
1718  ImGui::Checkbox("With Half Alpha Preview", &alpha_half_preview);
1719  ImGui::Checkbox("With Drag and Drop", &drag_and_drop);
1720  ImGui::Checkbox("With Options Menu", &options_menu); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Right-click on the individual color widget to show options.");
1721  ImGui::Checkbox("With HDR", &hdr); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Currently all this does is to lift the 0..1 limits on dragging widgets.");
1722  ImGuiColorEditFlags misc_flags = (hdr ? ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR : 0) | (drag_and_drop ? 0 : ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop) | (alpha_half_preview ? ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf : (alpha_preview ? ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview : 0)) | (options_menu ? 0 : ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions);
1723 
1724  ImGui::Text("Color widget:");
1725  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
1726  "Click on the color square to open a color picker.\n"
1727  "CTRL+click on individual component to input value.\n");
1728  ImGui::ColorEdit3("MyColor##1", (float *)&color, misc_flags);
1729 
1730  ImGui::Text("Color widget HSV with Alpha:");
1731  ImGui::ColorEdit4("MyColor##2", (float *)&color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV | misc_flags);
1732 
1733  ImGui::Text("Color widget with Float Display:");
1734  ImGui::ColorEdit4("MyColor##2f", (float *)&color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float | misc_flags);
1735 
1736  ImGui::Text("Color button with Picker:");
1737  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
1738  "With the ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs flag you can hide all the slider/text inputs.\n"
1739  "With the ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel flag you can pass a non-empty label which will only "
1740  "be used for the tooltip and picker popup.");
1741  ImGui::ColorEdit4("MyColor##3", (float *)&color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel | misc_flags);
1742 
1743  ImGui::Text("Color button with Custom Picker Popup:");
1744 
1745  // Generate a default palette. The palette will persist and can be edited.
1746  static bool saved_palette_init = true;
1747  static ImVec4 saved_palette[32] = {};
1748  if (saved_palette_init)
1749  {
1750  for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(saved_palette); n++)
1751  {
1752  ImGui::ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(n / 31.0f, 0.8f, 0.8f,
1753  saved_palette[n].x, saved_palette[n].y, saved_palette[n].z);
1754  saved_palette[n].w = 1.0f; // Alpha
1755  }
1756  saved_palette_init = false;
1757  }
1758 
1759  static ImVec4 backup_color;
1760  bool open_popup = ImGui::ColorButton("MyColor##3b", color, misc_flags);
1761  ImGui::SameLine(0, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x);
1762  open_popup |= ImGui::Button("Palette");
1763  if (open_popup)
1764  {
1765  ImGui::OpenPopup("mypicker");
1766  backup_color = color;
1767  }
1768  if (ImGui::BeginPopup("mypicker"))
1769  {
1770  ImGui::Text("MY CUSTOM COLOR PICKER WITH AN AMAZING PALETTE!");
1771  ImGui::Separator();
1772  ImGui::ColorPicker4("##picker", (float *)&color, misc_flags | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview);
1773  ImGui::SameLine();
1774 
1775  ImGui::BeginGroup(); // Lock X position
1776  ImGui::Text("Current");
1777  ImGui::ColorButton("##current", color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf, ImVec2(60, 40));
1778  ImGui::Text("Previous");
1779  if (ImGui::ColorButton("##previous", backup_color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf, ImVec2(60, 40)))
1780  color = backup_color;
1781  ImGui::Separator();
1782  ImGui::Text("Palette");
1783  for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(saved_palette); n++)
1784  {
1785  ImGui::PushID(n);
1786  if ((n % 8) != 0)
1787  ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemSpacing.y);
1788 
1789  ImGuiColorEditFlags palette_button_flags = ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip;
1790  if (ImGui::ColorButton("##palette", saved_palette[n], palette_button_flags, ImVec2(20, 20)))
1791  color = ImVec4(saved_palette[n].x, saved_palette[n].y, saved_palette[n].z, color.w); // Preserve alpha!
1792 
1793  // Allow user to drop colors into each palette entry. Note that ColorButton() is already a
1794  // drag source by default, unless specifying the ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop flag.
1795  if (ImGui::BeginDragDropTarget())
1796  {
1797  if (const ImGuiPayload *payload = ImGui::AcceptDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_3F))
1798  memcpy((float *)&saved_palette[n], payload->Data, sizeof(float) * 3);
1799  if (const ImGuiPayload *payload = ImGui::AcceptDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_4F))
1800  memcpy((float *)&saved_palette[n], payload->Data, sizeof(float) * 4);
1801  ImGui::EndDragDropTarget();
1802  }
1803 
1804  ImGui::PopID();
1805  }
1806  ImGui::EndGroup();
1807  ImGui::EndPopup();
1808  }
1809 
1810  ImGui::Text("Color button only:");
1811  static bool no_border = false;
1812  ImGui::Checkbox("ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoBorder", &no_border);
1813  ImGui::ColorButton("MyColor##3c", *(ImVec4 *)&color, misc_flags | (no_border ? ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoBorder : 0), ImVec2(80, 80));
1814 
1815  ImGui::Text("Color picker:");
1816  static bool alpha = true;
1817  static bool alpha_bar = true;
1818  static bool side_preview = true;
1819  static bool ref_color = false;
1820  static ImVec4 ref_color_v(1.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f, 0.5f);
1821  static int display_mode = 0;
1822  static int picker_mode = 0;
1823  ImGui::Checkbox("With Alpha", &alpha);
1824  ImGui::Checkbox("With Alpha Bar", &alpha_bar);
1825  ImGui::Checkbox("With Side Preview", &side_preview);
1826  if (side_preview)
1827  {
1828  ImGui::SameLine();
1829  ImGui::Checkbox("With Ref Color", &ref_color);
1830  if (ref_color)
1831  {
1832  ImGui::SameLine();
1833  ImGui::ColorEdit4("##RefColor", &ref_color_v.x, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs | misc_flags);
1834  }
1835  }
1836  ImGui::Combo("Display Mode", &display_mode, "Auto/Current\0None\0RGB Only\0HSV Only\0Hex Only\0");
1837  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
1838  "ColorEdit defaults to displaying RGB inputs if you don't specify a display mode, "
1839  "but the user can change it with a right-click.\n\nColorPicker defaults to displaying RGB+HSV+Hex "
1840  "if you don't specify a display mode.\n\nYou can change the defaults using SetColorEditOptions().");
1841  ImGui::Combo("Picker Mode", &picker_mode, "Auto/Current\0Hue bar + SV rect\0Hue wheel + SV triangle\0");
1842  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("User can right-click the picker to change mode.");
1843  ImGuiColorEditFlags flags = misc_flags;
1844  if (!alpha) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha; // This is by default if you call ColorPicker3() instead of ColorPicker4()
1845  if (alpha_bar) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar;
1846  if (!side_preview) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview;
1847  if (picker_mode == 1) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar;
1848  if (picker_mode == 2) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel;
1849  if (display_mode == 1) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs; // Disable all RGB/HSV/Hex displays
1850  if (display_mode == 2) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB; // Override display mode
1851  if (display_mode == 3) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV;
1852  if (display_mode == 4) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex;
1853  ImGui::ColorPicker4("MyColor##4", (float *)&color, flags, ref_color ? &ref_color_v.x : NULL);
1854 
1855  ImGui::Text("Set defaults in code:");
1856  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
1857  "SetColorEditOptions() is designed to allow you to set boot-time default.\n"
1858  "We don't have Push/Pop functions because you can force options on a per-widget basis if needed,"
1859  "and the user can change non-forced ones with the options menu.\nWe don't have a getter to avoid"
1860  "encouraging you to persistently save values that aren't forward-compatible.");
1861  if (ImGui::Button("Default: Uint8 + HSV + Hue Bar"))
1862  ImGui::SetColorEditOptions(ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8 | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar);
1863  if (ImGui::Button("Default: Float + HDR + Hue Wheel"))
1864  ImGui::SetColorEditOptions(ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float | ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel);
1865 
1866  // HSV encoded support (to avoid RGB<>HSV round trips and singularities when S==0 or V==0)
1867  static ImVec4 color_hsv(0.23f, 1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f); // Stored as HSV!
1868  ImGui::Spacing();
1869  ImGui::Text("HSV encoded colors");
1870  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
1871  "By default, colors are given to ColorEdit and ColorPicker in RGB, but ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV"
1872  "allows you to store colors as HSV and pass them to ColorEdit and ColorPicker as HSV. This comes with the"
1873  "added benefit that you can manipulate hue values with the picker even when saturation or value are zero.");
1874  ImGui::Text("Color widget with InputHSV:");
1875  ImGui::ColorEdit4("HSV shown as RGB##1", (float *)&color_hsv, ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV | ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float);
1876  ImGui::ColorEdit4("HSV shown as HSV##1", (float *)&color_hsv, ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV | ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float);
1877  ImGui::DragFloat4("Raw HSV values", (float *)&color_hsv, 0.01f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
1878 
1879  ImGui::TreePop();
1880  }
1881 
1882  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Drag/Slider Flags"))
1883  {
1884  // Demonstrate using advanced flags for DragXXX and SliderXXX functions. Note that the flags are the same!
1885  static ImGuiSliderFlags flags = ImGuiSliderFlags_None;
1886  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp", &flags, ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp);
1887  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Always clamp value to min/max bounds (if any) when input manually with CTRL+Click.");
1888  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic", &flags, ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic);
1889  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable logarithmic editing (more precision for small values).");
1890  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat", &flags, ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat);
1891  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable rounding underlying value to match precision of the format string (e.g. %.3f values are rounded to those 3 digits).");
1892  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput", &flags, ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput);
1893  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable CTRL+Click or Enter key allowing to input text directly into the widget.");
1894 
1895  // Drags
1896  static float drag_f = 0.5f;
1897  static int drag_i = 50;
1898  ImGui::Text("Underlying float value: %f", drag_f);
1899  ImGui::DragFloat("DragFloat (0 -> 1)", &drag_f, 0.005f, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.3f", flags);
1900  ImGui::DragFloat("DragFloat (0 -> +inf)", &drag_f, 0.005f, 0.0f, FLT_MAX, "%.3f", flags);
1901  ImGui::DragFloat("DragFloat (-inf -> 1)", &drag_f, 0.005f, -FLT_MAX, 1.0f, "%.3f", flags);
1902  ImGui::DragFloat("DragFloat (-inf -> +inf)", &drag_f, 0.005f, -FLT_MAX, +FLT_MAX, "%.3f", flags);
1903  ImGui::DragInt("DragInt (0 -> 100)", &drag_i, 0.5f, 0, 100, "%d", flags);
1904 
1905  // Sliders
1906  static float slider_f = 0.5f;
1907  static int slider_i = 50;
1908  ImGui::Text("Underlying float value: %f", slider_f);
1909  ImGui::SliderFloat("SliderFloat (0 -> 1)", &slider_f, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.3f", flags);
1910  ImGui::SliderInt("SliderInt (0 -> 100)", &slider_i, 0, 100, "%d", flags);
1911 
1912  ImGui::TreePop();
1913  }
1914 
1915  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Range Widgets"))
1916  {
1917  static float begin = 10, end = 90;
1918  static int begin_i = 100, end_i = 1000;
1919  ImGui::DragFloatRange2("range float", &begin, &end, 0.25f, 0.0f, 100.0f, "Min: %.1f %%", "Max: %.1f %%", ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp);
1920  ImGui::DragIntRange2("range int", &begin_i, &end_i, 5, 0, 1000, "Min: %d units", "Max: %d units");
1921  ImGui::DragIntRange2("range int (no bounds)", &begin_i, &end_i, 5, 0, 0, "Min: %d units", "Max: %d units");
1922  ImGui::TreePop();
1923  }
1924 
1925  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Data Types"))
1926  {
1927  // DragScalar/InputScalar/SliderScalar functions allow various data types
1928  // - signed/unsigned
1929  // - 8/16/32/64-bits
1930  // - integer/float/double
1931  // To avoid polluting the public API with all possible combinations, we use the ImGuiDataType enum
1932  // to pass the type, and passing all arguments by pointer.
1933  // This is the reason the test code below creates local variables to hold "zero" "one" etc. for each types.
1934  // In practice, if you frequently use a given type that is not covered by the normal API entry points,
1935  // you can wrap it yourself inside a 1 line function which can take typed argument as value instead of void*,
1936  // and then pass their address to the generic function. For example:
1937  // bool MySliderU64(const char *label, u64* value, u64 min = 0, u64 max = 0, const char* format = "%lld")
1938  // {
1939  // return SliderScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_U64, value, &min, &max, format);
1940  // }
1941 
1942  // Setup limits (as helper variables so we can take their address, as explained above)
1943  // Note: SliderScalar() functions have a maximum usable range of half the natural type maximum, hence the /2.
1944 #ifndef LLONG_MIN
1945  ImS64 LLONG_MIN = -9223372036854775807LL - 1;
1946  ImS64 LLONG_MAX = 9223372036854775807LL;
1947  ImU64 ULLONG_MAX = (2ULL * 9223372036854775807LL + 1);
1948 #endif
1949  const char s8_zero = 0, s8_one = 1, s8_fifty = 50, s8_min = -128, s8_max = 127;
1950  const ImU8 u8_zero = 0, u8_one = 1, u8_fifty = 50, u8_min = 0, u8_max = 255;
1951  const short s16_zero = 0, s16_one = 1, s16_fifty = 50, s16_min = -32768, s16_max = 32767;
1952  const ImU16 u16_zero = 0, u16_one = 1, u16_fifty = 50, u16_min = 0, u16_max = 65535;
1953  const ImS32 s32_zero = 0, s32_one = 1, s32_fifty = 50, s32_min = INT_MIN / 2, s32_max = INT_MAX / 2, s32_hi_a = INT_MAX / 2 - 100, s32_hi_b = INT_MAX / 2;
1954  const ImU32 u32_zero = 0, u32_one = 1, u32_fifty = 50, u32_min = 0, u32_max = UINT_MAX / 2, u32_hi_a = UINT_MAX / 2 - 100, u32_hi_b = UINT_MAX / 2;
1955  const ImS64 s64_zero = 0, s64_one = 1, s64_fifty = 50, s64_min = LLONG_MIN / 2, s64_max = LLONG_MAX / 2, s64_hi_a = LLONG_MAX / 2 - 100, s64_hi_b = LLONG_MAX / 2;
1956  const ImU64 u64_zero = 0, u64_one = 1, u64_fifty = 50, u64_min = 0, u64_max = ULLONG_MAX / 2, u64_hi_a = ULLONG_MAX / 2 - 100, u64_hi_b = ULLONG_MAX / 2;
1957  const float f32_zero = 0.f, f32_one = 1.f, f32_lo_a = -10000000000.0f, f32_hi_a = +10000000000.0f;
1958  const double f64_zero = 0., f64_one = 1., f64_lo_a = -1000000000000000.0, f64_hi_a = +1000000000000000.0;
1959 
1960  // State
1961  static char s8_v = 127;
1962  static ImU8 u8_v = 255;
1963  static short s16_v = 32767;
1964  static ImU16 u16_v = 65535;
1965  static ImS32 s32_v = -1;
1966  static ImU32 u32_v = (ImU32)-1;
1967  static ImS64 s64_v = -1;
1968  static ImU64 u64_v = (ImU64)-1;
1969  static float f32_v = 0.123f;
1970  static double f64_v = 90000.01234567890123456789;
1971 
1972  const float drag_speed = 0.2f;
1973  static bool drag_clamp = false;
1974  ImGui::Text("Drags:");
1975  ImGui::Checkbox("Clamp integers to 0..50", &drag_clamp);
1976  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
1977  "As with every widgets in dear imgui, we never modify values unless there is a user interaction.\n"
1978  "You can override the clamping limits by using CTRL+Click to input a value.");
1979  ImGui::DragScalar("drag s8", ImGuiDataType_S8, &s8_v, drag_speed, drag_clamp ? &s8_zero : NULL, drag_clamp ? &s8_fifty : NULL);
1980  ImGui::DragScalar("drag u8", ImGuiDataType_U8, &u8_v, drag_speed, drag_clamp ? &u8_zero : NULL, drag_clamp ? &u8_fifty : NULL, "%u ms");
1981  ImGui::DragScalar("drag s16", ImGuiDataType_S16, &s16_v, drag_speed, drag_clamp ? &s16_zero : NULL, drag_clamp ? &s16_fifty : NULL);
1982  ImGui::DragScalar("drag u16", ImGuiDataType_U16, &u16_v, drag_speed, drag_clamp ? &u16_zero : NULL, drag_clamp ? &u16_fifty : NULL, "%u ms");
1983  ImGui::DragScalar("drag s32", ImGuiDataType_S32, &s32_v, drag_speed, drag_clamp ? &s32_zero : NULL, drag_clamp ? &s32_fifty : NULL);
1984  ImGui::DragScalar("drag u32", ImGuiDataType_U32, &u32_v, drag_speed, drag_clamp ? &u32_zero : NULL, drag_clamp ? &u32_fifty : NULL, "%u ms");
1985  ImGui::DragScalar("drag s64", ImGuiDataType_S64, &s64_v, drag_speed, drag_clamp ? &s64_zero : NULL, drag_clamp ? &s64_fifty : NULL);
1986  ImGui::DragScalar("drag u64", ImGuiDataType_U64, &u64_v, drag_speed, drag_clamp ? &u64_zero : NULL, drag_clamp ? &u64_fifty : NULL);
1987  ImGui::DragScalar("drag float", ImGuiDataType_Float, &f32_v, 0.005f, &f32_zero, &f32_one, "%f");
1988  ImGui::DragScalar("drag float log", ImGuiDataType_Float, &f32_v, 0.005f, &f32_zero, &f32_one, "%f", ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic);
1989  ImGui::DragScalar("drag double", ImGuiDataType_Double, &f64_v, 0.0005f, &f64_zero, NULL, "%.10f grams");
1990  ImGui::DragScalar("drag double log", ImGuiDataType_Double, &f64_v, 0.0005f, &f64_zero, &f64_one, "0 < %.10f < 1", ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic);
1991 
1992  ImGui::Text("Sliders");
1993  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s8 full", ImGuiDataType_S8, &s8_v, &s8_min, &s8_max, "%d");
1994  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u8 full", ImGuiDataType_U8, &u8_v, &u8_min, &u8_max, "%u");
1995  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s16 full", ImGuiDataType_S16, &s16_v, &s16_min, &s16_max, "%d");
1996  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u16 full", ImGuiDataType_U16, &u16_v, &u16_min, &u16_max, "%u");
1997  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s32 low", ImGuiDataType_S32, &s32_v, &s32_zero, &s32_fifty, "%d");
1998  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s32 high", ImGuiDataType_S32, &s32_v, &s32_hi_a, &s32_hi_b, "%d");
1999  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s32 full", ImGuiDataType_S32, &s32_v, &s32_min, &s32_max, "%d");
2000  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u32 low", ImGuiDataType_U32, &u32_v, &u32_zero, &u32_fifty, "%u");
2001  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u32 high", ImGuiDataType_U32, &u32_v, &u32_hi_a, &u32_hi_b, "%u");
2002  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u32 full", ImGuiDataType_U32, &u32_v, &u32_min, &u32_max, "%u");
2003  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s64 low", ImGuiDataType_S64, &s64_v, &s64_zero, &s64_fifty, "%" IM_PRId64);
2004  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s64 high", ImGuiDataType_S64, &s64_v, &s64_hi_a, &s64_hi_b, "%" IM_PRId64);
2005  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s64 full", ImGuiDataType_S64, &s64_v, &s64_min, &s64_max, "%" IM_PRId64);
2006  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u64 low", ImGuiDataType_U64, &u64_v, &u64_zero, &u64_fifty, "%" IM_PRIu64 " ms");
2007  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u64 high", ImGuiDataType_U64, &u64_v, &u64_hi_a, &u64_hi_b, "%" IM_PRIu64 " ms");
2008  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u64 full", ImGuiDataType_U64, &u64_v, &u64_min, &u64_max, "%" IM_PRIu64 " ms");
2009  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider float low", ImGuiDataType_Float, &f32_v, &f32_zero, &f32_one);
2010  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider float low log", ImGuiDataType_Float, &f32_v, &f32_zero, &f32_one, "%.10f", ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic);
2011  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider float high", ImGuiDataType_Float, &f32_v, &f32_lo_a, &f32_hi_a, "%e");
2012  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider double low", ImGuiDataType_Double, &f64_v, &f64_zero, &f64_one, "%.10f grams");
2013  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider double low log", ImGuiDataType_Double, &f64_v, &f64_zero, &f64_one, "%.10f", ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic);
2014  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider double high", ImGuiDataType_Double, &f64_v, &f64_lo_a, &f64_hi_a, "%e grams");
2015 
2016  ImGui::Text("Sliders (reverse)");
2017  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s8 reverse", ImGuiDataType_S8, &s8_v, &s8_max, &s8_min, "%d");
2018  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u8 reverse", ImGuiDataType_U8, &u8_v, &u8_max, &u8_min, "%u");
2019  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s32 reverse", ImGuiDataType_S32, &s32_v, &s32_fifty, &s32_zero, "%d");
2020  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u32 reverse", ImGuiDataType_U32, &u32_v, &u32_fifty, &u32_zero, "%u");
2021  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s64 reverse", ImGuiDataType_S64, &s64_v, &s64_fifty, &s64_zero, "%" IM_PRId64);
2022  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u64 reverse", ImGuiDataType_U64, &u64_v, &u64_fifty, &u64_zero, "%" IM_PRIu64 " ms");
2023 
2024  static bool inputs_step = true;
2025  ImGui::Text("Inputs");
2026  ImGui::Checkbox("Show step buttons", &inputs_step);
2027  ImGui::InputScalar("input s8", ImGuiDataType_S8, &s8_v, inputs_step ? &s8_one : NULL, NULL, "%d");
2028  ImGui::InputScalar("input u8", ImGuiDataType_U8, &u8_v, inputs_step ? &u8_one : NULL, NULL, "%u");
2029  ImGui::InputScalar("input s16", ImGuiDataType_S16, &s16_v, inputs_step ? &s16_one : NULL, NULL, "%d");
2030  ImGui::InputScalar("input u16", ImGuiDataType_U16, &u16_v, inputs_step ? &u16_one : NULL, NULL, "%u");
2031  ImGui::InputScalar("input s32", ImGuiDataType_S32, &s32_v, inputs_step ? &s32_one : NULL, NULL, "%d");
2032  ImGui::InputScalar("input s32 hex", ImGuiDataType_S32, &s32_v, inputs_step ? &s32_one : NULL, NULL, "%08X", ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal);
2033  ImGui::InputScalar("input u32", ImGuiDataType_U32, &u32_v, inputs_step ? &u32_one : NULL, NULL, "%u");
2034  ImGui::InputScalar("input u32 hex", ImGuiDataType_U32, &u32_v, inputs_step ? &u32_one : NULL, NULL, "%08X", ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal);
2035  ImGui::InputScalar("input s64", ImGuiDataType_S64, &s64_v, inputs_step ? &s64_one : NULL);
2036  ImGui::InputScalar("input u64", ImGuiDataType_U64, &u64_v, inputs_step ? &u64_one : NULL);
2037  ImGui::InputScalar("input float", ImGuiDataType_Float, &f32_v, inputs_step ? &f32_one : NULL);
2038  ImGui::InputScalar("input double", ImGuiDataType_Double, &f64_v, inputs_step ? &f64_one : NULL);
2039 
2040  ImGui::TreePop();
2041  }
2042 
2043  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Multi-component Widgets"))
2044  {
2045  static float vec4f[4] = { 0.10f, 0.20f, 0.30f, 0.44f };
2046  static int vec4i[4] = { 1, 5, 100, 255 };
2047 
2048  ImGui::InputFloat2("input float2", vec4f);
2049  ImGui::DragFloat2("drag float2", vec4f, 0.01f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
2050  ImGui::SliderFloat2("slider float2", vec4f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
2051  ImGui::InputInt2("input int2", vec4i);
2052  ImGui::DragInt2("drag int2", vec4i, 1, 0, 255);
2053  ImGui::SliderInt2("slider int2", vec4i, 0, 255);
2054  ImGui::Spacing();
2055 
2056  ImGui::InputFloat3("input float3", vec4f);
2057  ImGui::DragFloat3("drag float3", vec4f, 0.01f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
2058  ImGui::SliderFloat3("slider float3", vec4f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
2059  ImGui::InputInt3("input int3", vec4i);
2060  ImGui::DragInt3("drag int3", vec4i, 1, 0, 255);
2061  ImGui::SliderInt3("slider int3", vec4i, 0, 255);
2062  ImGui::Spacing();
2063 
2064  ImGui::InputFloat4("input float4", vec4f);
2065  ImGui::DragFloat4("drag float4", vec4f, 0.01f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
2066  ImGui::SliderFloat4("slider float4", vec4f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
2067  ImGui::InputInt4("input int4", vec4i);
2068  ImGui::DragInt4("drag int4", vec4i, 1, 0, 255);
2069  ImGui::SliderInt4("slider int4", vec4i, 0, 255);
2070 
2071  ImGui::TreePop();
2072  }
2073 
2074  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Vertical Sliders"))
2075  {
2076  const float spacing = 4;
2077  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(spacing, spacing));
2078 
2079  static int int_value = 0;
2080  ImGui::VSliderInt("##int", ImVec2(18, 160), &int_value, 0, 5);
2081  ImGui::SameLine();
2082 
2083  static float values[7] = { 0.0f, 0.60f, 0.35f, 0.9f, 0.70f, 0.20f, 0.0f };
2084  ImGui::PushID("set1");
2085  for (int i = 0; i < 7; i++)
2086  {
2087  if (i > 0) ImGui::SameLine();
2088  ImGui::PushID(i);
2089  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_FrameBg, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(i / 7.0f, 0.5f, 0.5f));
2090  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(i / 7.0f, 0.6f, 0.5f));
2091  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(i / 7.0f, 0.7f, 0.5f));
2092  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_SliderGrab, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(i / 7.0f, 0.9f, 0.9f));
2093  ImGui::VSliderFloat("##v", ImVec2(18, 160), &values[i], 0.0f, 1.0f, "");
2094  if (ImGui::IsItemActive() || ImGui::IsItemHovered())
2095  ImGui::SetTooltip("%.3f", values[i]);
2096  ImGui::PopStyleColor(4);
2097  ImGui::PopID();
2098  }
2099  ImGui::PopID();
2100 
2101  ImGui::SameLine();
2102  ImGui::PushID("set2");
2103  static float values2[4] = { 0.20f, 0.80f, 0.40f, 0.25f };
2104  const int rows = 3;
2105  const ImVec2 small_slider_size(18, (float)(int)((160.0f - (rows - 1) * spacing) / rows));
2106  for (int nx = 0; nx < 4; nx++)
2107  {
2108  if (nx > 0) ImGui::SameLine();
2109  ImGui::BeginGroup();
2110  for (int ny = 0; ny < rows; ny++)
2111  {
2112  ImGui::PushID(nx * rows + ny);
2113  ImGui::VSliderFloat("##v", small_slider_size, &values2[nx], 0.0f, 1.0f, "");
2114  if (ImGui::IsItemActive() || ImGui::IsItemHovered())
2115  ImGui::SetTooltip("%.3f", values2[nx]);
2116  ImGui::PopID();
2117  }
2118  ImGui::EndGroup();
2119  }
2120  ImGui::PopID();
2121 
2122  ImGui::SameLine();
2123  ImGui::PushID("set3");
2124  for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
2125  {
2126  if (i > 0) ImGui::SameLine();
2127  ImGui::PushID(i);
2128  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_GrabMinSize, 40);
2129  ImGui::VSliderFloat("##v", ImVec2(40, 160), &values[i], 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.2f\nsec");
2130  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
2131  ImGui::PopID();
2132  }
2133  ImGui::PopID();
2134  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
2135  ImGui::TreePop();
2136  }
2137 
2138  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Drag and Drop"))
2139  {
2140  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Drag and drop in standard widgets"))
2141  {
2142  // ColorEdit widgets automatically act as drag source and drag target.
2143  // They are using standardized payload strings IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_3F and IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_4F
2144  // to allow your own widgets to use colors in their drag and drop interaction.
2145  // Also see 'Demo->Widgets->Color/Picker Widgets->Palette' demo.
2146  HelpMarker("You can drag from the color squares.");
2147  static float col1[3] = { 1.0f, 0.0f, 0.2f };
2148  static float col2[4] = { 0.4f, 0.7f, 0.0f, 0.5f };
2149  ImGui::ColorEdit3("color 1", col1);
2150  ImGui::ColorEdit4("color 2", col2);
2151  ImGui::TreePop();
2152  }
2153 
2154  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Drag and drop to copy/swap items"))
2155  {
2156  enum Mode
2157  {
2158  Mode_Copy,
2159  Mode_Move,
2160  Mode_Swap
2161  };
2162  static int mode = 0;
2163  if (ImGui::RadioButton("Copy", mode == Mode_Copy))
2164  {
2165  mode = Mode_Copy;
2166  } ImGui::SameLine();
2167  if (ImGui::RadioButton("Move", mode == Mode_Move))
2168  {
2169  mode = Mode_Move;
2170  } ImGui::SameLine();
2171  if (ImGui::RadioButton("Swap", mode == Mode_Swap))
2172  {
2173  mode = Mode_Swap;
2174  }
2175  static const char *names[9] =
2176  {
2177  "Bobby", "Beatrice", "Betty",
2178  "Brianna", "Barry", "Bernard",
2179  "Bibi", "Blaine", "Bryn"
2180  };
2181  for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(names); n++)
2182  {
2183  ImGui::PushID(n);
2184  if ((n % 3) != 0)
2185  ImGui::SameLine();
2186  ImGui::Button(names[n], ImVec2(60, 60));
2187 
2188  // Our buttons are both drag sources and drag targets here!
2189  if (ImGui::BeginDragDropSource(ImGuiDragDropFlags_None))
2190  {
2191  // Set payload to carry the index of our item (could be anything)
2192  ImGui::SetDragDropPayload("DND_DEMO_CELL", &n, sizeof(int));
2193 
2194  // Display preview (could be anything, e.g. when dragging an image we could decide to display
2195  // the filename and a small preview of the image, etc.)
2196  if (mode == Mode_Copy)
2197  {
2198  ImGui::Text("Copy %s", names[n]);
2199  }
2200  if (mode == Mode_Move)
2201  {
2202  ImGui::Text("Move %s", names[n]);
2203  }
2204  if (mode == Mode_Swap)
2205  {
2206  ImGui::Text("Swap %s", names[n]);
2207  }
2208  ImGui::EndDragDropSource();
2209  }
2210  if (ImGui::BeginDragDropTarget())
2211  {
2212  if (const ImGuiPayload *payload = ImGui::AcceptDragDropPayload("DND_DEMO_CELL"))
2213  {
2214  IM_ASSERT(payload->DataSize == sizeof(int));
2215  int payload_n = *(const int *)payload->Data;
2216  if (mode == Mode_Copy)
2217  {
2218  names[n] = names[payload_n];
2219  }
2220  if (mode == Mode_Move)
2221  {
2222  names[n] = names[payload_n];
2223  names[payload_n] = "";
2224  }
2225  if (mode == Mode_Swap)
2226  {
2227  const char *tmp = names[n];
2228  names[n] = names[payload_n];
2229  names[payload_n] = tmp;
2230  }
2231  }
2232  ImGui::EndDragDropTarget();
2233  }
2234  ImGui::PopID();
2235  }
2236  ImGui::TreePop();
2237  }
2238 
2239  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Drag to reorder items (simple)"))
2240  {
2241  // Simple reordering
2242  HelpMarker(
2243  "We don't use the drag and drop api at all here! "
2244  "Instead we query when the item is held but not hovered, and order items accordingly.");
2245  static const char *item_names[] = { "Item One", "Item Two", "Item Three", "Item Four", "Item Five" };
2246  for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(item_names); n++)
2247  {
2248  const char *item = item_names[n];
2249  ImGui::Selectable(item);
2250 
2251  if (ImGui::IsItemActive() && !ImGui::IsItemHovered())
2252  {
2253  int n_next = n + (ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(0).y < 0.f ? -1 : 1);
2254  if (n_next >= 0 && n_next < IM_ARRAYSIZE(item_names))
2255  {
2256  item_names[n] = item_names[n_next];
2257  item_names[n_next] = item;
2258  ImGui::ResetMouseDragDelta();
2259  }
2260  }
2261  }
2262  ImGui::TreePop();
2263  }
2264 
2265  ImGui::TreePop();
2266  }
2267 
2268  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Querying Status (Edited/Active/Hovered etc.)"))
2269  {
2270  // Select an item type
2271  const char *item_names[] =
2272  {
2273  "Text", "Button", "Button (w/ repeat)", "Checkbox", "SliderFloat", "InputText", "InputFloat",
2274  "InputFloat3", "ColorEdit4", "Selectable", "MenuItem", "TreeNode", "TreeNode (w/ double-click)", "Combo", "ListBox"
2275  };
2276  static int item_type = 4;
2277  static bool item_disabled = false;
2278  ImGui::Combo("Item Type", &item_type, item_names, IM_ARRAYSIZE(item_names), IM_ARRAYSIZE(item_names));
2279  ImGui::SameLine();
2280  HelpMarker("Testing how various types of items are interacting with the IsItemXXX functions. Note that the bool return value of most ImGui function is generally equivalent to calling ImGui::IsItemHovered().");
2281  ImGui::Checkbox("Item Disabled", &item_disabled);
2282 
2283  // Submit selected item item so we can query their status in the code following it.
2284  bool ret = false;
2285  static bool b = false;
2286  static float col4f[4] = { 1.0f, 0.5, 0.0f, 1.0f };
2287  static char str[16] = {};
2288  if (item_disabled)
2289  ImGui::BeginDisabled(true);
2290  if (item_type == 0)
2291  {
2292  ImGui::Text("ITEM: Text");
2293  } // Testing text items with no identifier/interaction
2294  if (item_type == 1)
2295  {
2296  ret = ImGui::Button("ITEM: Button");
2297  } // Testing button
2298  if (item_type == 2)
2299  {
2300  ImGui::PushButtonRepeat(true); ret = ImGui::Button("ITEM: Button"); ImGui::PopButtonRepeat();
2301  } // Testing button (with repeater)
2302  if (item_type == 3)
2303  {
2304  ret = ImGui::Checkbox("ITEM: Checkbox", &b);
2305  } // Testing checkbox
2306  if (item_type == 4)
2307  {
2308  ret = ImGui::SliderFloat("ITEM: SliderFloat", &col4f[0], 0.0f, 1.0f);
2309  } // Testing basic item
2310  if (item_type == 5)
2311  {
2312  ret = ImGui::InputText("ITEM: InputText", &str[0], IM_ARRAYSIZE(str));
2313  } // Testing input text (which handles tabbing)
2314  if (item_type == 6)
2315  {
2316  ret = ImGui::InputFloat("ITEM: InputFloat", col4f, 1.0f);
2317  } // Testing +/- buttons on scalar input
2318  if (item_type == 7)
2319  {
2320  ret = ImGui::InputFloat3("ITEM: InputFloat3", col4f);
2321  } // Testing multi-component items (IsItemXXX flags are reported merged)
2322  if (item_type == 8)
2323  {
2324  ret = ImGui::ColorEdit4("ITEM: ColorEdit4", col4f);
2325  } // Testing multi-component items (IsItemXXX flags are reported merged)
2326  if (item_type == 9)
2327  {
2328  ret = ImGui::Selectable("ITEM: Selectable");
2329  } // Testing selectable item
2330  if (item_type == 10)
2331  {
2332  ret = ImGui::MenuItem("ITEM: MenuItem");
2333  } // Testing menu item (they use ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnRelease button policy)
2334  if (item_type == 11)
2335  {
2336  ret = ImGui::TreeNode("ITEM: TreeNode"); if (ret) ImGui::TreePop();
2337  } // Testing tree node
2338  if (item_type == 12)
2339  {
2340  ret = ImGui::TreeNodeEx("ITEM: TreeNode w/ ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen);
2341  } // Testing tree node with ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDoubleClick button policy.
2342  if (item_type == 13)
2343  {
2344  const char *items[] = { "Apple", "Banana", "Cherry", "Kiwi" }; static int current = 1; ret = ImGui::Combo("ITEM: Combo", &current, items, IM_ARRAYSIZE(items));
2345  }
2346  if (item_type == 14)
2347  {
2348  const char *items[] = { "Apple", "Banana", "Cherry", "Kiwi" }; static int current = 1; ret = ImGui::ListBox("ITEM: ListBox", &current, items, IM_ARRAYSIZE(items), IM_ARRAYSIZE(items));
2349  }
2350 
2351 // Display the values of IsItemHovered() and other common item state functions.
2352 // Note that the ImGuiHoveredFlags_XXX flags can be combined.
2353 // Because BulletText is an item itself and that would affect the output of IsItemXXX functions,
2354 // we query every state in a single call to avoid storing them and to simplify the code.
2355  ImGui::BulletText(
2356  "Return value = %d\n"
2357  "IsItemFocused() = %d\n"
2358  "IsItemHovered() = %d\n"
2359  "IsItemHovered(_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup) = %d\n"
2360  "IsItemHovered(_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem) = %d\n"
2361  "IsItemHovered(_AllowWhenOverlapped) = %d\n"
2362  "IsItemHovered(_AllowWhenDisabled) = %d\n"
2363  "IsItemHovered(_RectOnly) = %d\n"
2364  "IsItemActive() = %d\n"
2365  "IsItemEdited() = %d\n"
2366  "IsItemActivated() = %d\n"
2367  "IsItemDeactivated() = %d\n"
2368  "IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit() = %d\n"
2369  "IsItemVisible() = %d\n"
2370  "IsItemClicked() = %d\n"
2371  "IsItemToggledOpen() = %d\n"
2372  "GetItemRectMin() = (%.1f, %.1f)\n"
2373  "GetItemRectMax() = (%.1f, %.1f)\n"
2374  "GetItemRectSize() = (%.1f, %.1f)",
2375  ret,
2376  ImGui::IsItemFocused(),
2377  ImGui::IsItemHovered(),
2378  ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup),
2379  ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem),
2380  ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped),
2381  ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenDisabled),
2382  ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_RectOnly),
2383  ImGui::IsItemActive(),
2384  ImGui::IsItemEdited(),
2385  ImGui::IsItemActivated(),
2386  ImGui::IsItemDeactivated(),
2387  ImGui::IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit(),
2388  ImGui::IsItemVisible(),
2389  ImGui::IsItemClicked(),
2390  ImGui::IsItemToggledOpen(),
2391  ImGui::GetItemRectMin().x, ImGui::GetItemRectMin().y,
2392  ImGui::GetItemRectMax().x, ImGui::GetItemRectMax().y,
2393  ImGui::GetItemRectSize().x, ImGui::GetItemRectSize().y
2394  );
2395 
2396  if (item_disabled)
2397  ImGui::EndDisabled();
2398 
2399  static bool embed_all_inside_a_child_window = false;
2400  ImGui::Checkbox("Embed everything inside a child window (for additional testing)", &embed_all_inside_a_child_window);
2401  if (embed_all_inside_a_child_window)
2402  ImGui::BeginChild("outer_child", ImVec2(0, ImGui::GetFontSize() * 20.0f), true);
2403 
2404  // Testing IsWindowFocused() function with its various flags.
2405  // Note that the ImGuiFocusedFlags_XXX flags can be combined.
2406  ImGui::BulletText(
2407  "IsWindowFocused() = %d\n"
2408  "IsWindowFocused(_ChildWindows) = %d\n"
2409  "IsWindowFocused(_ChildWindows|_RootWindow) = %d\n"
2410  "IsWindowFocused(_RootWindow) = %d\n"
2411  "IsWindowFocused(_AnyWindow) = %d\n",
2412  ImGui::IsWindowFocused(),
2413  ImGui::IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows),
2414  ImGui::IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows | ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow),
2415  ImGui::IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow),
2416  ImGui::IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_AnyWindow));
2417 
2418  // Testing IsWindowHovered() function with its various flags.
2419  // Note that the ImGuiHoveredFlags_XXX flags can be combined.
2420  ImGui::BulletText(
2421  "IsWindowHovered() = %d\n"
2422  "IsWindowHovered(_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup) = %d\n"
2423  "IsWindowHovered(_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem) = %d\n"
2424  "IsWindowHovered(_ChildWindows) = %d\n"
2425  "IsWindowHovered(_ChildWindows|_RootWindow) = %d\n"
2426  "IsWindowHovered(_ChildWindows|_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup) = %d\n"
2427  "IsWindowHovered(_RootWindow) = %d\n"
2428  "IsWindowHovered(_AnyWindow) = %d\n",
2429  ImGui::IsWindowHovered(),
2430  ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup),
2431  ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem),
2432  ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows),
2433  ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows | ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow),
2434  ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows | ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup),
2435  ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow),
2436  ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow));
2437 
2438  ImGui::BeginChild("child", ImVec2(0, 50), true);
2439  ImGui::Text("This is another child window for testing the _ChildWindows flag.");
2440  ImGui::EndChild();
2441  if (embed_all_inside_a_child_window)
2442  ImGui::EndChild();
2443 
2444  static char unused_str[] = "This widget is only here to be able to tab-out of the widgets above.";
2445  ImGui::InputText("unused", unused_str, IM_ARRAYSIZE(unused_str), ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly);
2446 
2447  // Calling IsItemHovered() after begin returns the hovered status of the title bar.
2448  // This is useful in particular if you want to create a context menu associated to the title bar of a window.
2449  static bool test_window = false;
2450  ImGui::Checkbox("Hovered/Active tests after Begin() for title bar testing", &test_window);
2451  if (test_window)
2452  {
2453  ImGui::Begin("Title bar Hovered/Active tests", &test_window);
2454  if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem()) // <-- This is using IsItemHovered()
2455  {
2456  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Close"))
2457  {
2458  test_window = false;
2459  }
2460  ImGui::EndPopup();
2461  }
2462  ImGui::Text(
2463  "IsItemHovered() after begin = %d (== is title bar hovered)\n"
2464  "IsItemActive() after begin = %d (== is window being clicked/moved)\n",
2465  ImGui::IsItemHovered(), ImGui::IsItemActive());
2466  ImGui::End();
2467  }
2468 
2469  ImGui::TreePop();
2470  }
2471 
2472  // Demonstrate BeginDisabled/EndDisabled using a checkbox located at the bottom of the section (which is a bit odd:
2473  // logically we'd have this checkbox at the top of the section, but we don't want this feature to steal that space)
2474  if (disable_all)
2475  ImGui::EndDisabled();
2476 
2477  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Disable block"))
2478  {
2479  ImGui::Checkbox("Disable entire section above", &disable_all);
2480  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Demonstrate using BeginDisabled()/EndDisabled() across this section.");
2481  ImGui::TreePop();
2482  }
2483 }
2484 
2485 static void ShowDemoWindowLayout()
2486 {
2487  if (!ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Layout & Scrolling"))
2488  return;
2489 
2490  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Child windows"))
2491  {
2492  HelpMarker("Use child windows to begin into a self-contained independent scrolling/clipping regions within a host window.");
2493  static bool disable_mouse_wheel = false;
2494  static bool disable_menu = false;
2495  ImGui::Checkbox("Disable Mouse Wheel", &disable_mouse_wheel);
2496  ImGui::Checkbox("Disable Menu", &disable_menu);
2497 
2498  // Child 1: no border, enable horizontal scrollbar
2499  {
2500  ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar;
2501  if (disable_mouse_wheel)
2502  window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse;
2503  ImGui::BeginChild("ChildL", ImVec2(ImGui::GetWindowContentRegionWidth() * 0.5f, 260), false, window_flags);
2504  for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++)
2505  ImGui::Text("%04d: scrollable region", i);
2506  ImGui::EndChild();
2507  }
2508 
2509  ImGui::SameLine();
2510 
2511  // Child 2: rounded border
2512  {
2513  ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_None;
2514  if (disable_mouse_wheel)
2515  window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse;
2516  if (!disable_menu)
2517  window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar;
2518  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding, 5.0f);
2519  ImGui::BeginChild("ChildR", ImVec2(0, 260), true, window_flags);
2520  if (!disable_menu && ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
2521  {
2522  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Menu"))
2523  {
2524  ShowExampleMenuFile();
2525  ImGui::EndMenu();
2526  }
2527  ImGui::EndMenuBar();
2528  }
2529  if (ImGui::BeginTable("split", 2, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_NoSavedSettings))
2530  {
2531  for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++)
2532  {
2533  char buf[32];
2534  sprintf(buf, "%03d", i);
2535  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
2536  ImGui::Button(buf, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f));
2537  }
2538  ImGui::EndTable();
2539  }
2540  ImGui::EndChild();
2541  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
2542  }
2543 
2544  ImGui::Separator();
2545 
2546  // Demonstrate a few extra things
2547  // - Changing ImGuiCol_ChildBg (which is transparent black in default styles)
2548  // - Using SetCursorPos() to position child window (the child window is an item from the POV of parent window)
2549  // You can also call SetNextWindowPos() to position the child window. The parent window will effectively
2550  // layout from this position.
2551  // - Using ImGui::GetItemRectMin/Max() to query the "item" state (because the child window is an item from
2552  // the POV of the parent window). See 'Demo->Querying Status (Edited/Active/Hovered etc.)' for details.
2553  {
2554  static int offset_x = 0;
2555  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 8);
2556  ImGui::DragInt("Offset X", &offset_x, 1.0f, -1000, 1000);
2557 
2558  ImGui::SetCursorPosX(ImGui::GetCursorPosX() + (float)offset_x);
2559  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ChildBg, IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 100));
2560  ImGui::BeginChild("Red", ImVec2(200, 100), true, ImGuiWindowFlags_None);
2561  for (int n = 0; n < 50; n++)
2562  ImGui::Text("Some test %d", n);
2563  ImGui::EndChild();
2564  bool child_is_hovered = ImGui::IsItemHovered();
2565  ImVec2 child_rect_min = ImGui::GetItemRectMin();
2566  ImVec2 child_rect_max = ImGui::GetItemRectMax();
2567  ImGui::PopStyleColor();
2568  ImGui::Text("Hovered: %d", child_is_hovered);
2569  ImGui::Text("Rect of child window is: (%.0f,%.0f) (%.0f,%.0f)", child_rect_min.x, child_rect_min.y, child_rect_max.x, child_rect_max.y);
2570  }
2571 
2572  ImGui::TreePop();
2573  }
2574 
2575  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Widgets Width"))
2576  {
2577  static float f = 0.0f;
2578  static bool show_indented_items = true;
2579  ImGui::Checkbox("Show indented items", &show_indented_items);
2580 
2581  // Use SetNextItemWidth() to set the width of a single upcoming item.
2582  // Use PushItemWidth()/PopItemWidth() to set the width of a group of items.
2583  // In real code use you'll probably want to choose width values that are proportional to your font size
2584  // e.g. Using '20.0f * GetFontSize()' as width instead of '200.0f', etc.
2585 
2586  ImGui::Text("SetNextItemWidth/PushItemWidth(100)");
2587  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Fixed width.");
2588  ImGui::PushItemWidth(100);
2589  ImGui::DragFloat("float##1b", &f);
2590  if (show_indented_items)
2591  {
2592  ImGui::Indent();
2593  ImGui::DragFloat("float (indented)##1b", &f);
2594  ImGui::Unindent();
2595  }
2596  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
2597 
2598  ImGui::Text("SetNextItemWidth/PushItemWidth(-100)");
2599  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Align to right edge minus 100");
2600  ImGui::PushItemWidth(-100);
2601  ImGui::DragFloat("float##2a", &f);
2602  if (show_indented_items)
2603  {
2604  ImGui::Indent();
2605  ImGui::DragFloat("float (indented)##2b", &f);
2606  ImGui::Unindent();
2607  }
2608  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
2609 
2610  ImGui::Text("SetNextItemWidth/PushItemWidth(GetContentRegionAvail().x * 0.5f)");
2611  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Half of available width.\n(~ right-cursor_pos)\n(works within a column set)");
2612  ImGui::PushItemWidth(ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x * 0.5f);
2613  ImGui::DragFloat("float##3a", &f);
2614  if (show_indented_items)
2615  {
2616  ImGui::Indent();
2617  ImGui::DragFloat("float (indented)##3b", &f);
2618  ImGui::Unindent();
2619  }
2620  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
2621 
2622  ImGui::Text("SetNextItemWidth/PushItemWidth(-GetContentRegionAvail().x * 0.5f)");
2623  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Align to right edge minus half");
2624  ImGui::PushItemWidth(-ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x * 0.5f);
2625  ImGui::DragFloat("float##4a", &f);
2626  if (show_indented_items)
2627  {
2628  ImGui::Indent();
2629  ImGui::DragFloat("float (indented)##4b", &f);
2630  ImGui::Unindent();
2631  }
2632  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
2633 
2634  // Demonstrate using PushItemWidth to surround three items.
2635  // Calling SetNextItemWidth() before each of them would have the same effect.
2636  ImGui::Text("SetNextItemWidth/PushItemWidth(-FLT_MIN)");
2637  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Align to right edge");
2638  ImGui::PushItemWidth(-FLT_MIN);
2639  ImGui::DragFloat("##float5a", &f);
2640  if (show_indented_items)
2641  {
2642  ImGui::Indent();
2643  ImGui::DragFloat("float (indented)##5b", &f);
2644  ImGui::Unindent();
2645  }
2646  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
2647 
2648  ImGui::TreePop();
2649  }
2650 
2651  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Basic Horizontal Layout"))
2652  {
2653  ImGui::TextWrapped("(Use ImGui::SameLine() to keep adding items to the right of the preceding item)");
2654 
2655  // Text
2656  ImGui::Text("Two items: Hello"); ImGui::SameLine();
2657  ImGui::TextColored(ImVec4(1, 1, 0, 1), "Sailor");
2658 
2659  // Adjust spacing
2660  ImGui::Text("More spacing: Hello"); ImGui::SameLine(0, 20);
2661  ImGui::TextColored(ImVec4(1, 1, 0, 1), "Sailor");
2662 
2663  // Button
2664  ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
2665  ImGui::Text("Normal buttons"); ImGui::SameLine();
2666  ImGui::Button("Banana"); ImGui::SameLine();
2667  ImGui::Button("Apple"); ImGui::SameLine();
2668  ImGui::Button("Corniflower");
2669 
2670  // Button
2671  ImGui::Text("Small buttons"); ImGui::SameLine();
2672  ImGui::SmallButton("Like this one"); ImGui::SameLine();
2673  ImGui::Text("can fit within a text block.");
2674 
2675  // Aligned to arbitrary position. Easy/cheap column.
2676  ImGui::Text("Aligned");
2677  ImGui::SameLine(150); ImGui::Text("x=150");
2678  ImGui::SameLine(300); ImGui::Text("x=300");
2679  ImGui::Text("Aligned");
2680  ImGui::SameLine(150); ImGui::SmallButton("x=150");
2681  ImGui::SameLine(300); ImGui::SmallButton("x=300");
2682 
2683  // Checkbox
2684  static bool c1 = false, c2 = false, c3 = false, c4 = false;
2685  ImGui::Checkbox("My", &c1); ImGui::SameLine();
2686  ImGui::Checkbox("Tailor", &c2); ImGui::SameLine();
2687  ImGui::Checkbox("Is", &c3); ImGui::SameLine();
2688  ImGui::Checkbox("Rich", &c4);
2689 
2690  // Various
2691  static float f0 = 1.0f, f1 = 2.0f, f2 = 3.0f;
2692  ImGui::PushItemWidth(80);
2693  const char *items[] = { "AAAA", "BBBB", "CCCC", "DDDD" };
2694  static int item = -1;
2695  ImGui::Combo("Combo", &item, items, IM_ARRAYSIZE(items)); ImGui::SameLine();
2696  ImGui::SliderFloat("X", &f0, 0.0f, 5.0f); ImGui::SameLine();
2697  ImGui::SliderFloat("Y", &f1, 0.0f, 5.0f); ImGui::SameLine();
2698  ImGui::SliderFloat("Z", &f2, 0.0f, 5.0f);
2699  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
2700 
2701  ImGui::PushItemWidth(80);
2702  ImGui::Text("Lists:");
2703  static int selection[4] = { 0, 1, 2, 3 };
2704  for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
2705  {
2706  if (i > 0) ImGui::SameLine();
2707  ImGui::PushID(i);
2708  ImGui::ListBox("", &selection[i], items, IM_ARRAYSIZE(items));
2709  ImGui::PopID();
2710  //if (ImGui::IsItemHovered()) ImGui::SetTooltip("ListBox %d hovered", i);
2711  }
2712  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
2713 
2714  // Dummy
2715  ImVec2 button_sz(40, 40);
2716  ImGui::Button("A", button_sz); ImGui::SameLine();
2717  ImGui::Dummy(button_sz); ImGui::SameLine();
2718  ImGui::Button("B", button_sz);
2719 
2720  // Manually wrapping
2721  // (we should eventually provide this as an automatic layout feature, but for now you can do it manually)
2722  ImGui::Text("Manually wrapping:");
2723  ImGuiStyle &style = ImGui::GetStyle();
2724  int buttons_count = 20;
2725  float window_visible_x2 = ImGui::GetWindowPos().x + ImGui::GetWindowContentRegionMax().x;
2726  for (int n = 0; n < buttons_count; n++)
2727  {
2728  ImGui::PushID(n);
2729  ImGui::Button("Box", button_sz);
2730  float last_button_x2 = ImGui::GetItemRectMax().x;
2731  float next_button_x2 = last_button_x2 + style.ItemSpacing.x + button_sz.x; // Expected position if next button was on same line
2732  if (n + 1 < buttons_count && next_button_x2 < window_visible_x2)
2733  ImGui::SameLine();
2734  ImGui::PopID();
2735  }
2736 
2737  ImGui::TreePop();
2738  }
2739 
2740  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Groups"))
2741  {
2742  HelpMarker(
2743  "BeginGroup() basically locks the horizontal position for new line. "
2744  "EndGroup() bundles the whole group so that you can use \"item\" functions such as "
2745  "IsItemHovered()/IsItemActive() or SameLine() etc. on the whole group.");
2746  ImGui::BeginGroup();
2747  {
2748  ImGui::BeginGroup();
2749  ImGui::Button("AAA");
2750  ImGui::SameLine();
2751  ImGui::Button("BBB");
2752  ImGui::SameLine();
2753  ImGui::BeginGroup();
2754  ImGui::Button("CCC");
2755  ImGui::Button("DDD");
2756  ImGui::EndGroup();
2757  ImGui::SameLine();
2758  ImGui::Button("EEE");
2759  ImGui::EndGroup();
2760  if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())
2761  ImGui::SetTooltip("First group hovered");
2762  }
2763  // Capture the group size and create widgets using the same size
2764  ImVec2 size = ImGui::GetItemRectSize();
2765  const float values[5] = { 0.5f, 0.20f, 0.80f, 0.60f, 0.25f };
2766  ImGui::PlotHistogram("##values", values, IM_ARRAYSIZE(values), 0, NULL, 0.0f, 1.0f, size);
2767 
2768  ImGui::Button("ACTION", ImVec2((size.x - ImGui::GetStyle().ItemSpacing.x) * 0.5f, size.y));
2769  ImGui::SameLine();
2770  ImGui::Button("REACTION", ImVec2((size.x - ImGui::GetStyle().ItemSpacing.x) * 0.5f, size.y));
2771  ImGui::EndGroup();
2772  ImGui::SameLine();
2773 
2774  ImGui::Button("LEVERAGE\nBUZZWORD", size);
2775  ImGui::SameLine();
2776 
2777  if (ImGui::BeginListBox("List", size))
2778  {
2779  ImGui::Selectable("Selected", true);
2780  ImGui::Selectable("Not Selected", false);
2781  ImGui::EndListBox();
2782  }
2783 
2784  ImGui::TreePop();
2785  }
2786 
2787  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Text Baseline Alignment"))
2788  {
2789  {
2790  ImGui::BulletText("Text baseline:");
2791  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
2792  "This is testing the vertical alignment that gets applied on text to keep it aligned with widgets. "
2793  "Lines only composed of text or \"small\" widgets use less vertical space than lines with framed widgets.");
2794  ImGui::Indent();
2795 
2796  ImGui::Text("KO Blahblah"); ImGui::SameLine();
2797  ImGui::Button("Some framed item"); ImGui::SameLine();
2798  HelpMarker("Baseline of button will look misaligned with text..");
2799 
2800  // If your line starts with text, call AlignTextToFramePadding() to align text to upcoming widgets.
2801  // (because we don't know what's coming after the Text() statement, we need to move the text baseline
2802  // down by FramePadding.y ahead of time)
2803  ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
2804  ImGui::Text("OK Blahblah"); ImGui::SameLine();
2805  ImGui::Button("Some framed item"); ImGui::SameLine();
2806  HelpMarker("We call AlignTextToFramePadding() to vertically align the text baseline by +FramePadding.y");
2807 
2808  // SmallButton() uses the same vertical padding as Text
2809  ImGui::Button("TEST##1"); ImGui::SameLine();
2810  ImGui::Text("TEST"); ImGui::SameLine();
2811  ImGui::SmallButton("TEST##2");
2812 
2813  // If your line starts with text, call AlignTextToFramePadding() to align text to upcoming widgets.
2814  ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
2815  ImGui::Text("Text aligned to framed item"); ImGui::SameLine();
2816  ImGui::Button("Item##1"); ImGui::SameLine();
2817  ImGui::Text("Item"); ImGui::SameLine();
2818  ImGui::SmallButton("Item##2"); ImGui::SameLine();
2819  ImGui::Button("Item##3");
2820 
2821  ImGui::Unindent();
2822  }
2823 
2824  ImGui::Spacing();
2825 
2826  {
2827  ImGui::BulletText("Multi-line text:");
2828  ImGui::Indent();
2829  ImGui::Text("One\nTwo\nThree"); ImGui::SameLine();
2830  ImGui::Text("Hello\nWorld"); ImGui::SameLine();
2831  ImGui::Text("Banana");
2832 
2833  ImGui::Text("Banana"); ImGui::SameLine();
2834  ImGui::Text("Hello\nWorld"); ImGui::SameLine();
2835  ImGui::Text("One\nTwo\nThree");
2836 
2837  ImGui::Button("HOP##1"); ImGui::SameLine();
2838  ImGui::Text("Banana"); ImGui::SameLine();
2839  ImGui::Text("Hello\nWorld"); ImGui::SameLine();
2840  ImGui::Text("Banana");
2841 
2842  ImGui::Button("HOP##2"); ImGui::SameLine();
2843  ImGui::Text("Hello\nWorld"); ImGui::SameLine();
2844  ImGui::Text("Banana");
2845  ImGui::Unindent();
2846  }
2847 
2848  ImGui::Spacing();
2849 
2850  {
2851  ImGui::BulletText("Misc items:");
2852  ImGui::Indent();
2853 
2854  // SmallButton() sets FramePadding to zero. Text baseline is aligned to match baseline of previous Button.
2855  ImGui::Button("80x80", ImVec2(80, 80));
2856  ImGui::SameLine();
2857  ImGui::Button("50x50", ImVec2(50, 50));
2858  ImGui::SameLine();
2859  ImGui::Button("Button()");
2860  ImGui::SameLine();
2861  ImGui::SmallButton("SmallButton()");
2862 
2863  // Tree
2864  const float spacing = ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x;
2865  ImGui::Button("Button##1");
2866  ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, spacing);
2867  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Node##1"))
2868  {
2869  // Placeholder tree data
2870  for (int i = 0; i < 6; i++)
2871  ImGui::BulletText("Item %d..", i);
2872  ImGui::TreePop();
2873  }
2874 
2875  // Vertically align text node a bit lower so it'll be vertically centered with upcoming widget.
2876  // Otherwise you can use SmallButton() (smaller fit).
2877  ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
2878 
2879  // Common mistake to avoid: if we want to SameLine after TreeNode we need to do it before we add
2880  // other contents below the node.
2881  bool node_open = ImGui::TreeNode("Node##2");
2882  ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, spacing); ImGui::Button("Button##2");
2883  if (node_open)
2884  {
2885  // Placeholder tree data
2886  for (int i = 0; i < 6; i++)
2887  ImGui::BulletText("Item %d..", i);
2888  ImGui::TreePop();
2889  }
2890 
2891  // Bullet
2892  ImGui::Button("Button##3");
2893  ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, spacing);
2894  ImGui::BulletText("Bullet text");
2895 
2896  ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
2897  ImGui::BulletText("Node");
2898  ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, spacing); ImGui::Button("Button##4");
2899  ImGui::Unindent();
2900  }
2901 
2902  ImGui::TreePop();
2903  }
2904 
2905  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Scrolling"))
2906  {
2907  // Vertical scroll functions
2908  HelpMarker("Use SetScrollHereY() or SetScrollFromPosY() to scroll to a given vertical position.");
2909 
2910  static int track_item = 50;
2911  static bool enable_track = true;
2912  static bool enable_extra_decorations = false;
2913  static float scroll_to_off_px = 0.0f;
2914  static float scroll_to_pos_px = 200.0f;
2915 
2916  ImGui::Checkbox("Decoration", &enable_extra_decorations);
2917 
2918  ImGui::Checkbox("Track", &enable_track);
2919  ImGui::PushItemWidth(100);
2920  ImGui::SameLine(140); enable_track |= ImGui::DragInt("##item", &track_item, 0.25f, 0, 99, "Item = %d");
2921 
2922  bool scroll_to_off = ImGui::Button("Scroll Offset");
2923  ImGui::SameLine(140); scroll_to_off |= ImGui::DragFloat("##off", &scroll_to_off_px, 1.00f, 0, FLT_MAX, "+%.0f px");
2924 
2925  bool scroll_to_pos = ImGui::Button("Scroll To Pos");
2926  ImGui::SameLine(140); scroll_to_pos |= ImGui::DragFloat("##pos", &scroll_to_pos_px, 1.00f, -10, FLT_MAX, "X/Y = %.0f px");
2927  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
2928 
2929  if (scroll_to_off || scroll_to_pos)
2930  enable_track = false;
2931 
2932  ImGuiStyle &style = ImGui::GetStyle();
2933  float child_w = (ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x - 4 * style.ItemSpacing.x) / 5;
2934  if (child_w < 1.0f)
2935  child_w = 1.0f;
2936  ImGui::PushID("##VerticalScrolling");
2937  for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++)
2938  {
2939  if (i > 0) ImGui::SameLine();
2940  ImGui::BeginGroup();
2941  const char *names[] = { "Top", "25%", "Center", "75%", "Bottom" };
2942  ImGui::TextUnformatted(names[i]);
2943 
2944  const ImGuiWindowFlags child_flags = enable_extra_decorations ? ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar : 0;
2945  const ImGuiID child_id = ImGui::GetID((void *)(intptr_t)i);
2946  const bool child_is_visible = ImGui::BeginChild(child_id, ImVec2(child_w, 200.0f), true, child_flags);
2947  if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
2948  {
2949  ImGui::TextUnformatted("abc");
2950  ImGui::EndMenuBar();
2951  }
2952  if (scroll_to_off)
2953  ImGui::SetScrollY(scroll_to_off_px);
2954  if (scroll_to_pos)
2955  ImGui::SetScrollFromPosY(ImGui::GetCursorStartPos().y + scroll_to_pos_px, i * 0.25f);
2956  if (child_is_visible) // Avoid calling SetScrollHereY when running with culled items
2957  {
2958  for (int item = 0; item < 100; item++)
2959  {
2960  if (enable_track && item == track_item)
2961  {
2962  ImGui::TextColored(ImVec4(1, 1, 0, 1), "Item %d", item);
2963  ImGui::SetScrollHereY(i * 0.25f); // 0.0f:top, 0.5f:center, 1.0f:bottom
2964  }
2965  else
2966  {
2967  ImGui::Text("Item %d", item);
2968  }
2969  }
2970  }
2971  float scroll_y = ImGui::GetScrollY();
2972  float scroll_max_y = ImGui::GetScrollMaxY();
2973  ImGui::EndChild();
2974  ImGui::Text("%.0f/%.0f", scroll_y, scroll_max_y);
2975  ImGui::EndGroup();
2976  }
2977  ImGui::PopID();
2978 
2979  // Horizontal scroll functions
2980  ImGui::Spacing();
2981  HelpMarker(
2982  "Use SetScrollHereX() or SetScrollFromPosX() to scroll to a given horizontal position.\n\n"
2983  "Because the clipping rectangle of most window hides half worth of WindowPadding on the "
2984  "left/right, using SetScrollFromPosX(+1) will usually result in clipped text whereas the "
2985  "equivalent SetScrollFromPosY(+1) wouldn't.");
2986  ImGui::PushID("##HorizontalScrolling");
2987  for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++)
2988  {
2989  float child_height = ImGui::GetTextLineHeight() + style.ScrollbarSize + style.WindowPadding.y * 2.0f;
2990  ImGuiWindowFlags child_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar | (enable_extra_decorations ? ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar : 0);
2991  ImGuiID child_id = ImGui::GetID((void *)(intptr_t)i);
2992  bool child_is_visible = ImGui::BeginChild(child_id, ImVec2(-100, child_height), true, child_flags);
2993  if (scroll_to_off)
2994  ImGui::SetScrollX(scroll_to_off_px);
2995  if (scroll_to_pos)
2996  ImGui::SetScrollFromPosX(ImGui::GetCursorStartPos().x + scroll_to_pos_px, i * 0.25f);
2997  if (child_is_visible) // Avoid calling SetScrollHereY when running with culled items
2998  {
2999  for (int item = 0; item < 100; item++)
3000  {
3001  if (item > 0)
3002  ImGui::SameLine();
3003  if (enable_track && item == track_item)
3004  {
3005  ImGui::TextColored(ImVec4(1, 1, 0, 1), "Item %d", item);
3006  ImGui::SetScrollHereX(i * 0.25f); // 0.0f:left, 0.5f:center, 1.0f:right
3007  }
3008  else
3009  {
3010  ImGui::Text("Item %d", item);
3011  }
3012  }
3013  }
3014  float scroll_x = ImGui::GetScrollX();
3015  float scroll_max_x = ImGui::GetScrollMaxX();
3016  ImGui::EndChild();
3017  ImGui::SameLine();
3018  const char *names[] = { "Left", "25%", "Center", "75%", "Right" };
3019  ImGui::Text("%s\n%.0f/%.0f", names[i], scroll_x, scroll_max_x);
3020  ImGui::Spacing();
3021  }
3022  ImGui::PopID();
3023 
3024  // Miscellaneous Horizontal Scrolling Demo
3025  HelpMarker(
3026  "Horizontal scrolling for a window is enabled via the ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar flag.\n\n"
3027  "You may want to also explicitly specify content width by using SetNextWindowContentWidth() before Begin().");
3028  static int lines = 7;
3029  ImGui::SliderInt("Lines", &lines, 1, 15);
3030  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FrameRounding, 3.0f);
3031  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(2.0f, 1.0f));
3032  ImVec2 scrolling_child_size = ImVec2(0, ImGui::GetFrameHeightWithSpacing() * 7 + 30);
3033  ImGui::BeginChild("scrolling", scrolling_child_size, true, ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar);
3034  for (int line = 0; line < lines; line++)
3035  {
3036  // Display random stuff. For the sake of this trivial demo we are using basic Button() + SameLine()
3037  // If you want to create your own time line for a real application you may be better off manipulating
3038  // the cursor position yourself, aka using SetCursorPos/SetCursorScreenPos to position the widgets
3039  // yourself. You may also want to use the lower-level ImDrawList API.
3040  int num_buttons = 10 + ((line & 1) ? line * 9 : line * 3);
3041  for (int n = 0; n < num_buttons; n++)
3042  {
3043  if (n > 0) ImGui::SameLine();
3044  ImGui::PushID(n + line * 1000);
3045  char num_buf[16];
3046  sprintf(num_buf, "%d", n);
3047  const char *label = (!(n % 15)) ? "FizzBuzz" : (!(n % 3)) ? "Fizz" : (!(n % 5)) ? "Buzz" : num_buf;
3048  float hue = n * 0.05f;
3049  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Button, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(hue, 0.6f, 0.6f));
3050  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(hue, 0.7f, 0.7f));
3051  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ButtonActive, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(hue, 0.8f, 0.8f));
3052  ImGui::Button(label, ImVec2(40.0f + sinf((float)(line + n)) * 20.0f, 0.0f));
3053  ImGui::PopStyleColor(3);
3054  ImGui::PopID();
3055  }
3056  }
3057  float scroll_x = ImGui::GetScrollX();
3058  float scroll_max_x = ImGui::GetScrollMaxX();
3059  ImGui::EndChild();
3060  ImGui::PopStyleVar(2);
3061  float scroll_x_delta = 0.0f;
3062  ImGui::SmallButton("<<");
3063  if (ImGui::IsItemActive())
3064  scroll_x_delta = -ImGui::GetIO().Time * 1000.0f;
3065  ImGui::SameLine();
3066  ImGui::Text("Scroll from code"); ImGui::SameLine();
3067  ImGui::SmallButton(">>");
3068  if (ImGui::IsItemActive())
3069  scroll_x_delta = +ImGui::GetIO().Time * 1000.0f;
3070  ImGui::SameLine();
3071  ImGui::Text("%.0f/%.0f", scroll_x, scroll_max_x);
3072  if (scroll_x_delta != 0.0f)
3073  {
3074  // Demonstrate a trick: you can use Begin to set yourself in the context of another window
3075  // (here we are already out of your child window)
3076  ImGui::BeginChild("scrolling");
3077  ImGui::SetScrollX(ImGui::GetScrollX() + scroll_x_delta);
3078  ImGui::EndChild();
3079  }
3080  ImGui::Spacing();
3081 
3082  static bool show_horizontal_contents_size_demo_window = false;
3083  ImGui::Checkbox("Show Horizontal contents size demo window", &show_horizontal_contents_size_demo_window);
3084 
3085  if (show_horizontal_contents_size_demo_window)
3086  {
3087  static bool show_h_scrollbar = true;
3088  static bool show_button = true;
3089  static bool show_tree_nodes = true;
3090  static bool show_text_wrapped = false;
3091  static bool show_columns = true;
3092  static bool show_tab_bar = true;
3093  static bool show_child = false;
3094  static bool explicit_content_size = false;
3095  static float contents_size_x = 300.0f;
3096  if (explicit_content_size)
3097  ImGui::SetNextWindowContentSize(ImVec2(contents_size_x, 0.0f));
3098  ImGui::Begin("Horizontal contents size demo window", &show_horizontal_contents_size_demo_window, show_h_scrollbar ? ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar : 0);
3099  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(2, 0));
3100  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(2, 0));
3101  HelpMarker("Test of different widgets react and impact the work rectangle growing when horizontal scrolling is enabled.\n\nUse 'Metrics->Tools->Show windows rectangles' to visualize rectangles.");
3102  ImGui::Checkbox("H-scrollbar", &show_h_scrollbar);
3103  ImGui::Checkbox("Button", &show_button); // Will grow contents size (unless explicitly overwritten)
3104  ImGui::Checkbox("Tree nodes", &show_tree_nodes); // Will grow contents size and display highlight over full width
3105  ImGui::Checkbox("Text wrapped", &show_text_wrapped);// Will grow and use contents size
3106  ImGui::Checkbox("Columns", &show_columns); // Will use contents size
3107  ImGui::Checkbox("Tab bar", &show_tab_bar); // Will use contents size
3108  ImGui::Checkbox("Child", &show_child); // Will grow and use contents size
3109  ImGui::Checkbox("Explicit content size", &explicit_content_size);
3110  ImGui::Text("Scroll %.1f/%.1f %.1f/%.1f", ImGui::GetScrollX(), ImGui::GetScrollMaxX(), ImGui::GetScrollY(), ImGui::GetScrollMaxY());
3111  if (explicit_content_size)
3112  {
3113  ImGui::SameLine();
3114  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(100);
3115  ImGui::DragFloat("##csx", &contents_size_x);
3116  ImVec2 p = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
3117  ImGui::GetWindowDrawList()->AddRectFilled(p, ImVec2(p.x + 10, p.y + 10), IM_COL32_WHITE);
3118  ImGui::GetWindowDrawList()->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(p.x + contents_size_x - 10, p.y), ImVec2(p.x + contents_size_x, p.y + 10), IM_COL32_WHITE);
3119  ImGui::Dummy(ImVec2(0, 10));
3120  }
3121  ImGui::PopStyleVar(2);
3122  ImGui::Separator();
3123  if (show_button)
3124  {
3125  ImGui::Button("this is a 300-wide button", ImVec2(300, 0));
3126  }
3127  if (show_tree_nodes)
3128  {
3129  bool open = true;
3130  if (ImGui::TreeNode("this is a tree node"))
3131  {
3132  if (ImGui::TreeNode("another one of those tree node..."))
3133  {
3134  ImGui::Text("Some tree contents");
3135  ImGui::TreePop();
3136  }
3137  ImGui::TreePop();
3138  }
3139  ImGui::CollapsingHeader("CollapsingHeader", &open);
3140  }
3141  if (show_text_wrapped)
3142  {
3143  ImGui::TextWrapped("This text should automatically wrap on the edge of the work rectangle.");
3144  }
3145  if (show_columns)
3146  {
3147  ImGui::Text("Tables:");
3148  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table", 4, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders))
3149  {
3150  for (int n = 0; n < 4; n++)
3151  {
3152  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
3153  ImGui::Text("Width %.2f", ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x);
3154  }
3155  ImGui::EndTable();
3156  }
3157  ImGui::Text("Columns:");
3158  ImGui::Columns(4);
3159  for (int n = 0; n < 4; n++)
3160  {
3161  ImGui::Text("Width %.2f", ImGui::GetColumnWidth());
3162  ImGui::NextColumn();
3163  }
3164  ImGui::Columns(1);
3165  }
3166  if (show_tab_bar && ImGui::BeginTabBar("Hello"))
3167  {
3168  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("OneOneOne"))
3169  {
3170  ImGui::EndTabItem();
3171  }
3172  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("TwoTwoTwo"))
3173  {
3174  ImGui::EndTabItem();
3175  }
3176  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("ThreeThreeThree"))
3177  {
3178  ImGui::EndTabItem();
3179  }
3180  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("FourFourFour"))
3181  {
3182  ImGui::EndTabItem();
3183  }
3184  ImGui::EndTabBar();
3185  }
3186  if (show_child)
3187  {
3188  ImGui::BeginChild("child", ImVec2(0, 0), true);
3189  ImGui::EndChild();
3190  }
3191  ImGui::End();
3192  }
3193 
3194  ImGui::TreePop();
3195  }
3196 
3197  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Clipping"))
3198  {
3199  static ImVec2 size(100.0f, 100.0f);
3200  static ImVec2 offset(30.0f, 30.0f);
3201  ImGui::DragFloat2("size", (float *)&size, 0.5f, 1.0f, 200.0f, "%.0f");
3202  ImGui::TextWrapped("(Click and drag to scroll)");
3203 
3204  for (int n = 0; n < 3; n++)
3205  {
3206  if (n > 0)
3207  ImGui::SameLine();
3208  ImGui::PushID(n);
3209  ImGui::BeginGroup(); // Lock X position
3210 
3211  ImGui::InvisibleButton("##empty", size);
3212  if (ImGui::IsItemActive() && ImGui::IsMouseDragging(ImGuiMouseButton_Left))
3213  {
3214  offset.x += ImGui::GetIO().MouseDelta.x;
3215  offset.y += ImGui::GetIO().MouseDelta.y;
3216  }
3217  const ImVec2 p0 = ImGui::GetItemRectMin();
3218  const ImVec2 p1 = ImGui::GetItemRectMax();
3219  const char *text_str = "Line 1 hello\nLine 2 clip me!";
3220  const ImVec2 text_pos = ImVec2(p0.x + offset.x, p0.y + offset.y);
3221  ImDrawList *draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
3222 
3223  switch (n)
3224  {
3225  case 0:
3226  HelpMarker(
3227  "Using ImGui::PushClipRect():\n"
3228  "Will alter ImGui hit-testing logic + ImDrawList rendering.\n"
3229  "(use this if you want your clipping rectangle to affect interactions)");
3230  ImGui::PushClipRect(p0, p1, true);
3231  draw_list->AddRectFilled(p0, p1, IM_COL32(90, 90, 120, 255));
3232  draw_list->AddText(text_pos, IM_COL32_WHITE, text_str);
3233  ImGui::PopClipRect();
3234  break;
3235  case 1:
3236  HelpMarker(
3237  "Using ImDrawList::PushClipRect():\n"
3238  "Will alter ImDrawList rendering only.\n"
3239  "(use this as a shortcut if you are only using ImDrawList calls)");
3240  draw_list->PushClipRect(p0, p1, true);
3241  draw_list->AddRectFilled(p0, p1, IM_COL32(90, 90, 120, 255));
3242  draw_list->AddText(text_pos, IM_COL32_WHITE, text_str);
3243  draw_list->PopClipRect();
3244  break;
3245  case 2:
3246  HelpMarker(
3247  "Using ImDrawList::AddText() with a fine ClipRect:\n"
3248  "Will alter only this specific ImDrawList::AddText() rendering.\n"
3249  "(this is often used internally to avoid altering the clipping rectangle and minimize draw calls)");
3250  ImVec4 clip_rect(p0.x, p0.y, p1.x, p1.y); // AddText() takes a ImVec4* here so let's convert.
3251  draw_list->AddRectFilled(p0, p1, IM_COL32(90, 90, 120, 255));
3252  draw_list->AddText(ImGui::GetFont(), ImGui::GetFontSize(), text_pos, IM_COL32_WHITE, text_str, NULL, 0.0f, &clip_rect);
3253  break;
3254  }
3255  ImGui::EndGroup();
3256  ImGui::PopID();
3257  }
3258 
3259  ImGui::TreePop();
3260  }
3261 }
3262 
3263 static void ShowDemoWindowPopups()
3264 {
3265  if (!ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Popups & Modal windows"))
3266  return;
3267 
3268  // The properties of popups windows are:
3269  // - They block normal mouse hovering detection outside them. (*)
3270  // - Unless modal, they can be closed by clicking anywhere outside them, or by pressing ESCAPE.
3271  // - Their visibility state (~bool) is held internally by Dear ImGui instead of being held by the programmer as
3272  // we are used to with regular Begin() calls. User can manipulate the visibility state by calling OpenPopup().
3273  // (*) One can use IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup) to bypass it and detect hovering even
3274  // when normally blocked by a popup.
3275  // Those three properties are connected. The library needs to hold their visibility state BECAUSE it can close
3276  // popups at any time.
3277 
3278  // Typical use for regular windows:
3279  // bool my_tool_is_active = false; if (ImGui::Button("Open")) my_tool_is_active = true; [...] if (my_tool_is_active) Begin("My Tool", &my_tool_is_active) { [...] } End();
3280  // Typical use for popups:
3281  // if (ImGui::Button("Open")) ImGui::OpenPopup("MyPopup"); if (ImGui::BeginPopup("MyPopup") { [...] EndPopup(); }
3282 
3283  // With popups we have to go through a library call (here OpenPopup) to manipulate the visibility state.
3284  // This may be a bit confusing at first but it should quickly make sense. Follow on the examples below.
3285 
3286  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Popups"))
3287  {
3288  ImGui::TextWrapped(
3289  "When a popup is active, it inhibits interacting with windows that are behind the popup. "
3290  "Clicking outside the popup closes it.");
3291 
3292  static int selected_fish = -1;
3293  const char *names[] = { "Bream", "Haddock", "Mackerel", "Pollock", "Tilefish" };
3294  static bool toggles[] = { true, false, false, false, false };
3295 
3296  // Simple selection popup (if you want to show the current selection inside the Button itself,
3297  // you may want to build a string using the "###" operator to preserve a constant ID with a variable label)
3298  if (ImGui::Button("Select.."))
3299  ImGui::OpenPopup("my_select_popup");
3300  ImGui::SameLine();
3301  ImGui::TextUnformatted(selected_fish == -1 ? "<None>" : names[selected_fish]);
3302  if (ImGui::BeginPopup("my_select_popup"))
3303  {
3304  ImGui::Text("Aquarium");
3305  ImGui::Separator();
3306  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(names); i++)
3307  if (ImGui::Selectable(names[i]))
3308  selected_fish = i;
3309  ImGui::EndPopup();
3310  }
3311 
3312  // Showing a menu with toggles
3313  if (ImGui::Button("Toggle.."))
3314  ImGui::OpenPopup("my_toggle_popup");
3315  if (ImGui::BeginPopup("my_toggle_popup"))
3316  {
3317  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(names); i++)
3318  ImGui::MenuItem(names[i], "", &toggles[i]);
3319  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Sub-menu"))
3320  {
3321  ImGui::MenuItem("Click me");
3322  ImGui::EndMenu();
3323  }
3324 
3325  ImGui::Separator();
3326  ImGui::Text("Tooltip here");
3327  if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())
3328  ImGui::SetTooltip("I am a tooltip over a popup");
3329 
3330  if (ImGui::Button("Stacked Popup"))
3331  ImGui::OpenPopup("another popup");
3332  if (ImGui::BeginPopup("another popup"))
3333  {
3334  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(names); i++)
3335  ImGui::MenuItem(names[i], "", &toggles[i]);
3336  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Sub-menu"))
3337  {
3338  ImGui::MenuItem("Click me");
3339  if (ImGui::Button("Stacked Popup"))
3340  ImGui::OpenPopup("another popup");
3341  if (ImGui::BeginPopup("another popup"))
3342  {
3343  ImGui::Text("I am the last one here.");
3344  ImGui::EndPopup();
3345  }
3346  ImGui::EndMenu();
3347  }
3348  ImGui::EndPopup();
3349  }
3350  ImGui::EndPopup();
3351  }
3352 
3353  // Call the more complete ShowExampleMenuFile which we use in various places of this demo
3354  if (ImGui::Button("File Menu.."))
3355  ImGui::OpenPopup("my_file_popup");
3356  if (ImGui::BeginPopup("my_file_popup"))
3357  {
3358  ShowExampleMenuFile();
3359  ImGui::EndPopup();
3360  }
3361 
3362  ImGui::TreePop();
3363  }
3364 
3365  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Context menus"))
3366  {
3367  HelpMarker("\"Context\" functions are simple helpers to associate a Popup to a given Item or Window identifier.");
3368 
3369  // BeginPopupContextItem() is a helper to provide common/simple popup behavior of essentially doing:
3370  // if (id == 0)
3371  // id = GetItemID(); // Use last item id
3372  // if (IsItemHovered() && IsMouseReleased(ImGuiMouseButton_Right))
3373  // OpenPopup(id);
3374  // return BeginPopup(id);
3375  // For advanced advanced uses you may want to replicate and customize this code.
3376  // See more details in BeginPopupContextItem().
3377 
3378  // Example 1
3379  // When used after an item that has an ID (e.g. Button), we can skip providing an ID to BeginPopupContextItem(),
3380  // and BeginPopupContextItem() will use the last item ID as the popup ID.
3381  {
3382  const char *names[5] = { "Label1", "Label2", "Label3", "Label4", "Label5" };
3383  for (int n = 0; n < 5; n++)
3384  {
3385  ImGui::Selectable(names[n]);
3386  if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem()) // <-- use last item id as popup id
3387  {
3388  ImGui::Text("This a popup for \"%s\"!", names[n]);
3389  if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
3390  ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
3391  ImGui::EndPopup();
3392  }
3393  if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())
3394  ImGui::SetTooltip("Right-click to open popup");
3395  }
3396  }
3397 
3398  // Example 2
3399  // Popup on a Text() element which doesn't have an identifier: we need to provide an identifier to BeginPopupContextItem().
3400  // Using an explicit identifier is also convenient if you want to activate the popups from different locations.
3401  {
3402  HelpMarker("Text() elements don't have stable identifiers so we need to provide one.");
3403  static float value = 0.5f;
3404  ImGui::Text("Value = %.3f <-- (1) right-click this value", value);
3405  if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem("my popup"))
3406  {
3407  if (ImGui::Selectable("Set to zero")) value = 0.0f;
3408  if (ImGui::Selectable("Set to PI")) value = 3.1415f;
3409  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN);
3410  ImGui::DragFloat("##Value", &value, 0.1f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
3411  ImGui::EndPopup();
3412  }
3413 
3414  // We can also use OpenPopupOnItemClick() to toggle the visibility of a given popup.
3415  // Here we make it that right-clicking this other text element opens the same popup as above.
3416  // The popup itself will be submitted by the code above.
3417  ImGui::Text("(2) Or right-click this text");
3418  ImGui::OpenPopupOnItemClick("my popup", ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight);
3419 
3420  // Back to square one: manually open the same popup.
3421  if (ImGui::Button("(3) Or click this button"))
3422  ImGui::OpenPopup("my popup");
3423  }
3424 
3425  // Example 3
3426  // When using BeginPopupContextItem() with an implicit identifier (NULL == use last item ID),
3427  // we need to make sure your item identifier is stable.
3428  // In this example we showcase altering the item label while preserving its identifier, using the ### operator (see FAQ).
3429  {
3430  HelpMarker("Showcase using a popup ID linked to item ID, with the item having a changing label + stable ID using the ### operator.");
3431  static char name[32] = "Label1";
3432  char buf[64];
3433  sprintf(buf, "Button: %s###Button", name); // ### operator override ID ignoring the preceding label
3434  ImGui::Button(buf);
3435  if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem())
3436  {
3437  ImGui::Text("Edit name:");
3438  ImGui::InputText("##edit", name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name));
3439  if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
3440  ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
3441  ImGui::EndPopup();
3442  }
3443  ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("(<-- right-click here)");
3444  }
3445 
3446  ImGui::TreePop();
3447  }
3448 
3449  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Modals"))
3450  {
3451  ImGui::TextWrapped("Modal windows are like popups but the user cannot close them by clicking outside.");
3452 
3453  if (ImGui::Button("Delete.."))
3454  ImGui::OpenPopup("Delete?");
3455 
3456  // Always center this window when appearing
3457  ImVec2 center = ImGui::GetMainViewport()->GetCenter();
3458  ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(center, ImGuiCond_Appearing, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
3459 
3460  if (ImGui::BeginPopupModal("Delete?", NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
3461  {
3462  ImGui::Text("All those beautiful files will be deleted.\nThis operation cannot be undone!\n\n");
3463  ImGui::Separator();
3464 
3465  //static int unused_i = 0;
3466  //ImGui::Combo("Combo", &unused_i, "Delete\0Delete harder\0");
3467 
3468  static bool dont_ask_me_next_time = false;
3469  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(0, 0));
3470  ImGui::Checkbox("Don't ask me next time", &dont_ask_me_next_time);
3471  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
3472 
3473  if (ImGui::Button("OK", ImVec2(120, 0)))
3474  {
3475  ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
3476  }
3477  ImGui::SetItemDefaultFocus();
3478  ImGui::SameLine();
3479  if (ImGui::Button("Cancel", ImVec2(120, 0)))
3480  {
3481  ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
3482  }
3483  ImGui::EndPopup();
3484  }
3485 
3486  if (ImGui::Button("Stacked modals.."))
3487  ImGui::OpenPopup("Stacked 1");
3488  if (ImGui::BeginPopupModal("Stacked 1", NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar))
3489  {
3490  if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
3491  {
3492  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("File"))
3493  {
3494  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Some menu item"))
3495  {
3496  }
3497  ImGui::EndMenu();
3498  }
3499  ImGui::EndMenuBar();
3500  }
3501  ImGui::Text("Hello from Stacked The First\nUsing style.Colors[ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg] behind it.");
3502 
3503  // Testing behavior of widgets stacking their own regular popups over the modal.
3504  static int item = 1;
3505  static float color[4] = { 0.4f, 0.7f, 0.0f, 0.5f };
3506  ImGui::Combo("Combo", &item, "aaaa\0bbbb\0cccc\0dddd\0eeee\0\0");
3507  ImGui::ColorEdit4("color", color);
3508
