3509  if (ImGui::Button("Add another modal.."))
3510  ImGui::OpenPopup("Stacked 2");
3511 
3512  // Also demonstrate passing a bool* to BeginPopupModal(), this will create a regular close button which
3513  // will close the popup. Note that the visibility state of popups is owned by imgui, so the input value
3514  // of the bool actually doesn't matter here.
3515  bool unused_open = true;
3516  if (ImGui::BeginPopupModal("Stacked 2", &unused_open))
3517  {
3518  ImGui::Text("Hello from Stacked The Second!");
3519  if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
3520  ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
3521  ImGui::EndPopup();
3522  }
3523 
3524  if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
3525  ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
3526  ImGui::EndPopup();
3527  }
3528 
3529  ImGui::TreePop();
3530  }
3531 
3532  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Menus inside a regular window"))
3533  {
3534  ImGui::TextWrapped("Below we are testing adding menu items to a regular window. It's rather unusual but should work!");
3535  ImGui::Separator();
3536 
3537  // Note: As a quirk in this very specific example, we want to differentiate the parent of this menu from the
3538  // parent of the various popup menus above. To do so we are encloding the items in a PushID()/PopID() block
3539  // to make them two different menusets. If we don't, opening any popup above and hovering our menu here would
3540  // open it. This is because once a menu is active, we allow to switch to a sibling menu by just hovering on it,
3541  // which is the desired behavior for regular menus.
3542  ImGui::PushID("foo");
3543  ImGui::MenuItem("Menu item", "CTRL+M");
3544  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Menu inside a regular window"))
3545  {
3546  ShowExampleMenuFile();
3547  ImGui::EndMenu();
3548  }
3549  ImGui::PopID();
3550  ImGui::Separator();
3551  ImGui::TreePop();
3552  }
3553 }
3554 
3555 // Dummy data structure that we use for the Table demo.
3556 // (pre-C++11 doesn't allow us to instantiate ImVector<MyItem> template if this structure if defined inside the demo function)
3557 namespace
3558 {
3559 // We are passing our own identifier to TableSetupColumn() to facilitate identifying columns in the sorting code.
3560 // This identifier will be passed down into ImGuiTableSortSpec::ColumnUserID.
3561 // But it is possible to omit the user id parameter of TableSetupColumn() and just use the column index instead! (ImGuiTableSortSpec::ColumnIndex)
3562 // If you don't use sorting, you will generally never care about giving column an ID!
3563  enum MyItemColumnID
3564  {
3565  MyItemColumnID_ID,
3566  MyItemColumnID_Name,
3567  MyItemColumnID_Action,
3568  MyItemColumnID_Quantity,
3569  MyItemColumnID_Description
3570  };
3571 
3572  struct MyItem
3573  {
3574  int ID;
3575  const char *Name;
3576  int Quantity;
3577 
3578  // We have a problem which is affecting _only this demo_ and should not affect your code:
3579  // As we don't rely on std:: or other third-party library to compile dear imgui, we only have reliable access to qsort(),
3580  // however qsort doesn't allow passing user data to comparing function.
3581  // As a workaround, we are storing the sort specs in a static/global for the comparing function to access.
3582  // In your own use case you would probably pass the sort specs to your sorting/comparing functions directly and not use a global.
3583  // We could technically call ImGui::TableGetSortSpecs() in CompareWithSortSpecs(), but considering that this function is called
3584  // very often by the sorting algorithm it would be a little wasteful.
3585  static const ImGuiTableSortSpecs *s_current_sort_specs;
3586 
3587  // Compare function to be used by qsort()
3588  static int IMGUI_CDECL CompareWithSortSpecs(const void *lhs, const void *rhs)
3589  {
3590  const MyItem *a = (const MyItem *)lhs;
3591  const MyItem *b = (const MyItem *)rhs;
3592  for (int n = 0; n < s_current_sort_specs->SpecsCount; n++)
3593  {
3594  // Here we identify columns using the ColumnUserID value that we ourselves passed to TableSetupColumn()
3595  // We could also choose to identify columns based on their index (sort_spec->ColumnIndex), which is simpler!
3596  const ImGuiTableColumnSortSpecs *sort_spec = &s_current_sort_specs->Specs[n];
3597  int delta = 0;
3598  switch (sort_spec->ColumnUserID)
3599  {
3600  case MyItemColumnID_ID: delta = (a->ID - b->ID); break;
3601  case MyItemColumnID_Name: delta = (strcmp(a->Name, b->Name)); break;
3602  case MyItemColumnID_Quantity: delta = (a->Quantity - b->Quantity); break;
3603  case MyItemColumnID_Description: delta = (strcmp(a->Name, b->Name)); break;
3604  default: IM_ASSERT(0); break;
3605  }
3606  if (delta > 0)
3607  return (sort_spec->SortDirection == ImGuiSortDirection_Ascending) ? +1 : -1;
3608  if (delta < 0)
3609  return (sort_spec->SortDirection == ImGuiSortDirection_Ascending) ? -1 : +1;
3610  }
3611 
3612  // qsort() is instable so always return a way to differenciate items.
3613  // Your own compare function may want to avoid fallback on implicit sort specs e.g. a Name compare if it wasn't already part of the sort specs.
3614  return (a->ID - b->ID);
3615  }
3616  };
3617  const ImGuiTableSortSpecs *MyItem::s_current_sort_specs = NULL;
3618 }
3619 
3620 // Make the UI compact because there are so many fields
3621 static void PushStyleCompact()
3622 {
3623  ImGuiStyle &style = ImGui::GetStyle();
3624  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(style.FramePadding.x, (float)(int)(style.FramePadding.y * 0.60f)));
3625  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(style.ItemSpacing.x, (float)(int)(style.ItemSpacing.y * 0.60f)));
3626 }
3627 
3628 static void PopStyleCompact()
3629 {
3630  ImGui::PopStyleVar(2);
3631 }
3632 
3633 // Show a combo box with a choice of sizing policies
3634 static void EditTableSizingFlags(ImGuiTableFlags *p_flags)
3635 {
3636  struct EnumDesc
3637  {
3638  ImGuiTableFlags Value; const char *Name; const char *Tooltip;
3639  };
3640  static const EnumDesc policies[] =
3641  {
3642  { ImGuiTableFlags_None, "Default", "Use default sizing policy:\n- ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit if ScrollX is on or if host window has ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize.\n- ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame otherwise." },
3643  { ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit, "ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit", "Columns default to _WidthFixed (if resizable) or _WidthAuto (if not resizable), matching contents width." },
3644  { ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedSame, "ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedSame", "Columns are all the same width, matching the maximum contents width.\nImplicitly disable ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable and enable ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible." },
3645  { ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchProp, "ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchProp", "Columns default to _WidthStretch with weights proportional to their widths." },
3646  { ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame, "ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame", "Columns default to _WidthStretch with same weights." }
3647  };
3648  int idx;
3649  for (idx = 0; idx < IM_ARRAYSIZE(policies); idx++)
3650  if (policies[idx].Value == (*p_flags & ImGuiTableFlags_SizingMask_))
3651  break;
3652  const char *preview_text = (idx < IM_ARRAYSIZE(policies)) ? policies[idx].Name + (idx > 0 ? strlen("ImGuiTableFlags") : 0) : "";
3653  if (ImGui::BeginCombo("Sizing Policy", preview_text))
3654  {
3655  for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(policies); n++)
3656  if (ImGui::Selectable(policies[n].Name, idx == n))
3657  *p_flags = (*p_flags & ~ImGuiTableFlags_SizingMask_) | policies[n].Value;
3658  ImGui::EndCombo();
3659  }
3660  ImGui::SameLine();
3661  ImGui::TextDisabled("(?)");
3662  if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())
3663  {
3664  ImGui::BeginTooltip();
3665  ImGui::PushTextWrapPos(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 50.0f);
3666  for (int m = 0; m < IM_ARRAYSIZE(policies); m++)
3667  {
3668  ImGui::Separator();
3669  ImGui::Text("%s:", policies[m].Name);
3670  ImGui::Separator();
3671  ImGui::SetCursorPosX(ImGui::GetCursorPosX() + ImGui::GetStyle().IndentSpacing * 0.5f);
3672  ImGui::TextUnformatted(policies[m].Tooltip);
3673  }
3674  ImGui::PopTextWrapPos();
3675  ImGui::EndTooltip();
3676  }
3677 }
3678 
3679 static void EditTableColumnsFlags(ImGuiTableColumnFlags *p_flags)
3680 {
3681  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_Disabled", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_Disabled); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Master disable flag (also hide from context menu)");
3682  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_DefaultHide", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultHide);
3683  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_DefaultSort", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultSort);
3684  if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_WidthStretch", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch))
3685  *p_flags &= ~(ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthMask_ ^ ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch);
3686  if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_WidthFixed", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed))
3687  *p_flags &= ~(ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthMask_ ^ ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed);
3688  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoResize", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoResize);
3689  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoReorder", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoReorder);
3690  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoHide", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHide);
3691  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoClip", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoClip);
3692  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoSort", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSort);
3693  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoSortAscending", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSortAscending);
3694  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoSortDescending", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSortDescending);
3695  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoHeaderLabel", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHeaderLabel);
3696  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoHeaderWidth", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHeaderWidth);
3697  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_PreferSortAscending", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortAscending);
3698  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_PreferSortDescending", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortDescending);
3699  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_IndentEnable", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentEnable); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Default for column 0");
3700  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_IndentDisable", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentDisable); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Default for column >0");
3701 }
3702 
3703 static void ShowTableColumnsStatusFlags(ImGuiTableColumnFlags flags)
3704 {
3705  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_IsEnabled", &flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsEnabled);
3706  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_IsVisible", &flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsVisible);
3707  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_IsSorted", &flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsSorted);
3708  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_IsHovered", &flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsHovered);
3709 }
3710 
3711 static void ShowDemoWindowTables()
3712 {
3713  //ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once);
3714  if (!ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Tables & Columns"))
3715  return;
3716 
3717  // Using those as a base value to create width/height that are factor of the size of our font
3718  const float TEXT_BASE_WIDTH = ImGui::CalcTextSize("A").x;
3719  const float TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT = ImGui::GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing();
3720 
3721  ImGui::PushID("Tables");
3722 
3723  int open_action = -1;
3724  if (ImGui::Button("Open all"))
3725  open_action = 1;
3726  ImGui::SameLine();
3727  if (ImGui::Button("Close all"))
3728  open_action = 0;
3729  ImGui::SameLine();
3730 
3731  // Options
3732  static bool disable_indent = false;
3733  ImGui::Checkbox("Disable tree indentation", &disable_indent);
3734  ImGui::SameLine();
3735  HelpMarker("Disable the indenting of tree nodes so demo tables can use the full window width.");
3736  ImGui::Separator();
3737  if (disable_indent)
3738  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_IndentSpacing, 0.0f);
3739 
3740  // About Styling of tables
3741  // Most settings are configured on a per-table basis via the flags passed to BeginTable() and TableSetupColumns APIs.
3742  // There are however a few settings that a shared and part of the ImGuiStyle structure:
3743  // style.CellPadding // Padding within each cell
3744  // style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TableHeaderBg] // Table header background
3745  // style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TableBorderStrong] // Table outer and header borders
3746  // style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TableBorderLight] // Table inner borders
3747  // style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TableRowBg] // Table row background when ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg is enabled (even rows)
3748  // style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TableRowBgAlt] // Table row background when ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg is enabled (odds rows)
3749 
3750  // Demos
3751  if (open_action != -1)
3752  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
3753  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Basic"))
3754  {
3755  // Here we will showcase three different ways to output a table.
3756  // They are very simple variations of a same thing!
3757 
3758  // [Method 1] Using TableNextRow() to create a new row, and TableSetColumnIndex() to select the column.
3759  // In many situations, this is the most flexible and easy to use pattern.
3760  HelpMarker("Using TableNextRow() + calling TableSetColumnIndex() _before_ each cell, in a loop.");
3761  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3))
3762  {
3763  for (int row = 0; row < 4; row++)
3764  {
3765  ImGui::TableNextRow();
3766  for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
3767  {
3768  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
3769  ImGui::Text("Row %d Column %d", row, column);
3770  }
3771  }
3772  ImGui::EndTable();
3773  }
3774 
3775  // [Method 2] Using TableNextColumn() called multiple times, instead of using a for loop + TableSetColumnIndex().
3776  // This is generally more convenient when you have code manually submitting the contents of each columns.
3777  HelpMarker("Using TableNextRow() + calling TableNextColumn() _before_ each cell, manually.");
3778  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 3))
3779  {
3780  for (int row = 0; row < 4; row++)
3781  {
3782  ImGui::TableNextRow();
3783  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
3784  ImGui::Text("Row %d", row);
3785  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
3786  ImGui::Text("Some contents");
3787  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
3788  ImGui::Text("123.456");
3789  }
3790  ImGui::EndTable();
3791  }
3792 
3793  // [Method 3] We call TableNextColumn() _before_ each cell. We never call TableNextRow(),
3794  // as TableNextColumn() will automatically wrap around and create new roes as needed.
3795  // This is generally more convenient when your cells all contains the same type of data.
3796  HelpMarker(
3797  "Only using TableNextColumn(), which tends to be convenient for tables where every cells contains the same type of contents.\n"
3798  "This is also more similar to the old NextColumn() function of the Columns API, and provided to facilitate the Columns->Tables API transition.");
3799  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table3", 3))
3800  {
3801  for (int item = 0; item < 14; item++)
3802  {
3803  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
3804  ImGui::Text("Item %d", item);
3805  }
3806  ImGui::EndTable();
3807  }
3808 
3809  ImGui::TreePop();
3810  }
3811 
3812  if (open_action != -1)
3813  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
3814  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Borders, background"))
3815  {
3816  // Expose a few Borders related flags interactively
3817  enum ContentsType
3818  {
3819  CT_Text, CT_FillButton
3820  };
3821  static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg;
3822  static bool display_headers = false;
3823  static int contents_type = CT_Text;
3824 
3825  PushStyleCompact();
3826  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg);
3827  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Borders", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders);
3828  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("ImGuiTableFlags_Borders\n = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV\n | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV\n | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV\n | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH");
3829  ImGui::Indent();
3830 
3831  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH);
3832  ImGui::Indent();
3833  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH);
3834  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH);
3835  ImGui::Unindent();
3836 
3837  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV);
3838  ImGui::Indent();
3839  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV);
3840  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV);
3841  ImGui::Unindent();
3842 
3843  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter);
3844  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInner", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInner);
3845  ImGui::Unindent();
3846 
3847  ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding(); ImGui::Text("Cell contents:");
3848  ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::RadioButton("Text", &contents_type, CT_Text);
3849  ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::RadioButton("FillButton", &contents_type, CT_FillButton);
3850  ImGui::Checkbox("Display headers", &display_headers);
3851  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable vertical borders in columns Body (borders will always appears in Headers");
3852  PopStyleCompact();
3853 
3854  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, flags))
3855  {
3856  // Display headers so we can inspect their interaction with borders.
3857  // (Headers are not the main purpose of this section of the demo, so we are not elaborating on them too much. See other sections for details)
3858  if (display_headers)
3859  {
3860  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");
3861  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");
3862  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");
3863  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
3864  }
3865 
3866  for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
3867  {
3868  ImGui::TableNextRow();
3869  for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
3870  {
3871  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
3872  char buf[32];
3873  sprintf(buf, "Hello %d,%d", column, row);
3874  if (contents_type == CT_Text)
3875  ImGui::TextUnformatted(buf);
3876  else if (contents_type)
3877  ImGui::Button(buf, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f));
3878  }
3879  }
3880  ImGui::EndTable();
3881  }
3882  ImGui::TreePop();
3883  }
3884 
3885  if (open_action != -1)
3886  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
3887  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Resizable, stretch"))
3888  {
3889  // By default, if we don't enable ScrollX the sizing policy for each columns is "Stretch"
3890  // Each columns maintain a sizing weight, and they will occupy all available width.
3891  static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody;
3892  PushStyleCompact();
3893  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
3894  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV);
3895  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Using the _Resizable flag automatically enables the _BordersInnerV flag as well, this is why the resize borders are still showing when unchecking this.");
3896  PopStyleCompact();
3897 
3898  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, flags))
3899  {
3900  for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
3901  {
3902  ImGui::TableNextRow();
3903  for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
3904  {
3905  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
3906  ImGui::Text("Hello %d,%d", column, row);
3907  }
3908  }
3909  ImGui::EndTable();
3910  }
3911  ImGui::TreePop();
3912  }
3913 
3914  if (open_action != -1)
3915  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
3916  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Resizable, fixed"))
3917  {
3918  // Here we use ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit (even though _ScrollX is not set)
3919  // So columns will adopt the "Fixed" policy and will maintain a fixed width regardless of the whole available width (unless table is small)
3920  // If there is not enough available width to fit all columns, they will however be resized down.
3921  // FIXME-TABLE: Providing a stretch-on-init would make sense especially for tables which don't have saved settings
3922  HelpMarker(
3923  "Using _Resizable + _SizingFixedFit flags.\n"
3924  "Fixed-width columns generally makes more sense if you want to use horizontal scrolling.\n\n"
3925  "Double-click a column border to auto-fit the column to its contents.");
3926  PushStyleCompact();
3927  static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody;
3928  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX);
3929  PopStyleCompact();
3930 
3931  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, flags))
3932  {
3933  for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
3934  {
3935  ImGui::TableNextRow();
3936  for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
3937  {
3938  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
3939  ImGui::Text("Hello %d,%d", column, row);
3940  }
3941  }
3942  ImGui::EndTable();
3943  }
3944  ImGui::TreePop();
3945  }
3946 
3947  if (open_action != -1)
3948  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
3949  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Resizable, mixed"))
3950  {
3951  HelpMarker(
3952  "Using TableSetupColumn() to alter resizing policy on a per-column basis.\n\n"
3953  "When combining Fixed and Stretch columns, generally you only want one, maybe two trailing columns to use _WidthStretch.");
3954  static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable;
3955 
3956  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, flags))
3957  {
3958  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("AAA", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed);
3959  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("BBB", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed);
3960  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("CCC", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch);
3961  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
3962  for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
3963  {
3964  ImGui::TableNextRow();
3965  for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
3966  {
3967  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
3968  ImGui::Text("%s %d,%d", (column == 2) ? "Stretch" : "Fixed", column, row);
3969  }
3970  }
3971  ImGui::EndTable();
3972  }
3973  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 6, flags))
3974  {
3975  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("AAA", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed);
3976  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("BBB", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed);
3977  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("CCC", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultHide);
3978  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("DDD", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch);
3979  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("EEE", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch);
3980  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("FFF", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultHide);
3981  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
3982  for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
3983  {
3984  ImGui::TableNextRow();
3985  for (int column = 0; column < 6; column++)
3986  {
3987  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
3988  ImGui::Text("%s %d,%d", (column >= 3) ? "Stretch" : "Fixed", column, row);
3989  }
3990  }
3991  ImGui::EndTable();
3992  }
3993  ImGui::TreePop();
3994  }
3995 
3996  if (open_action != -1)
3997  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
3998  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Reorderable, hideable, with headers"))
3999  {
4000  HelpMarker(
4001  "Click and drag column headers to reorder columns.\n\n"
4002  "Right-click on a header to open a context menu.");
4003  static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV;
4004  PushStyleCompact();
4005  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
4006  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable);
4007  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable);
4008  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody);
4009  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable vertical borders in columns Body until hovered for resize (borders will always appears in Headers)");
4010  PopStyleCompact();
4011 
4012  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, flags))
4013  {
4014  // Submit columns name with TableSetupColumn() and call TableHeadersRow() to create a row with a header in each column.
4015  // (Later we will show how TableSetupColumn() has other uses, optional flags, sizing weight etc.)
4016  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");
4017  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");
4018  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");
4019  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
4020  for (int row = 0; row < 6; row++)
4021  {
4022  ImGui::TableNextRow();
4023  for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
4024  {
4025  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
4026  ImGui::Text("Hello %d,%d", column, row);
4027  }
4028  }
4029  ImGui::EndTable();
4030  }
4031 
4032  // Use outer_size.x == 0.0f instead of default to make the table as tight as possible (only valid when no scrolling and no stretch column)
4033  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 3, flags | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f)))
4034  {
4035  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");
4036  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");
4037  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");
4038  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
4039  for (int row = 0; row < 6; row++)
4040  {
4041  ImGui::TableNextRow();
4042  for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
4043  {
4044  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
4045  ImGui::Text("Fixed %d,%d", column, row);
4046  }
4047  }
4048  ImGui::EndTable();
4049  }
4050  ImGui::TreePop();
4051  }
4052 
4053  if (open_action != -1)
4054  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
4055  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Padding"))
4056  {
4057  // First example: showcase use of padding flags and effect of BorderOuterV/BorderInnerV on X padding.
4058  // We don't expose BorderOuterH/BorderInnerH here because they have no effect on X padding.
4059  HelpMarker(
4060  "We often want outer padding activated when any using features which makes the edges of a column visible:\n"
4061  "e.g.:\n"
4062  "- BorderOuterV\n"
4063  "- any form of row selection\n"
4064  "Because of this, activating BorderOuterV sets the default to PadOuterX. Using PadOuterX or NoPadOuterX you can override the default.\n\n"
4065  "Actual padding values are using style.CellPadding.\n\n"
4066  "In this demo we don't show horizontal borders to emphasis how they don't affect default horizontal padding.");
4067 
4068  static ImGuiTableFlags flags1 = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV;
4069  PushStyleCompact();
4070  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_PadOuterX", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_PadOuterX);
4071  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable outer-most padding (default if ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV is set)");
4072  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadOuterX", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadOuterX);
4073  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable outer-most padding (default if ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV is not set)");
4074  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadInnerX", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadInnerX);
4075  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable inner padding between columns (double inner padding if BordersOuterV is on, single inner padding if BordersOuterV is off)");
4076  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV);
4077  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV);
4078  static bool show_headers = false;
4079  ImGui::Checkbox("show_headers", &show_headers);
4080  PopStyleCompact();
4081 
4082  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_padding", 3, flags1))
4083  {
4084  if (show_headers)
4085  {
4086  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");
4087  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");
4088  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");
4089  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
4090  }
4091 
4092  for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
4093  {
4094  ImGui::TableNextRow();
4095  for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
4096  {
4097  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
4098  if (row == 0)
4099  {
4100  ImGui::Text("Avail %.2f", ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x);
4101  }
4102  else
4103  {
4104  char buf[32];
4105  sprintf(buf, "Hello %d,%d", column, row);
4106  ImGui::Button(buf, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f));
4107  }
4108  //if (ImGui::TableGetColumnFlags() & ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsHovered)
4109  // ImGui::TableSetBgColor(ImGuiTableBgTarget_CellBg, IM_COL32(0, 100, 0, 255));
4110  }
4111  }
4112  ImGui::EndTable();
4113  }
4114 
4115  // Second example: set style.CellPadding to (0.0) or a custom value.
4116  // FIXME-TABLE: Vertical border effectively not displayed the same way as horizontal one...
4117  HelpMarker("Setting style.CellPadding to (0,0) or a custom value.");
4118  static ImGuiTableFlags flags2 = ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg;
4119  static ImVec2 cell_padding(0.0f, 0.0f);
4120  static bool show_widget_frame_bg = true;
4121 
4122  PushStyleCompact();
4123  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Borders", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders);
4124  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH);
4125  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV);
4126  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInner", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInner);
4127  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter);
4128  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg);
4129  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
4130  ImGui::Checkbox("show_widget_frame_bg", &show_widget_frame_bg);
4131  ImGui::SliderFloat2("CellPadding", &cell_padding.x, 0.0f, 10.0f, "%.0f");
4132  PopStyleCompact();
4133 
4134  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_CellPadding, cell_padding);
4135  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_padding_2", 3, flags2))
4136  {
4137  static char text_bufs[3 * 5][16]; // Mini text storage for 3x5 cells
4138  static bool init = true;
4139  if (!show_widget_frame_bg)
4140  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_FrameBg, 0);
4141  for (int cell = 0; cell < 3 * 5; cell++)
4142  {
4143  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
4144  if (init)
4145  strcpy(text_bufs[cell], "edit me");
4146  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN);
4147  ImGui::PushID(cell);
4148  ImGui::InputText("##cell", text_bufs[cell], IM_ARRAYSIZE(text_bufs[cell]));
4149  ImGui::PopID();
4150  }
4151  if (!show_widget_frame_bg)
4152  ImGui::PopStyleColor();
4153  init = false;
4154  ImGui::EndTable();
4155  }
4156  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
4157 
4158  ImGui::TreePop();
4159  }
4160 
4161  if (open_action != -1)
4162  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
4163  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Sizing policies"))
4164  {
4165  static ImGuiTableFlags flags1 = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody;
4166  PushStyleCompact();
4167  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
4168  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX);
4169  PopStyleCompact();
4170 
4171  static ImGuiTableFlags sizing_policy_flags[4] = { ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit, ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedSame, ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchProp, ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame };
4172  for (int table_n = 0; table_n < 4; table_n++)
4173  {
4174  ImGui::PushID(table_n);
4175  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 30);
4176  EditTableSizingFlags(&sizing_policy_flags[table_n]);
4177 
4178  // To make it easier to understand the different sizing policy,
4179  // For each policy: we display one table where the columns have equal contents width, and one where the columns have different contents width.
4180  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, sizing_policy_flags[table_n] | flags1))
4181  {
4182  for (int row = 0; row < 3; row++)
4183  {
4184  ImGui::TableNextRow();
4185  ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("Oh dear");
4186  ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("Oh dear");
4187  ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("Oh dear");
4188  }
4189  ImGui::EndTable();
4190  }
4191  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 3, sizing_policy_flags[table_n] | flags1))
4192  {
4193  for (int row = 0; row < 3; row++)
4194  {
4195  ImGui::TableNextRow();
4196  ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("AAAA");
4197  ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("BBBBBBBB");
4198  ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("CCCCCCCCCCCC");
4199  }
4200  ImGui::EndTable();
4201  }
4202  ImGui::PopID();
4203  }
4204 
4205  ImGui::Spacing();
4206  ImGui::TextUnformatted("Advanced");
4207  ImGui::SameLine();
4208  HelpMarker("This section allows you to interact and see the effect of various sizing policies depending on whether Scroll is enabled and the contents of your columns.");
4209 
4210  enum ContentsType
4211  {
4212  CT_ShowWidth, CT_ShortText, CT_LongText, CT_Button, CT_FillButton, CT_InputText
4213  };
4214  static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable;
4215  static int contents_type = CT_ShowWidth;
4216  static int column_count = 3;
4217 
4218  PushStyleCompact();
4219  ImGui::PushID("Advanced");
4220  ImGui::PushItemWidth(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 30);
4221  EditTableSizingFlags(&flags);
4222  ImGui::Combo("Contents", &contents_type, "Show width\0Short Text\0Long Text\0Button\0Fill Button\0InputText\0");
4223  if (contents_type == CT_FillButton)
4224  {
4225  ImGui::SameLine();
4226  HelpMarker("Be mindful that using right-alignment (e.g. size.x = -FLT_MIN) creates a feedback loop where contents width can feed into auto-column width can feed into contents width.");
4227  }
4228  ImGui::DragInt("Columns", &column_count, 0.1f, 1, 64, "%d", ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp);
4229  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
4230  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_PreciseWidths", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_PreciseWidths);
4231  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable distributing remainder width to stretched columns (width allocation on a 100-wide table with 3 columns: Without this flag: 33,33,34. With this flag: 33,33,33). With larger number of columns, resizing will appear to be less smooth.");
4232  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX);
4233  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY);
4234  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoClip", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoClip);
4235  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
4236  ImGui::PopID();
4237  PopStyleCompact();
4238 
4239  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", column_count, flags, ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 7)))
4240  {
4241  for (int cell = 0; cell < 10 * column_count; cell++)
4242  {
4243  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
4244  int column = ImGui::TableGetColumnIndex();
4245  int row = ImGui::TableGetRowIndex();
4246 
4247  ImGui::PushID(cell);
4248  char label[32];
4249  static char text_buf[32] = "";
4250  sprintf(label, "Hello %d,%d", column, row);
4251  switch (contents_type)
4252  {
4253  case CT_ShortText: ImGui::TextUnformatted(label); break;
4254  case CT_LongText: ImGui::Text("Some %s text %d,%d\nOver two lines..", column == 0 ? "long" : "longeeer", column, row); break;
4255  case CT_ShowWidth: ImGui::Text("W: %.1f", ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x); break;
4256  case CT_Button: ImGui::Button(label); break;
4257  case CT_FillButton: ImGui::Button(label, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f)); break;
4258  case CT_InputText: ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN); ImGui::InputText("##", text_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(text_buf)); break;
4259  }
4260  ImGui::PopID();
4261  }
4262  ImGui::EndTable();
4263  }
4264  ImGui::TreePop();
4265  }
4266 
4267  if (open_action != -1)
4268  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
4269  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Vertical scrolling, with clipping"))
4270  {
4271  HelpMarker("Here we activate ScrollY, which will create a child window container to allow hosting scrollable contents.\n\nWe also demonstrate using ImGuiListClipper to virtualize the submission of many items.");
4272  static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable;
4273 
4274  PushStyleCompact();
4275  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY);
4276  PopStyleCompact();
4277 
4278  // When using ScrollX or ScrollY we need to specify a size for our table container!
4279  // Otherwise by default the table will fit all available space, like a BeginChild() call.
4280  ImVec2 outer_size = ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 8);
4281  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_scrolly", 3, flags, outer_size))
4282  {
4283  ImGui::TableSetupScrollFreeze(0, 1); // Make top row always visible
4284  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_None);
4285  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_None);
4286  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_None);
4287  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
4288 
4289  // Demonstrate using clipper for large vertical lists
4290  ImGuiListClipper clipper;
4291  clipper.Begin(1000);
4292  while (clipper.Step())
4293  {
4294  for (int row = clipper.DisplayStart; row < clipper.DisplayEnd; row++)
4295  {
4296  ImGui::TableNextRow();
4297  for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
4298  {
4299  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
4300  ImGui::Text("Hello %d,%d", column, row);
4301  }
4302  }
4303  }
4304  ImGui::EndTable();
4305  }
4306  ImGui::TreePop();
4307  }
4308 
4309  if (open_action != -1)
4310  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
4311  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Horizontal scrolling"))
4312  {
4313  HelpMarker(
4314  "When ScrollX is enabled, the default sizing policy becomes ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit, "
4315  "as automatically stretching columns doesn't make much sense with horizontal scrolling.\n\n"
4316  "Also note that as of the current version, you will almost always want to enable ScrollY along with ScrollX,"
4317  "because the container window won't automatically extend vertically to fix contents (this may be improved in future versions).");
4318  static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable;
4319  static int freeze_cols = 1;
4320  static int freeze_rows = 1;
4321 
4322  PushStyleCompact();
4323  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
4324  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX);
4325  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY);
4326  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFrameHeight());
4327  ImGui::DragInt("freeze_cols", &freeze_cols, 0.2f, 0, 9, NULL, ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput);
4328  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFrameHeight());
4329  ImGui::DragInt("freeze_rows", &freeze_rows, 0.2f, 0, 9, NULL, ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput);
4330  PopStyleCompact();
4331 
4332  // When using ScrollX or ScrollY we need to specify a size for our table container!
4333  // Otherwise by default the table will fit all available space, like a BeginChild() call.
4334  ImVec2 outer_size = ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 8);
4335  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_scrollx", 7, flags, outer_size))
4336  {
4337  ImGui::TableSetupScrollFreeze(freeze_cols, freeze_rows);
4338  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Line #", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHide); // Make the first column not hideable to match our use of TableSetupScrollFreeze()
4339  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");
4340  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");
4341  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");
4342  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Four");
4343  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Five");
4344  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Six");
4345  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
4346  for (int row = 0; row < 20; row++)
4347  {
4348  ImGui::TableNextRow();
4349  for (int column = 0; column < 7; column++)
4350  {
4351  // Both TableNextColumn() and TableSetColumnIndex() return true when a column is visible or performing width measurement.
4352  // Because here we know that:
4353  // - A) all our columns are contributing the same to row height
4354  // - B) column 0 is always visible,
4355  // We only always submit this one column and can skip others.
4356  // More advanced per-column clipping behaviors may benefit from polling the status flags via TableGetColumnFlags().
4357  if (!ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column) && column > 0)
4358  continue;
4359  if (column == 0)
4360  ImGui::Text("Line %d", row);
4361  else
4362  ImGui::Text("Hello world %d,%d", column, row);
4363  }
4364  }
4365  ImGui::EndTable();
4366  }
4367 
4368  ImGui::Spacing();
4369  ImGui::TextUnformatted("Stretch + ScrollX");
4370  ImGui::SameLine();
4371  HelpMarker(
4372  "Showcase using Stretch columns + ScrollX together: "
4373  "this is rather unusual and only makes sense when specifying an 'inner_width' for the table!\n"
4374  "Without an explicit value, inner_width is == outer_size.x and therefore using Stretch columns + ScrollX together doesn't make sense.");
4375  static ImGuiTableFlags flags2 = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody;
4376  static float inner_width = 1000.0f;
4377  PushStyleCompact();
4378  ImGui::PushID("flags3");
4379  ImGui::PushItemWidth(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 30);
4380  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX);
4381  ImGui::DragFloat("inner_width", &inner_width, 1.0f, 0.0f, FLT_MAX, "%.1f");
4382  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
4383  ImGui::PopID();
4384  PopStyleCompact();
4385  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 7, flags2, outer_size, inner_width))
4386  {
4387  for (int cell = 0; cell < 20 * 7; cell++)
4388  {
4389  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
4390  ImGui::Text("Hello world %d,%d", ImGui::TableGetColumnIndex(), ImGui::TableGetRowIndex());
4391  }
4392  ImGui::EndTable();
4393  }
4394  ImGui::TreePop();
4395  }
4396 
4397  if (open_action != -1)
4398  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
4399  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Columns flags"))
4400  {
4401  // Create a first table just to show all the options/flags we want to make visible in our example!
4402  const int column_count = 3;
4403  const char *column_names[column_count] = { "One", "Two", "Three" };
4404  static ImGuiTableColumnFlags column_flags[column_count] = { ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultSort, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_None, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultHide };
4405  static ImGuiTableColumnFlags column_flags_out[column_count] = { 0, 0, 0 }; // Output from TableGetColumnFlags()
4406 
4407  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_columns_flags_checkboxes", column_count, ImGuiTableFlags_None))
4408  {
4409  PushStyleCompact();
4410  for (int column = 0; column < column_count; column++)
4411  {
4412  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
4413  ImGui::PushID(column);
4414  ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding(); // FIXME-TABLE: Workaround for wrong text baseline propagation
4415  ImGui::Text("'%s'", column_names[column]);
4416  ImGui::Spacing();
4417  ImGui::Text("Input flags:");
4418  EditTableColumnsFlags(&column_flags[column]);
4419  ImGui::Spacing();
4420  ImGui::Text("Output flags:");
4421  ShowTableColumnsStatusFlags(column_flags_out[column]);
4422  ImGui::PopID();
4423  }
4424  PopStyleCompact();
4425  ImGui::EndTable();
4426  }
4427 
4428  // Create the real table we care about for the example!
4429  // We use a scrolling table to be able to showcase the difference between the _IsEnabled and _IsVisible flags above, otherwise in
4430  // a non-scrolling table columns are always visible (unless using ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible + resizing the parent window down)
4431  const ImGuiTableFlags flags
4432  = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY
4433  | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV
4434  | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable | ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable;
4435  ImVec2 outer_size = ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 9);
4436  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_columns_flags", column_count, flags, outer_size))
4437  {
4438  for (int column = 0; column < column_count; column++)
4439  ImGui::TableSetupColumn(column_names[column], column_flags[column]);
4440  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
4441  for (int column = 0; column < column_count; column++)
4442  column_flags_out[column] = ImGui::TableGetColumnFlags(column);
4443  float indent_step = (float)((int)TEXT_BASE_WIDTH / 2);
4444  for (int row = 0; row < 8; row++)
4445  {
4446  ImGui::Indent(indent_step); // Add some indentation to demonstrate usage of per-column IndentEnable/IndentDisable flags.
4447  ImGui::TableNextRow();
4448  for (int column = 0; column < column_count; column++)
4449  {
4450  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
4451  ImGui::Text("%s %s", (column == 0) ? "Indented" : "Hello", ImGui::TableGetColumnName(column));
4452  }
4453  }
4454  ImGui::Unindent(indent_step * 8.0f);
4455 
4456  ImGui::EndTable();
4457  }
4458  ImGui::TreePop();
4459  }
4460 
4461  if (open_action != -1)
4462  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
4463  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Columns widths"))
4464  {
4465  HelpMarker("Using TableSetupColumn() to setup default width.");
4466 
4467  static ImGuiTableFlags flags1 = ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize;
4468  PushStyleCompact();
4469  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
4470  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize);
4471  PopStyleCompact();
4472  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, flags1))
4473  {
4474  // We could also set ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit on the table and all columns will default to ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed.
4475  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("one", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 100.0f); // Default to 100.0f
4476  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("two", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 200.0f); // Default to 200.0f
4477  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("three", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed); // Default to auto
4478  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
4479  for (int row = 0; row < 4; row++)
4480  {
4481  ImGui::TableNextRow();
4482  for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
4483  {
4484  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
4485  if (row == 0)
4486  ImGui::Text("(w: %5.1f)", ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x);
4487  else
4488  ImGui::Text("Hello %d,%d", column, row);
4489  }
4490  }
4491  ImGui::EndTable();
4492  }
4493 
4494  HelpMarker("Using TableSetupColumn() to setup explicit width.\n\nUnless _NoKeepColumnsVisible is set, fixed columns with set width may still be shrunk down if there's not enough space in the host.");
4495 
4496  static ImGuiTableFlags flags2 = ImGuiTableFlags_None;
4497  PushStyleCompact();
4498  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible);
4499  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV);
4500  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV);
4501  PopStyleCompact();
4502  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 4, flags2))
4503  {
4504  // We could also set ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit on the table and all columns will default to ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed.
4505  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 100.0f);
4506  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 15.0f);
4507  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 30.0f);
4508  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 15.0f);
4509  for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
4510  {
4511  ImGui::TableNextRow();
4512  for (int column = 0; column < 4; column++)
4513  {
4514  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
4515  if (row == 0)
4516  ImGui::Text("(w: %5.1f)", ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x);
4517  else
4518  ImGui::Text("Hello %d,%d", column, row);
4519  }
4520  }
4521  ImGui::EndTable();
4522  }
4523  ImGui::TreePop();
4524  }
4525 
4526  if (open_action != -1)
4527  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
4528  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Nested tables"))
4529  {
4530  HelpMarker("This demonstrate embedding a table into another table cell.");
4531 
4532  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_nested1", 2, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable))
4533  {
4534  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("A0");
4535  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("A1");
4536  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
4537 
4538  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
4539  ImGui::Text("A0 Row 0");
4540  {
4541  float rows_height = TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 2;
4542  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_nested2", 2, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable))
4543  {
4544  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("B0");
4545  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("B1");
4546  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
4547 
4548  ImGui::TableNextRow(ImGuiTableRowFlags_None, rows_height);
4549  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
4550  ImGui::Text("B0 Row 0");
4551  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
4552  ImGui::Text("B1 Row 0");
4553  ImGui::TableNextRow(ImGuiTableRowFlags_None, rows_height);
4554  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
4555  ImGui::Text("B0 Row 1");
4556  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
4557  ImGui::Text("B1 Row 1");
4558 
4559  ImGui::EndTable();
4560  }
4561  }
4562  ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("A1 Row 0");
4563  ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("A0 Row 1");
4564  ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("A1 Row 1");
4565  ImGui::EndTable();
4566  }
4567  ImGui::TreePop();
4568  }
4569 
4570  if (open_action != -1)
4571  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
4572  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Row height"))
4573  {
4574  HelpMarker("You can pass a 'min_row_height' to TableNextRow().\n\nRows are padded with 'style.CellPadding.y' on top and bottom, so effectively the minimum row height will always be >= 'style.CellPadding.y * 2.0f'.\n\nWe cannot honor a _maximum_ row height as that would requires a unique clipping rectangle per row.");
4575  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_row_height", 1, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV))
4576  {
4577  for (int row = 0; row < 10; row++)
4578  {
4579  float min_row_height = (float)(int)(TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 0.30f * row);
4580  ImGui::TableNextRow(ImGuiTableRowFlags_None, min_row_height);
4581  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
4582  ImGui::Text("min_row_height = %.2f", min_row_height);
4583  }
4584  ImGui::EndTable();
4585  }
4586  ImGui::TreePop();
4587  }
4588 
4589  if (open_action != -1)
4590  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
4591  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Outer size"))
4592  {
4593  // Showcasing use of ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX and ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendY
4594  // Important to that note how the two flags have slightly different behaviors!
4595  ImGui::Text("Using NoHostExtendX and NoHostExtendY:");
4596  PushStyleCompact();
4597  static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX;
4598  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX);
4599  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Make outer width auto-fit to columns, overriding outer_size.x value.\n\nOnly available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled and Stretch columns are not used.");
4600  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendY);
4601  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Make outer height stop exactly at outer_size.y (prevent auto-extending table past the limit).\n\nOnly available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled. Data below the limit will be clipped and not visible.");
4602  PopStyleCompact();
4603 
4604  ImVec2 outer_size = ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 5.5f);
4605  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, flags, outer_size))
4606  {
4607  for (int row = 0; row < 10; row++)
4608  {
4609  ImGui::TableNextRow();
4610  for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
4611  {
4612  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
4613  ImGui::Text("Cell %d,%d", column, row);
4614  }
4615  }
4616  ImGui::EndTable();
4617  }
4618  ImGui::SameLine();
4619  ImGui::Text("Hello!");
4620 
4621  ImGui::Spacing();
4622 
4623  ImGui::Text("Using explicit size:");
4624  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 3, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg, ImVec2(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 30, 0.0f)))
4625  {
4626  for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
4627  {
4628  ImGui::TableNextRow();
4629  for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
4630  {
4631  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
4632  ImGui::Text("Cell %d,%d", column, row);
4633  }
4634  }
4635  ImGui::EndTable();
4636  }
4637  ImGui::SameLine();
4638  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table3", 3, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg, ImVec2(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 30, 0.0f)))
4639  {
4640  for (int row = 0; row < 3; row++)
4641  {
4642  ImGui::TableNextRow(0, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 1.5f);
4643  for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
4644  {
4645  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
4646  ImGui::Text("Cell %d,%d", column, row);
4647  }
4648  }
4649  ImGui::EndTable();
4650  }
4651 
4652  ImGui::TreePop();
4653  }
4654 
4655  if (open_action != -1)
4656  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
4657  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Background color"))
4658  {
4659  static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg;
4660  static int row_bg_type = 1;
4661  static int row_bg_target = 1;
4662  static int cell_bg_type = 1;
4663 
4664  PushStyleCompact();
4665  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Borders", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders);
4666  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg);
4667  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg automatically sets RowBg0 to alternative colors pulled from the Style.");
4668  ImGui::Combo("row bg type", (int *)&row_bg_type, "None\0Red\0Gradient\0");
4669  ImGui::Combo("row bg target", (int *)&row_bg_target, "RowBg0\0RowBg1\0"); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Target RowBg0 to override the alternating odd/even colors,\nTarget RowBg1 to blend with them.");
4670  ImGui::Combo("cell bg type", (int *)&cell_bg_type, "None\0Blue\0"); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("We are colorizing cells to B1->C2 here.");
4671  IM_ASSERT(row_bg_type >= 0 && row_bg_type <= 2);
4672  IM_ASSERT(row_bg_target >= 0 && row_bg_target <= 1);
4673  IM_ASSERT(cell_bg_type >= 0 && cell_bg_type <= 1);
4674  PopStyleCompact();
4675 
4676  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 5, flags))
4677  {
4678  for (int row = 0; row < 6; row++)
4679  {
4680  ImGui::TableNextRow();
4681 
4682  // Demonstrate setting a row background color with 'ImGui::TableSetBgColor(ImGuiTableBgTarget_RowBgX, ...)'
4683  // We use a transparent color so we can see the one behind in case our target is RowBg1 and RowBg0 was already targeted by the ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg flag.
4684  if (row_bg_type != 0)
4685  {
4686  ImU32 row_bg_color = ImGui::GetColorU32(row_bg_type == 1 ? ImVec4(0.7f, 0.3f, 0.3f, 0.65f) : ImVec4(0.2f + row * 0.1f, 0.2f, 0.2f, 0.65f)); // Flat or Gradient?
4687  ImGui::TableSetBgColor(ImGuiTableBgTarget_RowBg0 + row_bg_target, row_bg_color);
4688  }
4689 
4690  // Fill cells
4691  for (int column = 0; column < 5; column++)
4692  {
4693  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
4694  ImGui::Text("%c%c", 'A' + row, '0' + column);
4695 
4696  // Change background of Cells B1->C2
4697  // Demonstrate setting a cell background color with 'ImGui::TableSetBgColor(ImGuiTableBgTarget_CellBg, ...)'
4698  // (the CellBg color will be blended over the RowBg and ColumnBg colors)
4699  // We can also pass a column number as a third parameter to TableSetBgColor() and do this outside the column loop.
4700  if (row >= 1 && row <= 2 && column >= 1 && column <= 2 && cell_bg_type == 1)
4701  {
4702  ImU32 cell_bg_color = ImGui::GetColorU32(ImVec4(0.3f, 0.3f, 0.7f, 0.65f));
4703  ImGui::TableSetBgColor(ImGuiTableBgTarget_CellBg, cell_bg_color);
4704  }
4705  }
4706  }
4707  ImGui::EndTable();
4708  }
4709  ImGui::TreePop();
4710  }
4711 
4712  if (open_action != -1)
4713  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
4714  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tree view"))
4715  {
4716  static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody;
4717 
4718  if (ImGui::BeginTable("3ways", 3, flags))
4719  {
4720  // The first column will use the default _WidthStretch when ScrollX is Off and _WidthFixed when ScrollX is On
4721  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Name", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHide);
4722  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Size", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 12.0f);
4723  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Type", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 18.0f);
4724  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
4725 
4726  // Simple storage to output a dummy file-system.
4727  struct MyTreeNode
4728  {
4729  const char *Name;
4730  const char *Type;
4731  int Size;
4732  int ChildIdx;
4733  int ChildCount;
4734  static void DisplayNode(const MyTreeNode *node, const MyTreeNode *all_nodes)
4735  {
4736  ImGui::TableNextRow();
4737  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
4738  const bool is_folder = (node->ChildCount > 0);
4739  if (is_folder)
4740  {
4741  bool open = ImGui::TreeNodeEx(node->Name, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth);
4742  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
4743  ImGui::TextDisabled("--");
4744  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
4745  ImGui::TextUnformatted(node->Type);
4746  if (open)
4747  {
4748  for (int child_n = 0; child_n < node->ChildCount; child_n++)
4749  DisplayNode(&all_nodes[node->ChildIdx + child_n], all_nodes);
4750  ImGui::TreePop();
4751  }
4752  }
4753  else
4754  {
4755  ImGui::TreeNodeEx(node->Name, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth);
4756  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
4757  ImGui::Text("%d", node->Size);
4758  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
4759  ImGui::TextUnformatted(node->Type);
4760  }
4761  }
4762  };
4763  static const MyTreeNode nodes[] =
4764  {
4765  { "Root", "Folder", -1, 1, 3 }, // 0
4766  { "Music", "Folder", -1, 4, 2 }, // 1
4767  { "Textures", "Folder", -1, 6, 3 }, // 2
4768  { "desktop.ini", "System file", 1024, -1,-1 }, // 3
4769  { "File1_a.wav", "Audio file", 123000, -1,-1 }, // 4
4770  { "File1_b.wav", "Audio file", 456000, -1,-1 }, // 5
4771  { "Image001.png", "Image file", 203128, -1,-1 }, // 6
4772  { "Copy of Image001.png", "Image file", 203256, -1,-1 }, // 7
4773  { "Copy of Image001 (Final2).png","Image file", 203512, -1,-1 }, // 8
4774  };
4775 
4776  MyTreeNode::DisplayNode(&nodes[0], nodes);
4777 
4778  ImGui::EndTable();
4779  }
4780  ImGui::TreePop();
4781  }
4782 
4783  if (open_action != -1)
4784  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
4785  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Item width"))
4786  {
4787  HelpMarker(
4788  "Showcase using PushItemWidth() and how it is preserved on a per-column basis.\n\n"
4789  "Note that on auto-resizing non-resizable fixed columns, querying the content width for e.g. right-alignment doesn't make sense.");
4790  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_item_width", 3, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders))
4791  {
4792  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("small");
4793  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("half");
4794  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("right-align");
4795  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
4796 
4797  for (int row = 0; row < 3; row++)
4798  {
4799  ImGui::TableNextRow();
4800  if (row == 0)
4801  {
4802  // Setup ItemWidth once (instead of setting up every time, which is also possible but less efficient)
4803  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(0);
4804  ImGui::PushItemWidth(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 3.0f); // Small
4805  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(1);
4806  ImGui::PushItemWidth(-ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x * 0.5f);
4807  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(2);
4808  ImGui::PushItemWidth(-FLT_MIN); // Right-aligned
4809  }
4810 
4811  // Draw our contents
4812  static float dummy_f = 0.0f;
4813  ImGui::PushID(row);
4814  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(0);
4815  ImGui::SliderFloat("float0", &dummy_f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
4816  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(1);
4817  ImGui::SliderFloat("float1", &dummy_f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
4818  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(2);
4819  ImGui::SliderFloat("float2", &dummy_f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
4820  ImGui::PopID();
4821  }
4822  ImGui::EndTable();
4823  }
4824  ImGui::TreePop();
4825  }
4826 
4827  // Demonstrate using TableHeader() calls instead of TableHeadersRow()
4828  if (open_action != -1)
4829  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
4830  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Custom headers"))
4831  {
4832  const int COLUMNS_COUNT = 3;
4833  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_custom_headers", COLUMNS_COUNT, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable))
4834  {
4835  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Apricot");
4836  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Banana");
4837  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Cherry");
4838 
4839  // Dummy entire-column selection storage
4840  // FIXME: It would be nice to actually demonstrate full-featured selection using those checkbox.
4841  static bool column_selected[3] = {};
4842 
4843  // Instead of calling TableHeadersRow() we'll submit custom headers ourselves
4844  ImGui::TableNextRow(ImGuiTableRowFlags_Headers);
4845  for (int column = 0; column < COLUMNS_COUNT; column++)
4846  {
4847  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
4848  const char *column_name = ImGui::TableGetColumnName(column); // Retrieve name passed to TableSetupColumn()
4849  ImGui::PushID(column);
4850  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(0, 0));
4851  ImGui::Checkbox("##checkall", &column_selected[column]);
4852  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
4853  ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x);
4854  ImGui::TableHeader(column_name);
4855  ImGui::PopID();
4856  }
4857 
4858  for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
4859  {
4860  ImGui::TableNextRow();
4861  for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
4862  {
4863  char buf[32];
4864  sprintf(buf, "Cell %d,%d", column, row);
4865  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
4866  ImGui::Selectable(buf, column_selected[column]);
4867  }
4868  }
4869  ImGui::EndTable();
4870  }
4871  ImGui::TreePop();
4872  }
4873 
4874  // Demonstrate creating custom context menus inside columns, while playing it nice with context menus provided by TableHeadersRow()/TableHeader()
4875  if (open_action != -1)
4876  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
4877  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Context menus"))
4878  {
4879  HelpMarker("By default, right-clicking over a TableHeadersRow()/TableHeader() line will open the default context-menu.\nUsing ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody we also allow right-clicking over columns body.");
4880  static ImGuiTableFlags flags1 = ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody;
4881 
4882  PushStyleCompact();
4883  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody);
4884  PopStyleCompact();
4885 
4886  // Context Menus: first example
4887  // [1.1] Right-click on the TableHeadersRow() line to open the default table context menu.
4888  // [1.2] Right-click in columns also open the default table context menu (if ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody is set)
4889  const int COLUMNS_COUNT = 3;
4890  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_context_menu", COLUMNS_COUNT, flags1))
4891  {
4892  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");
4893  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");
4894  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");
4895 
4896  // [1.1]] Right-click on the TableHeadersRow() line to open the default table context menu.
4897  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
4898 
4899  // Submit dummy contents
4900  for (int row = 0; row < 4; row++)
4901  {
4902  ImGui::TableNextRow();
4903  for (int column = 0; column < COLUMNS_COUNT; column++)
4904  {
4905  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
4906  ImGui::Text("Cell %d,%d", column, row);
4907  }
4908  }
4909  ImGui::EndTable();
4910  }
4911 
4912  // Context Menus: second example
4913  // [2.1] Right-click on the TableHeadersRow() line to open the default table context menu.
4914  // [2.2] Right-click on the ".." to open a custom popup
4915  // [2.3] Right-click in columns to open another custom popup
4916  HelpMarker("Demonstrate mixing table context menu (over header), item context button (over button) and custom per-colum context menu (over column body).");
4917  ImGuiTableFlags flags2 = ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders;
4918  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_context_menu_2", COLUMNS_COUNT, flags2))
4919  {
4920  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");
4921  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");
4922  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");
4923 
4924  // [2.1] Right-click on the TableHeadersRow() line to open the default table context menu.
4925  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
4926  for (int row = 0; row < 4; row++)
4927  {
4928  ImGui::TableNextRow();
4929  for (int column = 0; column < COLUMNS_COUNT; column++)
4930  {
4931  // Submit dummy contents
4932  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
4933  ImGui::Text("Cell %d,%d", column, row);
4934  ImGui::SameLine();
4935 
4936  // [2.2] Right-click on the ".." to open a custom popup
4937  ImGui::PushID(row * COLUMNS_COUNT + column);
4938  ImGui::SmallButton("..");
4939  if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem())
4940  {
4941  ImGui::Text("This is the popup for Button(\"..\") in Cell %d,%d", column, row);
4942  if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
4943  ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
4944  ImGui::EndPopup();
4945  }
4946  ImGui::PopID();
4947  }
4948  }
4949 
4950  // [2.3] Right-click anywhere in columns to open another custom popup
4951  // (instead of testing for !IsAnyItemHovered() we could also call OpenPopup() with ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverExistingPopup
4952  // to manage popup priority as the popups triggers, here "are we hovering a column" are overlapping)
4953  int hovered_column = -1;
4954  for (int column = 0; column < COLUMNS_COUNT + 1; column++)
4955  {
4956  ImGui::PushID(column);
4957  if (ImGui::TableGetColumnFlags(column) & ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsHovered)
4958  hovered_column = column;
4959  if (hovered_column == column && !ImGui::IsAnyItemHovered() && ImGui::IsMouseReleased(1))
4960  ImGui::OpenPopup("MyPopup");
4961  if (ImGui::BeginPopup("MyPopup"))
4962  {
4963  if (column == COLUMNS_COUNT)
4964  ImGui::Text("This is a custom popup for unused space after the last column.");
4965  else
4966  ImGui::Text("This is a custom popup for Column %d", column);
4967  if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
4968  ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
4969  ImGui::EndPopup();
4970  }
4971  ImGui::PopID();
4972  }
4973 
4974  ImGui::EndTable();
4975  ImGui::Text("Hovered column: %d", hovered_column);
4976  }
4977  ImGui::TreePop();
4978  }
4979 
4980  // Demonstrate creating multiple tables with the same ID
4981  if (open_action != -1)
4982  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
4983  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Synced instances"))
4984  {
4985  HelpMarker("Multiple tables with the same identifier will share their settings, width, visibility, order etc.");
4986  for (int n = 0; n < 3; n++)
4987  {
4988  char buf[32];
4989  sprintf(buf, "Synced Table %d", n);
4990  bool open = ImGui::CollapsingHeader(buf, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen);
4991  if (open && ImGui::BeginTable("Table", 3, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_NoSavedSettings))
4992  {
4993  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");
4994  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");
4995  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");
4996  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
4997  for (int cell = 0; cell < 9; cell++)
4998  {
4999  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
5000  ImGui::Text("this cell %d", cell);
5001  }
5002  ImGui::EndTable();
5003  }
5004  }
5005  ImGui::TreePop();
5006  }
5007 
5008  // Demonstrate using Sorting facilities
5009  // This is a simplified version of the "Advanced" example, where we mostly focus on the code necessary to handle sorting.
5010  // Note that the "Advanced" example also showcase manually triggering a sort (e.g. if item quantities have been modified)
5011  static const char *template_items_names[] =
5012  {
5013  "Banana", "Apple", "Cherry", "Watermelon", "Grapefruit", "Strawberry", "Mango",
5014  "Kiwi", "Orange", "Pineapple", "Blueberry", "Plum", "Coconut", "Pear", "Apricot"
5015  };
5016  if (open_action != -1)
5017  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
5018  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Sorting"))
5019  {
5020  // Create item list
5021  static ImVector<MyItem> items;
5022  if (items.Size == 0)
5023  {
5024  items.resize(50, MyItem());
5025  for (int n = 0; n < items.Size; n++)
5026  {
5027  const int template_n = n % IM_ARRAYSIZE(template_items_names);
5028  MyItem &item = items[n];
5029  item.ID = n;
5030  item.Name = template_items_names[template_n];
5031  item.Quantity = (n * n - n) % 20; // Assign default quantities
5032  }
5033  }
5034 
5035  // Options
5036  static ImGuiTableFlags flags =
5037  ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable | ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable | ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti
5038  | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody
5039  | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY;
5040  PushStyleCompact();
5041  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti);
5042  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("When sorting is enabled: hold shift when clicking headers to sort on multiple column. TableGetSortSpecs() may return specs where (SpecsCount > 1).");
5043  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate);
5044  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("When sorting is enabled: allow no sorting, disable default sorting. TableGetSortSpecs() may return specs where (SpecsCount == 0).");
5045  PopStyleCompact();
5046 
5047  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_sorting", 4, flags, ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 15), 0.0f))
5048  {
5049  // Declare columns
5050  // We use the "user_id" parameter of TableSetupColumn() to specify a user id that will be stored in the sort specifications.
5051  // This is so our sort function can identify a column given our own identifier. We could also identify them based on their index!
5052  // Demonstrate using a mixture of flags among available sort-related flags:
5053  // - ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultSort
5054  // - ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSort / ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSortAscending / ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSortDescending
5055  // - ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortAscending / ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortDescending
5056  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("ID", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultSort | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_ID);
5057  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Name", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Name);
5058  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Action", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSort | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Action);
5059  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Quantity", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortDescending | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Quantity);
5060  ImGui::TableSetupScrollFreeze(0, 1); // Make row always visible
5061  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
5062 
5063  // Sort our data if sort specs have been changed!
5064  if (ImGuiTableSortSpecs *sorts_specs = ImGui::TableGetSortSpecs())
5065  if (sorts_specs->SpecsDirty)
5066  {
5067  MyItem::s_current_sort_specs = sorts_specs; // Store in variable accessible by the sort function.
5068  if (items.Size > 1)
5069  qsort(&items[0], (size_t)items.Size, sizeof(items[0]), MyItem::CompareWithSortSpecs);
5070  MyItem::s_current_sort_specs = NULL;
5071  sorts_specs->SpecsDirty = false;
5072  }
5073 
5074  // Demonstrate using clipper for large vertical lists
5075  ImGuiListClipper clipper;
5076  clipper.Begin(items.Size);
5077  while (clipper.Step())
5078  for (int row_n = clipper.DisplayStart; row_n < clipper.DisplayEnd; row_n++)
5079  {
5080  // Display a data item
5081  MyItem *item = &items[row_n];
5082  ImGui::PushID(item->ID);
5083  ImGui::TableNextRow();
5084  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
5085  ImGui::Text("%04d", item->ID);
5086  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
5087  ImGui::TextUnformatted(item->Name);
5088  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
5089  ImGui::SmallButton("None");
5090  ImGui::TableNextColumn();
5091  ImGui::Text("%d", item->Quantity);
5092  ImGui::PopID();
5093  }
5094  ImGui::EndTable();
5095  }
5096  ImGui::TreePop();
5097  }
5098 
5099  // In this example we'll expose most table flags and settings.
5100  // For specific flags and settings refer to the corresponding section for more detailed explanation.
5101  // This section is mostly useful to experiment with combining certain flags or settings with each others.
5102  //ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once); // [DEBUG]
5103  if (open_action != -1)
5104  ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
5105  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Advanced"))
5106  {
5107  static ImGuiTableFlags flags =
5108  ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable
5109  | ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable | ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti
5110  | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody
5111  | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY
5112  | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit;
5113 
5114  enum ContentsType
5115  {
5116  CT_Text, CT_Button, CT_SmallButton, CT_FillButton, CT_Selectable, CT_SelectableSpanRow
5117  };
5118  static int contents_type = CT_SelectableSpanRow;
5119  const char *contents_type_names[] = { "Text", "Button", "SmallButton", "FillButton", "Selectable", "Selectable (span row)" };
5120  static int freeze_cols = 1;
5121  static int freeze_rows = 1;
5122  static int items_count = IM_ARRAYSIZE(template_items_names) * 2;
5123  static ImVec2 outer_size_value = ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 12);
5124  static float row_min_height = 0.0f; // Auto
5125  static float inner_width_with_scroll = 0.0f; // Auto-extend
5126  static bool outer_size_enabled = true;
5127  static bool show_headers = true;
5128  static bool show_wrapped_text = false;
5129  //static ImGuiTextFilter filter;
5130  //ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once); // FIXME-TABLE: Enabling this results in initial clipped first pass on table which tend to affects column sizing
5131  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Options"))
5132  {
5133  // Make the UI compact because there are so many fields
5134  PushStyleCompact();
5135  ImGui::PushItemWidth(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 28.0f);
5136 
5137  if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Features:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))
5138  {
5139  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
5140  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable);
5141  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable);
5142  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable);
5143  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoSavedSettings", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoSavedSettings);
5144  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody);
5145  ImGui::TreePop();
5146  }
5147 
5148  if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Decorations:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))
5149  {
5150  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg);
5151  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV);
5152  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV);
5153  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV);
5154  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH);
5155  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH);
5156  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH);
5157  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable vertical borders in columns Body (borders will always appears in Headers");
5158  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable vertical borders in columns Body until hovered for resize (borders will always appears in Headers)");
5159  ImGui::TreePop();
5160  }
5161 
5162  if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Sizing:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))
5163  {
5164  EditTableSizingFlags(&flags);
5165  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("In the Advanced demo we override the policy of each column so those table-wide settings have less effect that typical.");
5166  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX);
5167  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Make outer width auto-fit to columns, overriding outer_size.x value.\n\nOnly available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled and Stretch columns are not used.");
5168  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendY);
5169  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Make outer height stop exactly at outer_size.y (prevent auto-extending table past the limit).\n\nOnly available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled. Data below the limit will be clipped and not visible.");
5170  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible);
5171  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Only available if ScrollX is disabled.");
5172  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_PreciseWidths", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_PreciseWidths);
5173  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable distributing remainder width to stretched columns (width allocation on a 100-wide table with 3 columns: Without this flag: 33,33,34. With this flag: 33,33,33). With larger number of columns, resizing will appear to be less smooth.");
5174  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoClip", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoClip);
5175  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable clipping rectangle for every individual columns (reduce draw command count, items will be able to overflow into other columns). Generally incompatible with ScrollFreeze options.");
5176  ImGui::TreePop();
5177  }
5178 
5179  if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Padding:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))
5180  {
5181  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_PadOuterX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_PadOuterX);
5182  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadOuterX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadOuterX);
5183  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadInnerX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadInnerX);
5184  ImGui::TreePop();
5185  }
5186 
5187  if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Scrolling:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))
5188  {
5189  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX);
5190  ImGui::SameLine();
5191  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFrameHeight());
5192  ImGui::DragInt("freeze_cols", &freeze_cols, 0.2f, 0, 9, NULL, ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput);
5193  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY);
5194  ImGui::SameLine();
5195  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFrameHeight());
