5196  ImGui::DragInt("freeze_rows", &freeze_rows, 0.2f, 0, 9, NULL, ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput);
5197  ImGui::TreePop();
5198  }
5199 
5200  if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Sorting:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))
5201  {
5202  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti);
5203  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("When sorting is enabled: hold shift when clicking headers to sort on multiple column. TableGetSortSpecs() may return specs where (SpecsCount > 1).");
5204  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate);
5205  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("When sorting is enabled: allow no sorting, disable default sorting. TableGetSortSpecs() may return specs where (SpecsCount == 0).");
5206  ImGui::TreePop();
5207  }
5208 
5209  if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Other:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))
5210  {
5211  ImGui::Checkbox("show_headers", &show_headers);
5212  ImGui::Checkbox("show_wrapped_text", &show_wrapped_text);
5213 
5214  ImGui::DragFloat2("##OuterSize", &outer_size_value.x);
5215  ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x);
5216  ImGui::Checkbox("outer_size", &outer_size_enabled);
5217  ImGui::SameLine();
5218  HelpMarker("If scrolling is disabled (ScrollX and ScrollY not set):\n"
5219  "- The table is output directly in the parent window.\n"
5220  "- OuterSize.x < 0.0f will right-align the table.\n"
5221  "- OuterSize.x = 0.0f will narrow fit the table unless there are any Stretch column.\n"
5222  "- OuterSize.y then becomes the minimum size for the table, which will extend vertically if there are more rows (unless NoHostExtendY is set).");
5223 
5224  // From a user point of view we will tend to use 'inner_width' differently depending on whether our table is embedding scrolling.
5225  // To facilitate toying with this demo we will actually pass 0.0f to the BeginTable() when ScrollX is disabled.
5226  ImGui::DragFloat("inner_width (when ScrollX active)", &inner_width_with_scroll, 1.0f, 0.0f, FLT_MAX);
5227 
5228  ImGui::DragFloat("row_min_height", &row_min_height, 1.0f, 0.0f, FLT_MAX);
5229  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Specify height of the Selectable item.");
5230 
5231  ImGui::DragInt("items_count", &items_count, 0.1f, 0, 9999);
5232  ImGui::Combo("items_type (first column)", &contents_type, contents_type_names, IM_ARRAYSIZE(contents_type_names));
5233  //filter.Draw("filter");
5234  ImGui::TreePop();
5235  }
5236 
5237  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
5238  PopStyleCompact();
5239  ImGui::Spacing();
5240  ImGui::TreePop();
5241  }
5242 
5243  // Update item list if we changed the number of items
5244  static ImVector<MyItem> items;
5245  static ImVector<int> selection;
5246  static bool items_need_sort = false;
5247  if (items.Size != items_count)
5248  {
5249  items.resize(items_count, MyItem());
5250  for (int n = 0; n < items_count; n++)
5251  {
5252  const int template_n = n % IM_ARRAYSIZE(template_items_names);
5253  MyItem &item = items[n];
5254  item.ID = n;
5255  item.Name = template_items_names[template_n];
5256  item.Quantity = (template_n == 3) ? 10 : (template_n == 4) ? 20 : 0; // Assign default quantities
5257  }
5258  }
5259 
5260  const ImDrawList *parent_draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
5261  const int parent_draw_list_draw_cmd_count = parent_draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size;
5262  ImVec2 table_scroll_cur, table_scroll_max; // For debug display
5263  const ImDrawList *table_draw_list = NULL; // "
5264 
5265  // Submit table
5266  const float inner_width_to_use = (flags & ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX) ? inner_width_with_scroll : 0.0f;
5267  if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_advanced", 6, flags, outer_size_enabled ? outer_size_value : ImVec2(0, 0), inner_width_to_use))
5268  {
5269  // Declare columns
5270  // We use the "user_id" parameter of TableSetupColumn() to specify a user id that will be stored in the sort specifications.
5271  // This is so our sort function can identify a column given our own identifier. We could also identify them based on their index!
5272  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("ID", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultSort | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHide, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_ID);
5273  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Name", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Name);
5274  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Action", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSort | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Action);
5275  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Quantity", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortDescending, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Quantity);
5276  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Description", (flags & ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX) ? 0 : ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Description);
5277  ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Hidden", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultHide | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSort);
5278  ImGui::TableSetupScrollFreeze(freeze_cols, freeze_rows);
5279 
5280  // Sort our data if sort specs have been changed!
5281  ImGuiTableSortSpecs *sorts_specs = ImGui::TableGetSortSpecs();
5282  if (sorts_specs && sorts_specs->SpecsDirty)
5283  items_need_sort = true;
5284  if (sorts_specs && items_need_sort && items.Size > 1)
5285  {
5286  MyItem::s_current_sort_specs = sorts_specs; // Store in variable accessible by the sort function.
5287  qsort(&items[0], (size_t)items.Size, sizeof(items[0]), MyItem::CompareWithSortSpecs);
5288  MyItem::s_current_sort_specs = NULL;
5289  sorts_specs->SpecsDirty = false;
5290  }
5291  items_need_sort = false;
5292 
5293  // Take note of whether we are currently sorting based on the Quantity field,
5294  // we will use this to trigger sorting when we know the data of this column has been modified.
5295  const bool sorts_specs_using_quantity = (ImGui::TableGetColumnFlags(3) & ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsSorted) != 0;
5296 
5297  // Show headers
5298  if (show_headers)
5299  ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
5300 
5301  // Show data
5302  // FIXME-TABLE FIXME-NAV: How we can get decent up/down even though we have the buttons here?
5303  ImGui::PushButtonRepeat(true);
5304 #if 1
5305  // Demonstrate using clipper for large vertical lists
5306  ImGuiListClipper clipper;
5307  clipper.Begin(items.Size);
5308  while (clipper.Step())
5309  {
5310  for (int row_n = clipper.DisplayStart; row_n < clipper.DisplayEnd; row_n++)
5311 #else
5312  // Without clipper
5313  {
5314  for (int row_n = 0; row_n < items.Size; row_n++)
5315 #endif
5316  {
5317  MyItem *item = &items[row_n];
5318  //if (!filter.PassFilter(item->Name))
5319  // continue;
5320 
5321  const bool item_is_selected = selection.contains(item->ID);
5322  ImGui::PushID(item->ID);
5323  ImGui::TableNextRow(ImGuiTableRowFlags_None, row_min_height);
5324 
5325  // For the demo purpose we can select among different type of items submitted in the first column
5326  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(0);
5327  char label[32];
5328  sprintf(label, "%04d", item->ID);
5329  if (contents_type == CT_Text)
5330  ImGui::TextUnformatted(label);
5331  else if (contents_type == CT_Button)
5332  ImGui::Button(label);
5333  else if (contents_type == CT_SmallButton)
5334  ImGui::SmallButton(label);
5335  else if (contents_type == CT_FillButton)
5336  ImGui::Button(label, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f));
5337  else if (contents_type == CT_Selectable || contents_type == CT_SelectableSpanRow)
5338  {
5339  ImGuiSelectableFlags selectable_flags = (contents_type == CT_SelectableSpanRow) ? ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns | ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowItemOverlap : ImGuiSelectableFlags_None;
5340  if (ImGui::Selectable(label, item_is_selected, selectable_flags, ImVec2(0, row_min_height)))
5341  {
5342  if (ImGui::GetIO().KeyCtrl)
5343  {
5344  if (item_is_selected)
5345  selection.find_erase_unsorted(item->ID);
5346  else
5347  selection.push_back(item->ID);
5348  }
5349  else
5350  {
5351  selection.clear();
5352  selection.push_back(item->ID);
5353  }
5354  }
5355  }
5356 
5357  if (ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(1))
5358  ImGui::TextUnformatted(item->Name);
5359 
5360  // Here we demonstrate marking our data set as needing to be sorted again if we modified a quantity,
5361  // and we are currently sorting on the column showing the Quantity.
5362  // To avoid triggering a sort while holding the button, we only trigger it when the button has been released.
5363  // You will probably need a more advanced system in your code if you want to automatically sort when a specific entry changes.
5364  if (ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(2))
5365  {
5366  if (ImGui::SmallButton("Chop"))
5367  {
5368  item->Quantity += 1;
5369  }
5370  if (sorts_specs_using_quantity && ImGui::IsItemDeactivated())
5371  {
5372  items_need_sort = true;
5373  }
5374  ImGui::SameLine();
5375  if (ImGui::SmallButton("Eat"))
5376  {
5377  item->Quantity -= 1;
5378  }
5379  if (sorts_specs_using_quantity && ImGui::IsItemDeactivated())
5380  {
5381  items_need_sort = true;
5382  }
5383  }
5384 
5385  if (ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(3))
5386  ImGui::Text("%d", item->Quantity);
5387 
5388  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(4);
5389  if (show_wrapped_text)
5390  ImGui::TextWrapped("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet");
5391  else
5392  ImGui::Text("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet");
5393 
5394  if (ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(5))
5395  ImGui::Text("1234");
5396 
5397  ImGui::PopID();
5398  }
5399  }
5400  ImGui::PopButtonRepeat();
5401 
5402  // Store some info to display debug details below
5403  table_scroll_cur = ImVec2(ImGui::GetScrollX(), ImGui::GetScrollY());
5404  table_scroll_max = ImVec2(ImGui::GetScrollMaxX(), ImGui::GetScrollMaxY());
5405  table_draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
5406  ImGui::EndTable();
5407  }
5408  static bool show_debug_details = false;
5409  ImGui::Checkbox("Debug details", &show_debug_details);
5410  if (show_debug_details && table_draw_list)
5411  {
5412  ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, 0.0f);
5413  const int table_draw_list_draw_cmd_count = table_draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size;
5414  if (table_draw_list == parent_draw_list)
5415  ImGui::Text(": DrawCmd: +%d (in same window)",
5416  table_draw_list_draw_cmd_count - parent_draw_list_draw_cmd_count);
5417  else
5418  ImGui::Text(": DrawCmd: +%d (in child window), Scroll: (%.f/%.f) (%.f/%.f)",
5419  table_draw_list_draw_cmd_count - 1, table_scroll_cur.x, table_scroll_max.x, table_scroll_cur.y, table_scroll_max.y);
5420  }
5421  ImGui::TreePop();
5422  }
5423 
5424  ImGui::PopID();
5425 
5426  ShowDemoWindowColumns();
5427 
5428  if (disable_indent)
5429  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
5430  }
5431 
5432  // Demonstrate old/legacy Columns API!
5433  // [2020: Columns are under-featured and not maintained. Prefer using the more flexible and powerful BeginTable() API!]
5434 static void ShowDemoWindowColumns()
5435 {
5436  bool open = ImGui::TreeNode("Legacy Columns API");
5437  ImGui::SameLine();
5438  HelpMarker("Columns() is an old API! Prefer using the more flexible and powerful BeginTable() API!");
5439  if (!open)
5440  return;
5441 
5442  // Basic columns
5443  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Basic"))
5444  {
5445  ImGui::Text("Without border:");
5446  ImGui::Columns(3, "mycolumns3", false); // 3-ways, no border
5447  ImGui::Separator();
5448  for (int n = 0; n < 14; n++)
5449  {
5450  char label[32];
5451  sprintf(label, "Item %d", n);
5452  if (ImGui::Selectable(label))
5453  {
5454  }
5455  //if (ImGui::Button(label, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN,0.0f))) {}
5456  ImGui::NextColumn();
5457  }
5458  ImGui::Columns(1);
5459  ImGui::Separator();
5460 
5461  ImGui::Text("With border:");
5462  ImGui::Columns(4, "mycolumns"); // 4-ways, with border
5463  ImGui::Separator();
5464  ImGui::Text("ID"); ImGui::NextColumn();
5465  ImGui::Text("Name"); ImGui::NextColumn();
5466  ImGui::Text("Path"); ImGui::NextColumn();
5467  ImGui::Text("Hovered"); ImGui::NextColumn();
5468  ImGui::Separator();
5469  const char *names[3] = { "One", "Two", "Three" };
5470  const char *paths[3] = { "/path/one", "/path/two", "/path/three" };
5471  static int selected = -1;
5472  for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
5473  {
5474  char label[32];
5475  sprintf(label, "%04d", i);
5476  if (ImGui::Selectable(label, selected == i, ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns))
5477  selected = i;
5478  bool hovered = ImGui::IsItemHovered();
5479  ImGui::NextColumn();
5480  ImGui::Text(names[i]); ImGui::NextColumn();
5481  ImGui::Text(paths[i]); ImGui::NextColumn();
5482  ImGui::Text("%d", hovered); ImGui::NextColumn();
5483  }
5484  ImGui::Columns(1);
5485  ImGui::Separator();
5486  ImGui::TreePop();
5487  }
5488 
5489  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Borders"))
5490  {
5491  // NB: Future columns API should allow automatic horizontal borders.
5492  static bool h_borders = true;
5493  static bool v_borders = true;
5494  static int columns_count = 4;
5495  const int lines_count = 3;
5496  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 8);
5497  ImGui::DragInt("##columns_count", &columns_count, 0.1f, 2, 10, "%d columns");
5498  if (columns_count < 2)
5499  columns_count = 2;
5500  ImGui::SameLine();
5501  ImGui::Checkbox("horizontal", &h_borders);
5502  ImGui::SameLine();
5503  ImGui::Checkbox("vertical", &v_borders);
5504  ImGui::Columns(columns_count, NULL, v_borders);
5505  for (int i = 0; i < columns_count * lines_count; i++)
5506  {
5507  if (h_borders && ImGui::GetColumnIndex() == 0)
5508  ImGui::Separator();
5509  ImGui::Text("%c%c%c", 'a' + i, 'a' + i, 'a' + i);
5510  ImGui::Text("Width %.2f", ImGui::GetColumnWidth());
5511  ImGui::Text("Avail %.2f", ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x);
5512  ImGui::Text("Offset %.2f", ImGui::GetColumnOffset());
5513  ImGui::Text("Long text that is likely to clip");
5514  ImGui::Button("Button", ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f));
5515  ImGui::NextColumn();
5516  }
5517  ImGui::Columns(1);
5518  if (h_borders)
5519  ImGui::Separator();
5520  ImGui::TreePop();
5521  }
5522 
5523  // Create multiple items in a same cell before switching to next column
5524  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Mixed items"))
5525  {
5526  ImGui::Columns(3, "mixed");
5527  ImGui::Separator();
5528 
5529  ImGui::Text("Hello");
5530  ImGui::Button("Banana");
5531  ImGui::NextColumn();
5532 
5533  ImGui::Text("ImGui");
5534  ImGui::Button("Apple");
5535  static float foo = 1.0f;
5536  ImGui::InputFloat("red", &foo, 0.05f, 0, "%.3f");
5537  ImGui::Text("An extra line here.");
5538  ImGui::NextColumn();
5539 
5540  ImGui::Text("Sailor");
5541  ImGui::Button("Corniflower");
5542  static float bar = 1.0f;
5543  ImGui::InputFloat("blue", &bar, 0.05f, 0, "%.3f");
5544  ImGui::NextColumn();
5545 
5546  if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Category A"))
5547  {
5548  ImGui::Text("Blah blah blah");
5549  } ImGui::NextColumn();
5550  if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Category B"))
5551  {
5552  ImGui::Text("Blah blah blah");
5553  } ImGui::NextColumn();
5554  if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Category C"))
5555  {
5556  ImGui::Text("Blah blah blah");
5557  } ImGui::NextColumn();
5558  ImGui::Columns(1);
5559  ImGui::Separator();
5560  ImGui::TreePop();
5561  }
5562 
5563  // Word wrapping
5564  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Word-wrapping"))
5565  {
5566  ImGui::Columns(2, "word-wrapping");
5567  ImGui::Separator();
5568  ImGui::TextWrapped("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.");
5569  ImGui::TextWrapped("Hello Left");
5570  ImGui::NextColumn();
5571  ImGui::TextWrapped("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.");
5572  ImGui::TextWrapped("Hello Right");
5573  ImGui::Columns(1);
5574  ImGui::Separator();
5575  ImGui::TreePop();
5576  }
5577 
5578  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Horizontal Scrolling"))
5579  {
5580  ImGui::SetNextWindowContentSize(ImVec2(1500.0f, 0.0f));
5581  ImVec2 child_size = ImVec2(0, ImGui::GetFontSize() * 20.0f);
5582  ImGui::BeginChild("##ScrollingRegion", child_size, false, ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar);
5583  ImGui::Columns(10);
5584 
5585  // Also demonstrate using clipper for large vertical lists
5586  int ITEMS_COUNT = 2000;
5587  ImGuiListClipper clipper;
5588  clipper.Begin(ITEMS_COUNT);
5589  while (clipper.Step())
5590  {
5591  for (int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++)
5592  for (int j = 0; j < 10; j++)
5593  {
5594  ImGui::Text("Line %d Column %d...", i, j);
5595  ImGui::NextColumn();
5596  }
5597  }
5598  ImGui::Columns(1);
5599  ImGui::EndChild();
5600  ImGui::TreePop();
5601  }
5602 
5603  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tree"))
5604  {
5605  ImGui::Columns(2, "tree", true);
5606  for (int x = 0; x < 3; x++)
5607  {
5608  bool open1 = ImGui::TreeNode((void *)(intptr_t)x, "Node%d", x);
5609  ImGui::NextColumn();
5610  ImGui::Text("Node contents");
5611  ImGui::NextColumn();
5612  if (open1)
5613  {
5614  for (int y = 0; y < 3; y++)
5615  {
5616  bool open2 = ImGui::TreeNode((void *)(intptr_t)y, "Node%d.%d", x, y);
5617  ImGui::NextColumn();
5618  ImGui::Text("Node contents");
5619  if (open2)
5620  {
5621  ImGui::Text("Even more contents");
5622  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tree in column"))
5623  {
5624  ImGui::Text("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog");
5625  ImGui::TreePop();
5626  }
5627  }
5628  ImGui::NextColumn();
5629  if (open2)
5630  ImGui::TreePop();
5631  }
5632  ImGui::TreePop();
5633  }
5634  }
5635  ImGui::Columns(1);
5636  ImGui::TreePop();
5637  }
5638 
5639  ImGui::TreePop();
5640 }
5641 
5642 static void ShowDemoWindowMisc()
5643 {
5644  if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Filtering"))
5645  {
5646  // Helper class to easy setup a text filter.
5647  // You may want to implement a more feature-full filtering scheme in your own application.
5648  static ImGuiTextFilter filter;
5649  ImGui::Text("Filter usage:\n"
5650  " \"\" display all lines\n"
5651  " \"xxx\" display lines containing \"xxx\"\n"
5652  " \"xxx,yyy\" display lines containing \"xxx\" or \"yyy\"\n"
5653  " \"-xxx\" hide lines containing \"xxx\"");
5654  filter.Draw();
5655  const char *lines[] = { "aaa1.c", "bbb1.c", "ccc1.c", "aaa2.cpp", "bbb2.cpp", "ccc2.cpp", "abc.h", "hello, world" };
5656  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(lines); i++)
5657  if (filter.PassFilter(lines[i]))
5658  ImGui::BulletText("%s", lines[i]);
5659  }
5660 
5661  if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Inputs, Navigation & Focus"))
5662  {
5663  ImGuiIO &io = ImGui::GetIO();
5664 
5665  // Display ImGuiIO output flags
5666  ImGui::Text("WantCaptureMouse: %d", io.WantCaptureMouse);
5667  ImGui::Text("WantCaptureKeyboard: %d", io.WantCaptureKeyboard);
5668  ImGui::Text("WantTextInput: %d", io.WantTextInput);
5669  ImGui::Text("WantSetMousePos: %d", io.WantSetMousePos);
5670  ImGui::Text("NavActive: %d, NavVisible: %d", io.NavActive, io.NavVisible);
5671 
5672  // Display Mouse state
5673  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Mouse State"))
5674  {
5675  if (ImGui::IsMousePosValid())
5676  ImGui::Text("Mouse pos: (%g, %g)", io.MousePos.x, io.MousePos.y);
5677  else
5678  ImGui::Text("Mouse pos: <INVALID>");
5679  ImGui::Text("Mouse delta: (%g, %g)", io.MouseDelta.x, io.MouseDelta.y);
5680  ImGui::Text("Mouse down:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.MouseDown); i++) if (ImGui::IsMouseDown(i))
5681  {
5682  ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("b%d (%.02f secs)", i, io.MouseDownDuration[i]);
5683  }
5684  ImGui::Text("Mouse clicked:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.MouseDown); i++) if (ImGui::IsMouseClicked(i))
5685  {
5686  ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("b%d", i);
5687  }
5688  ImGui::Text("Mouse dblclick:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.MouseDown); i++) if (ImGui::IsMouseDoubleClicked(i))
5689  {
5690  ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("b%d", i);
5691  }
5692  ImGui::Text("Mouse released:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.MouseDown); i++) if (ImGui::IsMouseReleased(i))
5693  {
5694  ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("b%d", i);
5695  }
5696  ImGui::Text("Mouse wheel: %.1f", io.MouseWheel);
5697  ImGui::Text("Pen Pressure: %.1f", io.PenPressure); // Note: currently unused
5698  ImGui::TreePop();
5699  }
5700 
5701  // Display Keyboard/Mouse state
5702  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Keyboard & Navigation State"))
5703  {
5704  ImGui::Text("Keys down:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.KeysDown); i++) if (ImGui::IsKeyDown(i))
5705  {
5706  ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("%d (0x%X) (%.02f secs)", i, i, io.KeysDownDuration[i]);
5707  }
5708  ImGui::Text("Keys pressed:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.KeysDown); i++) if (ImGui::IsKeyPressed(i))
5709  {
5710  ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("%d (0x%X)", i, i);
5711  }
5712  ImGui::Text("Keys release:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.KeysDown); i++) if (ImGui::IsKeyReleased(i))
5713  {
5714  ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("%d (0x%X)", i, i);
5715  }
5716  ImGui::Text("Keys mods: %s%s%s%s", io.KeyCtrl ? "CTRL " : "", io.KeyShift ? "SHIFT " : "", io.KeyAlt ? "ALT " : "", io.KeySuper ? "SUPER " : "");
5717  ImGui::Text("Chars queue:"); for (int i = 0; i < io.InputQueueCharacters.Size; i++)
5718  {
5719  ImWchar c = io.InputQueueCharacters[i]; ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("\'%c\' (0x%04X)", (c > ' ' && c <= 255) ? (char)c : '?', c);
5720  } // FIXME: We should convert 'c' to UTF-8 here but the functions are not public.
5721 
5722  ImGui::Text("NavInputs down:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.NavInputs); i++) if (io.NavInputs[i] > 0.0f)
5723  {
5724  ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("[%d] %.2f (%.02f secs)", i, io.NavInputs[i], io.NavInputsDownDuration[i]);
5725  }
5726  ImGui::Text("NavInputs pressed:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.NavInputs); i++) if (io.NavInputsDownDuration[i] == 0.0f)
5727  {
5728  ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("[%d]", i);
5729  }
5730 
5731  ImGui::Button("Hovering me sets the\nkeyboard capture flag");
5732  if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())
5733  ImGui::CaptureKeyboardFromApp(true);
5734  ImGui::SameLine();
5735  ImGui::Button("Holding me clears the\nthe keyboard capture flag");
5736  if (ImGui::IsItemActive())
5737  ImGui::CaptureKeyboardFromApp(false);
5738  ImGui::TreePop();
5739  }
5740 
5741  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tabbing"))
5742  {
5743  ImGui::Text("Use TAB/SHIFT+TAB to cycle through keyboard editable fields.");
5744  static char buf[32] = "hello";
5745  ImGui::InputText("1", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
5746  ImGui::InputText("2", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
5747  ImGui::InputText("3", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
5748  ImGui::PushAllowKeyboardFocus(false);
5749  ImGui::InputText("4 (tab skip)", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
5750  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Item won't be cycled through when using TAB or Shift+Tab.");
5751  ImGui::PopAllowKeyboardFocus();
5752  ImGui::InputText("5", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
5753  ImGui::TreePop();
5754  }
5755 
5756  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Focus from code"))
5757  {
5758  bool focus_1 = ImGui::Button("Focus on 1"); ImGui::SameLine();
5759  bool focus_2 = ImGui::Button("Focus on 2"); ImGui::SameLine();
5760  bool focus_3 = ImGui::Button("Focus on 3");
5761  int has_focus = 0;
5762  static char buf[128] = "click on a button to set focus";
5763 
5764  if (focus_1) ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere();
5765  ImGui::InputText("1", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
5766  if (ImGui::IsItemActive()) has_focus = 1;
5767 
5768  if (focus_2) ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere();
5769  ImGui::InputText("2", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
5770  if (ImGui::IsItemActive()) has_focus = 2;
5771 
5772  ImGui::PushAllowKeyboardFocus(false);
5773  if (focus_3) ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere();
5774  ImGui::InputText("3 (tab skip)", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
5775  if (ImGui::IsItemActive()) has_focus = 3;
5776  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Item won't be cycled through when using TAB or Shift+Tab.");
5777  ImGui::PopAllowKeyboardFocus();
5778 
5779  if (has_focus)
5780  ImGui::Text("Item with focus: %d", has_focus);
5781  else
5782  ImGui::Text("Item with focus: <none>");
5783 
5784  // Use >= 0 parameter to SetKeyboardFocusHere() to focus an upcoming item
5785  static float f3[3] = { 0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f };
5786  int focus_ahead = -1;
5787  if (ImGui::Button("Focus on X"))
5788  {
5789  focus_ahead = 0;
5790  } ImGui::SameLine();
5791  if (ImGui::Button("Focus on Y"))
5792  {
5793  focus_ahead = 1;
5794  } ImGui::SameLine();
5795  if (ImGui::Button("Focus on Z"))
5796  {
5797  focus_ahead = 2;
5798  }
5799  if (focus_ahead != -1) ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere(focus_ahead);
5800  ImGui::SliderFloat3("Float3", &f3[0], 0.0f, 1.0f);
5801 
5802  ImGui::TextWrapped("NB: Cursor & selection are preserved when refocusing last used item in code.");
5803  ImGui::TreePop();
5804  }
5805 
5806  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Dragging"))
5807  {
5808  ImGui::TextWrapped("You can use ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(0) to query for the dragged amount on any widget.");
5809  for (int button = 0; button < 3; button++)
5810  {
5811  ImGui::Text("IsMouseDragging(%d):", button);
5812  ImGui::Text(" w/ default threshold: %d,", ImGui::IsMouseDragging(button));
5813  ImGui::Text(" w/ zero threshold: %d,", ImGui::IsMouseDragging(button, 0.0f));
5814  ImGui::Text(" w/ large threshold: %d,", ImGui::IsMouseDragging(button, 20.0f));
5815  }
5816 
5817  ImGui::Button("Drag Me");
5818  if (ImGui::IsItemActive())
5819  ImGui::GetForegroundDrawList()->AddLine(io.MouseClickedPos[0], io.MousePos, ImGui::GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Button), 4.0f); // Draw a line between the button and the mouse cursor
5820 
5821  // Drag operations gets "unlocked" when the mouse has moved past a certain threshold
5822  // (the default threshold is stored in io.MouseDragThreshold). You can request a lower or higher
5823  // threshold using the second parameter of IsMouseDragging() and GetMouseDragDelta().
5824  ImVec2 value_raw = ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(0, 0.0f);
5825  ImVec2 value_with_lock_threshold = ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(0);
5826  ImVec2 mouse_delta = io.MouseDelta;
5827  ImGui::Text("GetMouseDragDelta(0):");
5828  ImGui::Text(" w/ default threshold: (%.1f, %.1f)", value_with_lock_threshold.x, value_with_lock_threshold.y);
5829  ImGui::Text(" w/ zero threshold: (%.1f, %.1f)", value_raw.x, value_raw.y);
5830  ImGui::Text("io.MouseDelta: (%.1f, %.1f)", mouse_delta.x, mouse_delta.y);
5831  ImGui::TreePop();
5832  }
5833 
5834  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Mouse cursors"))
5835  {
5836  const char *mouse_cursors_names[] = { "Arrow", "TextInput", "ResizeAll", "ResizeNS", "ResizeEW", "ResizeNESW", "ResizeNWSE", "Hand", "NotAllowed" };
5837  IM_ASSERT(IM_ARRAYSIZE(mouse_cursors_names) == ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT);
5838 
5839  ImGuiMouseCursor current = ImGui::GetMouseCursor();
5840  ImGui::Text("Current mouse cursor = %d: %s", current, mouse_cursors_names[current]);
5841  ImGui::Text("Hover to see mouse cursors:");
5842  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
5843  "Your application can render a different mouse cursor based on what ImGui::GetMouseCursor() returns. "
5844  "If software cursor rendering (io.MouseDrawCursor) is set ImGui will draw the right cursor for you, "
5845  "otherwise your backend needs to handle it.");
5846  for (int i = 0; i < ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT; i++)
5847  {
5848  char label[32];
5849  sprintf(label, "Mouse cursor %d: %s", i, mouse_cursors_names[i]);
5850  ImGui::Bullet(); ImGui::Selectable(label, false);
5851  if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())
5852  ImGui::SetMouseCursor(i);
5853  }
5854  ImGui::TreePop();
5855  }
5856  }
5857 }
5858 
5859 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5860 // [SECTION] About Window / ShowAboutWindow()
5861 // Access from Dear ImGui Demo -> Tools -> About
5862 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5863 
5864 void ImGui::ShowAboutWindow(bool *p_open)
5865 {
5866  if (!ImGui::Begin("About Dear ImGui", p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
5867  {
5868  ImGui::End();
5869  return;
5870  }
5871  ImGui::Text("Dear ImGui %s", ImGui::GetVersion());
5872  ImGui::Separator();
5873  ImGui::Text("By Omar Cornut and all Dear ImGui contributors.");
5874  ImGui::Text("Dear ImGui is licensed under the MIT License, see LICENSE for more information.");
5875 
5876  static bool show_config_info = false;
5877  ImGui::Checkbox("Config/Build Information", &show_config_info);
5878  if (show_config_info)
5879  {
5880  ImGuiIO &io = ImGui::GetIO();
5881  ImGuiStyle &style = ImGui::GetStyle();
5882 
5883  bool copy_to_clipboard = ImGui::Button("Copy to clipboard");
5884  ImVec2 child_size = ImVec2(0, ImGui::GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing() * 18);
5885  ImGui::BeginChildFrame(ImGui::GetID("cfg_infos"), child_size, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove);
5886  if (copy_to_clipboard)
5887  {
5888  ImGui::LogToClipboard();
5889  ImGui::LogText("```\n"); // Back quotes will make text appears without formatting when pasting on GitHub
5890  }
5891 
5892  ImGui::Text("Dear ImGui %s (%d)", IMGUI_VERSION, IMGUI_VERSION_NUM);
5893  ImGui::Separator();
5894  ImGui::Text("sizeof(size_t): %d, sizeof(ImDrawIdx): %d, sizeof(ImDrawVert): %d", (int)sizeof(size_t), (int)sizeof(ImDrawIdx), (int)sizeof(ImDrawVert));
5895  ImGui::Text("define: __cplusplus=%d", (int)__cplusplus);
5896 #ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
5897  ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS");
5898 #endif
5899 #ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_CLIPBOARD_FUNCTIONS
5900  ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_CLIPBOARD_FUNCTIONS");
5901 #endif
5902 #ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_IME_FUNCTIONS
5903  ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_IME_FUNCTIONS");
5904 #endif
5905 #ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_FUNCTIONS
5906  ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_FUNCTIONS");
5907 #endif
5908 #ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_FORMAT_FUNCTIONS
5909  ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_FORMAT_FUNCTIONS");
5910 #endif
5911 #ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_MATH_FUNCTIONS
5912  ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_MATH_FUNCTIONS");
5913 #endif
5914 #ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_FILE_FUNCTIONS
5915  ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_FILE_FUNCTIONS");
5916 #endif
5917 #ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_FILE_FUNCTIONS
5918  ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_FILE_FUNCTIONS");
5919 #endif
5920 #ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_ALLOCATORS
5921  ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_ALLOCATORS");
5922 #endif
5923 #ifdef IMGUI_USE_BGRA_PACKED_COLOR
5924  ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_USE_BGRA_PACKED_COLOR");
5925 #endif
5926 #ifdef _WIN32
5927  ImGui::Text("define: _WIN32");
5928 #endif
5929 #ifdef _WIN64
5930  ImGui::Text("define: _WIN64");
5931 #endif
5932 #ifdef __linux__
5933  ImGui::Text("define: __linux__");
5934 #endif
5935 #ifdef __APPLE__
5936  ImGui::Text("define: __APPLE__");
5937 #endif
5938 #ifdef _MSC_VER
5939  ImGui::Text("define: _MSC_VER=%d", _MSC_VER);
5940 #endif
5941 #ifdef _MSVC_LANG
5942  ImGui::Text("define: _MSVC_LANG=%d", (int)_MSVC_LANG);
5943 #endif
5944 #ifdef __MINGW32__
5945  ImGui::Text("define: __MINGW32__");
5946 #endif
5947 #ifdef __MINGW64__
5948  ImGui::Text("define: __MINGW64__");
5949 #endif
5950 #ifdef __GNUC__
5951  ImGui::Text("define: __GNUC__=%d", (int)__GNUC__);
5952 #endif
5953 #ifdef __clang_version__
5954  ImGui::Text("define: __clang_version__=%s", __clang_version__);
5955 #endif
5956  ImGui::Separator();
5957  ImGui::Text("io.BackendPlatformName: %s", io.BackendPlatformName ? io.BackendPlatformName : "NULL");
5958  ImGui::Text("io.BackendRendererName: %s", io.BackendRendererName ? io.BackendRendererName : "NULL");
5959  ImGui::Text("io.ConfigFlags: 0x%08X", io.ConfigFlags);
5960  if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) ImGui::Text(" NavEnableKeyboard");
5961  if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad) ImGui::Text(" NavEnableGamepad");
5962  if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos) ImGui::Text(" NavEnableSetMousePos");
5963  if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavNoCaptureKeyboard) ImGui::Text(" NavNoCaptureKeyboard");
5964  if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse) ImGui::Text(" NoMouse");
5965  if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouseCursorChange) ImGui::Text(" NoMouseCursorChange");
5966  if (io.MouseDrawCursor) ImGui::Text("io.MouseDrawCursor");
5967  if (io.ConfigMacOSXBehaviors) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigMacOSXBehaviors");
5968  if (io.ConfigInputTextCursorBlink) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigInputTextCursorBlink");
5969  if (io.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges");
5970  if (io.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly");
5971  if (io.ConfigMemoryCompactTimer >= 0.0f) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigMemoryCompactTimer = %.1f", io.ConfigMemoryCompactTimer);
5972  ImGui::Text("io.BackendFlags: 0x%08X", io.BackendFlags);
5973  if (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad) ImGui::Text(" HasGamepad");
5974  if (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors) ImGui::Text(" HasMouseCursors");
5975  if (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasSetMousePos) ImGui::Text(" HasSetMousePos");
5976  if (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset) ImGui::Text(" RendererHasVtxOffset");
5977  ImGui::Separator();
5978  ImGui::Text("io.Fonts: %d fonts, Flags: 0x%08X, TexSize: %d,%d", io.Fonts->Fonts.Size, io.Fonts->Flags, io.Fonts->TexWidth, io.Fonts->TexHeight);
5979  ImGui::Text("io.DisplaySize: %.2f,%.2f", io.DisplaySize.x, io.DisplaySize.y);
5980  ImGui::Text("io.DisplayFramebufferScale: %.2f,%.2f", io.DisplayFramebufferScale.x, io.DisplayFramebufferScale.y);
5981  ImGui::Separator();
5982  ImGui::Text("style.WindowPadding: %.2f,%.2f", style.WindowPadding.x, style.WindowPadding.y);
5983  ImGui::Text("style.WindowBorderSize: %.2f", style.WindowBorderSize);
5984  ImGui::Text("style.FramePadding: %.2f,%.2f", style.FramePadding.x, style.FramePadding.y);
5985  ImGui::Text("style.FrameRounding: %.2f", style.FrameRounding);
5986  ImGui::Text("style.FrameBorderSize: %.2f", style.FrameBorderSize);
5987  ImGui::Text("style.ItemSpacing: %.2f,%.2f", style.ItemSpacing.x, style.ItemSpacing.y);
5988  ImGui::Text("style.ItemInnerSpacing: %.2f,%.2f", style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, style.ItemInnerSpacing.y);
5989 
5990  if (copy_to_clipboard)
5991  {
5992  ImGui::LogText("\n```\n");
5993  ImGui::LogFinish();
5994  }
5995  ImGui::EndChildFrame();
5996  }
5997  ImGui::End();
5998 }
5999 
6000 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
6001 // [SECTION] Style Editor / ShowStyleEditor()
6002 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
6003 // - ShowFontSelector()
6004 // - ShowStyleSelector()
6005 // - ShowStyleEditor()
6006 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
6007 
6008 // Forward declare ShowFontAtlas() which isn't worth putting in public API yet
6009 namespace ImGui
6010 {
6011  IMGUI_API void ShowFontAtlas(ImFontAtlas *atlas);
6012 }
6013 
6014 // Demo helper function to select among loaded fonts.
6015 // Here we use the regular BeginCombo()/EndCombo() api which is more the more flexible one.
6016 void ImGui::ShowFontSelector(const char *label)
6017 {
6018  ImGuiIO &io = ImGui::GetIO();
6019  ImFont *font_current = ImGui::GetFont();
6020  if (ImGui::BeginCombo(label, font_current->GetDebugName()))
6021  {
6022  for (int n = 0; n < io.Fonts->Fonts.Size; n++)
6023  {
6024  ImFont *font = io.Fonts->Fonts[n];
6025  ImGui::PushID((void *)font);
6026  if (ImGui::Selectable(font->GetDebugName(), font == font_current))
6027  io.FontDefault = font;
6028  ImGui::PopID();
6029  }
6030  ImGui::EndCombo();
6031  }
6032  ImGui::SameLine();
6033  HelpMarker(
6034  "- Load additional fonts with io.Fonts->AddFontFromFileTTF().\n"
6035  "- The font atlas is built when calling io.Fonts->GetTexDataAsXXXX() or io.Fonts->Build().\n"
6036  "- Read FAQ and docs/FONTS.md for more details.\n"
6037  "- If you need to add/remove fonts at runtime (e.g. for DPI change), do it before calling NewFrame().");
6038 }
6039 
6040 // Demo helper function to select among default colors. See ShowStyleEditor() for more advanced options.
6041 // Here we use the simplified Combo() api that packs items into a single literal string.
6042 // Useful for quick combo boxes where the choices are known locally.
6043 bool ImGui::ShowStyleSelector(const char *label)
6044 {
6045  static int style_idx = -1;
6046  if (ImGui::Combo(label, &style_idx, "Dark\0Light\0Classic\0"))
6047  {
6048  switch (style_idx)
6049  {
6050  case 0: ImGui::StyleColorsDark(); break;
6051  case 1: ImGui::StyleColorsLight(); break;
6052  case 2: ImGui::StyleColorsClassic(); break;
6053  }
6054  return true;
6055  }
6056  return false;
6057 }
6058 
6059 void ImGui::ShowStyleEditor(ImGuiStyle * ref)
6060 {
6061  // You can pass in a reference ImGuiStyle structure to compare to, revert to and save to
6062  // (without a reference style pointer, we will use one compared locally as a reference)
6063  ImGuiStyle &style = ImGui::GetStyle();
6064  static ImGuiStyle ref_saved_style;
6065 
6066  // Default to using internal storage as reference
6067  static bool init = true;
6068  if (init && ref == NULL)
6069  ref_saved_style = style;
6070  init = false;
6071  if (ref == NULL)
6072  ref = &ref_saved_style;
6073 
6074  ImGui::PushItemWidth(ImGui::GetWindowWidth() * 0.50f);
6075 
6076  if (ImGui::ShowStyleSelector("Colors##Selector"))
6077  ref_saved_style = style;
6078  ImGui::ShowFontSelector("Fonts##Selector");
6079 
6080  // Simplified Settings (expose floating-pointer border sizes as boolean representing 0.0f or 1.0f)
6081  if (ImGui::SliderFloat("FrameRounding", &style.FrameRounding, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f"))
6082  style.GrabRounding = style.FrameRounding; // Make GrabRounding always the same value as FrameRounding
6083  {
6084  bool border = (style.WindowBorderSize > 0.0f); if (ImGui::Checkbox("WindowBorder", &border))
6085  {
6086  style.WindowBorderSize = border ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
6087  }
6088  }
6089  ImGui::SameLine();
6090  {
6091  bool border = (style.FrameBorderSize > 0.0f); if (ImGui::Checkbox("FrameBorder", &border))
6092  {
6093  style.FrameBorderSize = border ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
6094  }
6095  }
6096  ImGui::SameLine();
6097  {
6098  bool border = (style.PopupBorderSize > 0.0f); if (ImGui::Checkbox("PopupBorder", &border))
6099  {
6100  style.PopupBorderSize = border ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
6101  }
6102  }
6103 
6104  // Save/Revert button
6105  if (ImGui::Button("Save Ref"))
6106  *ref = ref_saved_style = style;
6107  ImGui::SameLine();
6108  if (ImGui::Button("Revert Ref"))
6109  style = *ref;
6110  ImGui::SameLine();
6111  HelpMarker(
6112  "Save/Revert in local non-persistent storage. Default Colors definition are not affected. "
6113  "Use \"Export\" below to save them somewhere.");
6114 
6115  ImGui::Separator();
6116 
6117  if (ImGui::BeginTabBar("##tabs", ImGuiTabBarFlags_None))
6118  {
6119  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Sizes"))
6120  {
6121  ImGui::Text("Main");
6122  ImGui::SliderFloat2("WindowPadding", (float *)&style.WindowPadding, 0.0f, 20.0f, "%.0f");
6123  ImGui::SliderFloat2("FramePadding", (float *)&style.FramePadding, 0.0f, 20.0f, "%.0f");
6124  ImGui::SliderFloat2("CellPadding", (float *)&style.CellPadding, 0.0f, 20.0f, "%.0f");
6125  ImGui::SliderFloat2("ItemSpacing", (float *)&style.ItemSpacing, 0.0f, 20.0f, "%.0f");
6126  ImGui::SliderFloat2("ItemInnerSpacing", (float *)&style.ItemInnerSpacing, 0.0f, 20.0f, "%.0f");
6127  ImGui::SliderFloat2("TouchExtraPadding", (float *)&style.TouchExtraPadding, 0.0f, 10.0f, "%.0f");
6128  ImGui::SliderFloat("IndentSpacing", &style.IndentSpacing, 0.0f, 30.0f, "%.0f");
6129  ImGui::SliderFloat("ScrollbarSize", &style.ScrollbarSize, 1.0f, 20.0f, "%.0f");
6130  ImGui::SliderFloat("GrabMinSize", &style.GrabMinSize, 1.0f, 20.0f, "%.0f");
6131  ImGui::Text("Borders");
6132  ImGui::SliderFloat("WindowBorderSize", &style.WindowBorderSize, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.0f");
6133  ImGui::SliderFloat("ChildBorderSize", &style.ChildBorderSize, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.0f");
6134  ImGui::SliderFloat("PopupBorderSize", &style.PopupBorderSize, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.0f");
6135  ImGui::SliderFloat("FrameBorderSize", &style.FrameBorderSize, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.0f");
6136  ImGui::SliderFloat("TabBorderSize", &style.TabBorderSize, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.0f");
6137  ImGui::Text("Rounding");
6138  ImGui::SliderFloat("WindowRounding", &style.WindowRounding, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f");
6139  ImGui::SliderFloat("ChildRounding", &style.ChildRounding, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f");
6140  ImGui::SliderFloat("FrameRounding", &style.FrameRounding, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f");
6141  ImGui::SliderFloat("PopupRounding", &style.PopupRounding, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f");
6142  ImGui::SliderFloat("ScrollbarRounding", &style.ScrollbarRounding, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f");
6143  ImGui::SliderFloat("GrabRounding", &style.GrabRounding, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f");
6144  ImGui::SliderFloat("LogSliderDeadzone", &style.LogSliderDeadzone, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f");
6145  ImGui::SliderFloat("TabRounding", &style.TabRounding, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f");
6146  ImGui::Text("Alignment");
6147  ImGui::SliderFloat2("WindowTitleAlign", (float *)&style.WindowTitleAlign, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.2f");
6148  int window_menu_button_position = style.WindowMenuButtonPosition + 1;
6149  if (ImGui::Combo("WindowMenuButtonPosition", (int *)&window_menu_button_position, "None\0Left\0Right\0"))
6150  style.WindowMenuButtonPosition = window_menu_button_position - 1;
6151  ImGui::Combo("ColorButtonPosition", (int *)&style.ColorButtonPosition, "Left\0Right\0");
6152  ImGui::SliderFloat2("ButtonTextAlign", (float *)&style.ButtonTextAlign, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.2f");
6153  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Alignment applies when a button is larger than its text content.");
6154  ImGui::SliderFloat2("SelectableTextAlign", (float *)&style.SelectableTextAlign, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.2f");
6155  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Alignment applies when a selectable is larger than its text content.");
6156  ImGui::Text("Safe Area Padding");
6157  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Adjust if you cannot see the edges of your screen (e.g. on a TV where scaling has not been configured).");
6158  ImGui::SliderFloat2("DisplaySafeAreaPadding", (float *)&style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding, 0.0f, 30.0f, "%.0f");
6159  ImGui::EndTabItem();
6160  }
6161 
6162  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Colors"))
6163  {
6164  static int output_dest = 0;
6165  static bool output_only_modified = true;
6166  if (ImGui::Button("Export"))
6167  {
6168  if (output_dest == 0)
6169  ImGui::LogToClipboard();
6170  else
6171  ImGui::LogToTTY();
6172  ImGui::LogText("ImVec4* colors = ImGui::GetStyle().Colors;" IM_NEWLINE);
6173  for (int i = 0; i < ImGuiCol_COUNT; i++)
6174  {
6175  const ImVec4 &col = style.Colors[i];
6176  const char *name = ImGui::GetStyleColorName(i);
6177  if (!output_only_modified || memcmp(&col, &ref->Colors[i], sizeof(ImVec4)) != 0)
6178  ImGui::LogText("colors[ImGuiCol_%s]%*s= ImVec4(%.2ff, %.2ff, %.2ff, %.2ff);" IM_NEWLINE,
6179  name, 23 - (int)strlen(name), "", col.x, col.y, col.z, col.w);
6180  }
6181  ImGui::LogFinish();
6182  }
6183  ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(120); ImGui::Combo("##output_type", &output_dest, "To Clipboard\0To TTY\0");
6184  ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Checkbox("Only Modified Colors", &output_only_modified);
6185 
6186  static ImGuiTextFilter filter;
6187  filter.Draw("Filter colors", ImGui::GetFontSize() * 16);
6188 
6189  static ImGuiColorEditFlags alpha_flags = 0;
6190  if (ImGui::RadioButton("Opaque", alpha_flags == ImGuiColorEditFlags_None))
6191  {
6192  alpha_flags = ImGuiColorEditFlags_None;
6193  } ImGui::SameLine();
6194  if (ImGui::RadioButton("Alpha", alpha_flags == ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview))
6195  {
6196  alpha_flags = ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview;
6197  } ImGui::SameLine();
6198  if (ImGui::RadioButton("Both", alpha_flags == ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf))
6199  {
6200  alpha_flags = ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf;
6201  } ImGui::SameLine();
6202  HelpMarker(
6203  "In the color list:\n"
6204  "Left-click on color square to open color picker,\n"
6205  "Right-click to open edit options menu.");
6206 
6207  ImGui::BeginChild("##colors", ImVec2(0, 0), true, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysHorizontalScrollbar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened);
6208  ImGui::PushItemWidth(-160);
6209  for (int i = 0; i < ImGuiCol_COUNT; i++)
6210  {
6211  const char *name = ImGui::GetStyleColorName(i);
6212  if (!filter.PassFilter(name))
6213  continue;
6214  ImGui::PushID(i);
6215  ImGui::ColorEdit4("##color", (float *)&style.Colors[i], ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar | alpha_flags);
6216  if (memcmp(&style.Colors[i], &ref->Colors[i], sizeof(ImVec4)) != 0)
6217  {
6218  // Tips: in a real user application, you may want to merge and use an icon font into the main font,
6219  // so instead of "Save"/"Revert" you'd use icons!
6220  // Read the FAQ and docs/FONTS.md about using icon fonts. It's really easy and super convenient!
6221  ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x); if (ImGui::Button("Save"))
6222  {
6223  ref->Colors[i] = style.Colors[i];
6224  }
6225  ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x); if (ImGui::Button("Revert"))
6226  {
6227  style.Colors[i] = ref->Colors[i];
6228  }
6229  }
6230  ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
6231  ImGui::TextUnformatted(name);
6232  ImGui::PopID();
6233  }
6234  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
6235  ImGui::EndChild();
6236 
6237  ImGui::EndTabItem();
6238  }
6239 
6240  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Fonts"))
6241  {
6242  ImGuiIO &io = ImGui::GetIO();
6243  ImFontAtlas *atlas = io.Fonts;
6244  HelpMarker("Read FAQ and docs/FONTS.md for details on font loading.");
6245  ImGui::ShowFontAtlas(atlas);
6246 
6247  // Post-baking font scaling. Note that this is NOT the nice way of scaling fonts, read below.
6248  // (we enforce hard clamping manually as by default DragFloat/SliderFloat allows CTRL+Click text to get out of bounds).
6249  const float MIN_SCALE = 0.3f;
6250  const float MAX_SCALE = 2.0f;
6251  HelpMarker(
6252  "Those are old settings provided for convenience.\n"
6253  "However, the _correct_ way of scaling your UI is currently to reload your font at the designed size, "
6254  "rebuild the font atlas, and call style.ScaleAllSizes() on a reference ImGuiStyle structure.\n"
6255  "Using those settings here will give you poor quality results.");
6256  static float window_scale = 1.0f;
6257  ImGui::PushItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 8);
6258  if (ImGui::DragFloat("window scale", &window_scale, 0.005f, MIN_SCALE, MAX_SCALE, "%.2f", ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp)) // Scale only this window
6259  ImGui::SetWindowFontScale(window_scale);
6260  ImGui::DragFloat("global scale", &io.FontGlobalScale, 0.005f, MIN_SCALE, MAX_SCALE, "%.2f", ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp); // Scale everything
6261  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
6262 
6263  ImGui::EndTabItem();
6264  }
6265 
6266  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Rendering"))
6267  {
6268  ImGui::Checkbox("Anti-aliased lines", &style.AntiAliasedLines);
6269  ImGui::SameLine();
6270  HelpMarker("When disabling anti-aliasing lines, you'll probably want to disable borders in your style as well.");
6271 
6272  ImGui::Checkbox("Anti-aliased lines use texture", &style.AntiAliasedLinesUseTex);
6273  ImGui::SameLine();
6274  HelpMarker("Faster lines using texture data. Require backend to render with bilinear filtering (not point/nearest filtering).");
6275 
6276  ImGui::Checkbox("Anti-aliased fill", &style.AntiAliasedFill);
6277  ImGui::PushItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 8);
6278  ImGui::DragFloat("Curve Tessellation Tolerance", &style.CurveTessellationTol, 0.02f, 0.10f, 10.0f, "%.2f");
6279  if (style.CurveTessellationTol < 0.10f) style.CurveTessellationTol = 0.10f;
6280 
6281  // When editing the "Circle Segment Max Error" value, draw a preview of its effect on auto-tessellated circles.
6282  ImGui::DragFloat("Circle Tessellation Max Error", &style.CircleTessellationMaxError, 0.005f, 0.10f, 5.0f, "%.2f", ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp);
6283  if (ImGui::IsItemActive())
6284  {
6285  ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos());
6286  ImGui::BeginTooltip();
6287  ImGui::TextUnformatted("(R = radius, N = number of segments)");
6288  ImGui::Spacing();
6289  ImDrawList *draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
6290  const float min_widget_width = ImGui::CalcTextSize("N: MMM\nR: MMM").x;
6291  for (int n = 0; n < 8; n++)
6292  {
6293  const float RAD_MIN = 5.0f;
6294  const float RAD_MAX = 70.0f;
6295  const float rad = RAD_MIN + (RAD_MAX - RAD_MIN) * (float)n / (8.0f - 1.0f);
6296 
6297  ImGui::BeginGroup();
6298 
6299  ImGui::Text("R: %.f\nN: %d", rad, draw_list->_CalcCircleAutoSegmentCount(rad));
6300 
6301  const float canvas_width = IM_MAX(min_widget_width, rad * 2.0f);
6302  const float offset_x = floorf(canvas_width * 0.5f);
6303  const float offset_y = floorf(RAD_MAX);
6304 
6305  const ImVec2 p1 = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
6306  draw_list->AddCircle(ImVec2(p1.x + offset_x, p1.y + offset_y), rad, ImGui::GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text));
6307  ImGui::Dummy(ImVec2(canvas_width, RAD_MAX * 2));
6308 
6309  /*
6310  const ImVec2 p2 = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
6311  draw_list->AddCircleFilled(ImVec2(p2.x + offset_x, p2.y + offset_y), rad, ImGui::GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text));
6312  ImGui::Dummy(ImVec2(canvas_width, RAD_MAX * 2));
6313  */
6314 
6315  ImGui::EndGroup();
6316  ImGui::SameLine();
6317  }
6318  ImGui::EndTooltip();
6319  }
6320  ImGui::SameLine();
6321  HelpMarker("When drawing circle primitives with \"num_segments == 0\" tesselation will be calculated automatically.");
6322 
6323  ImGui::DragFloat("Global Alpha", &style.Alpha, 0.005f, 0.20f, 1.0f, "%.2f"); // Not exposing zero here so user doesn't "lose" the UI (zero alpha clips all widgets). But application code could have a toggle to switch between zero and non-zero.
6324  ImGui::DragFloat("Disabled Alpha", &style.DisabledAlpha, 0.005f, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.2f"); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Additional alpha multiplier for disabled items (multiply over current value of Alpha).");
6325  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
6326 
6327  ImGui::EndTabItem();
6328  }
6329 
6330  ImGui::EndTabBar();
6331  }
6332 
6333  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
6334 }
6335 
6336 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
6337 // [SECTION] Example App: Main Menu Bar / ShowExampleAppMainMenuBar()
6338 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
6339 // - ShowExampleAppMainMenuBar()
6340 // - ShowExampleMenuFile()
6341 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
6342 
6343 // Demonstrate creating a "main" fullscreen menu bar and populating it.
6344 // Note the difference between BeginMainMenuBar() and BeginMenuBar():
6345 // - BeginMenuBar() = menu-bar inside current window (which needs the ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar flag!)
6346 // - BeginMainMenuBar() = helper to create menu-bar-sized window at the top of the main viewport + call BeginMenuBar() into it.
6347 static void ShowExampleAppMainMenuBar()
6348 {
6349  if (ImGui::BeginMainMenuBar())
6350  {
6351  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("File"))
6352  {
6353  ShowExampleMenuFile();
6354  ImGui::EndMenu();
6355  }
6356  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Edit"))
6357  {
6358  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Undo", "CTRL+Z"))
6359  {
6360  }
6361  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Redo", "CTRL+Y", false, false))
6362  {
6363  } // Disabled item
6364  ImGui::Separator();
6365  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Cut", "CTRL+X"))
6366  {
6367  }
6368  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Copy", "CTRL+C"))
6369  {
6370  }
6371  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Paste", "CTRL+V"))
6372  {
6373  }
6374  ImGui::EndMenu();
6375  }
6376  ImGui::EndMainMenuBar();
6377  }
6378 }
6379 
6380 // Note that shortcuts are currently provided for display only
6381 // (future version will add explicit flags to BeginMenu() to request processing shortcuts)
6382 static void ShowExampleMenuFile()
6383 {
6384  ImGui::MenuItem("(demo menu)", NULL, false, false);
6385  if (ImGui::MenuItem("New"))
6386  {
6387  }
6388  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Open", "Ctrl+O"))
6389  {
6390  }
6391  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Open Recent"))
6392  {
6393  ImGui::MenuItem("fish_hat.c");
6394  ImGui::MenuItem("fish_hat.inl");
6395  ImGui::MenuItem("fish_hat.h");
6396  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("More.."))
6397  {
6398  ImGui::MenuItem("Hello");
6399  ImGui::MenuItem("Sailor");
6400  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Recurse.."))
6401  {
6402  ShowExampleMenuFile();
6403  ImGui::EndMenu();
6404  }
6405  ImGui::EndMenu();
6406  }
6407  ImGui::EndMenu();
6408  }
6409  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Save", "Ctrl+S"))
6410  {
6411  }
6412  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Save As.."))
6413  {
6414  }
6415 
6416  ImGui::Separator();
6417  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Options"))
6418  {
6419  static bool enabled = true;
6420  ImGui::MenuItem("Enabled", "", &enabled);
6421  ImGui::BeginChild("child", ImVec2(0, 60), true);
6422  for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++)
6423  ImGui::Text("Scrolling Text %d", i);
6424  ImGui::EndChild();
6425  static float f = 0.5f;
6426  static int n = 0;
6427  ImGui::SliderFloat("Value", &f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
6428  ImGui::InputFloat("Input", &f, 0.1f);
6429  ImGui::Combo("Combo", &n, "Yes\0No\0Maybe\0\0");
6430  ImGui::EndMenu();
6431  }
6432 
6433  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Colors"))
6434  {
6435  float sz = ImGui::GetTextLineHeight();
6436  for (int i = 0; i < ImGuiCol_COUNT; i++)
6437  {
6438  const char *name = ImGui::GetStyleColorName((ImGuiCol)i);
6439  ImVec2 p = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
6440  ImGui::GetWindowDrawList()->AddRectFilled(p, ImVec2(p.x + sz, p.y + sz), ImGui::GetColorU32((ImGuiCol)i));
6441  ImGui::Dummy(ImVec2(sz, sz));
6442  ImGui::SameLine();
6443  ImGui::MenuItem(name);
6444  }
6445  ImGui::EndMenu();
6446  }
6447 
6448  // Here we demonstrate appending again to the "Options" menu (which we already created above)
6449  // Of course in this demo it is a little bit silly that this function calls BeginMenu("Options") twice.
6450  // In a real code-base using it would make senses to use this feature from very different code locations.
6451  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Options")) // <-- Append!
6452  {
6453  static bool b = true;
6454  ImGui::Checkbox("SomeOption", &b);
6455  ImGui::EndMenu();
6456  }
6457 
6458  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Disabled", false)) // Disabled
6459  {
6460  IM_ASSERT(0);
6461  }
6462  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Checked", NULL, true))
6463  {
6464  }
6465  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Quit", "Alt+F4"))
6466  {
6467  }
6468 }
6469 
6470 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
6471 // [SECTION] Example App: Debug Console / ShowExampleAppConsole()
6472 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
6473 
6474 // Demonstrate creating a simple console window, with scrolling, filtering, completion and history.
6475 // For the console example, we are using a more C++ like approach of declaring a class to hold both data and functions.
6476 struct ExampleAppConsole
6477 {
6478  char InputBuf[256];
6479  ImVector<char *> Items;
6480  ImVector<const char *> Commands;
6481  ImVector<char *> History;
6482  int HistoryPos; // -1: new line, 0..History.Size-1 browsing history.
6483  ImGuiTextFilter Filter;
6484  bool AutoScroll;
6485  bool ScrollToBottom;
6486 
6487  ExampleAppConsole()
6488  {
6489  ClearLog();
6490  memset(InputBuf, 0, sizeof(InputBuf));
6491  HistoryPos = -1;
6492 
6493  // "CLASSIFY" is here to provide the test case where "C"+[tab] completes to "CL" and display multiple matches.
6494  Commands.push_back("HELP");
6495  Commands.push_back("HISTORY");
6496  Commands.push_back("CLEAR");
6497  Commands.push_back("CLASSIFY");
6498  AutoScroll = true;
6499  ScrollToBottom = false;
6500  AddLog("Welcome to Dear ImGui!");
6501  }
6502  ~ExampleAppConsole()
6503  {
6504  ClearLog();
6505  for (int i = 0; i < History.Size; i++)
6506  free(History[i]);
6507  }
6508 
6509  // Portable helpers
6510  static int Stricmp(const char *s1, const char *s2)
6511  {
6512  int d; while ((d = toupper(*s2) - toupper(*s1)) == 0 && *s1)
6513  {
6514  s1++; s2++;
6515  } return d;
6516  }
6517  static int Strnicmp(const char *s1, const char *s2, int n)
6518  {
6519  int d = 0; while (n > 0 && (d = toupper(*s2) - toupper(*s1)) == 0 && *s1)
6520  {
6521  s1++; s2++; n--;
6522  } return d;
6523  }
6524  static char *Strdup(const char *s)
6525  {
6526  IM_ASSERT(s); size_t len = strlen(s) + 1; void *buf = malloc(len); IM_ASSERT(buf); return (char *)memcpy(buf, (const void *)s, len);
6527  }
6528  static void Strtrim(char *s)
6529  {
6530  char *str_end = s + strlen(s); while (str_end > s && str_end[-1] == ' ') str_end--; *str_end = 0;
6531  }
6532 
6533  void ClearLog()
6534  {
6535  for (int i = 0; i < Items.Size; i++)
6536  free(Items[i]);
6537  Items.clear();
6538  }
6539 
6540  void AddLog(const char *fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(2)
6541  {
6542  // FIXME-OPT
6543  char buf[1024];
6544  va_list args;
6545  va_start(args, fmt);
6546  vsnprintf(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), fmt, args);
6547  buf[IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf) - 1] = 0;
6548  va_end(args);
6549  Items.push_back(Strdup(buf));
6550  }
6551 
6552  void Draw(const char *title, bool *p_open)
6553  {
6554  ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(520, 600), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
6555  if (!ImGui::Begin(title, p_open))
6556  {
6557  ImGui::End();
6558  return;
6559  }
6560 
6561  // As a specific feature guaranteed by the library, after calling Begin() the last Item represent the title bar.
6562  // So e.g. IsItemHovered() will return true when hovering the title bar.
6563  // Here we create a context menu only available from the title bar.
6564  if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem())
6565  {
6566  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Close Console"))
6567  *p_open = false;
6568  ImGui::EndPopup();
6569  }
6570 
6571  ImGui::TextWrapped(
6572  "This example implements a console with basic coloring, completion (TAB key) and history (Up/Down keys). A more elaborate "
6573  "implementation may want to store entries along with extra data such as timestamp, emitter, etc.");
6574  ImGui::TextWrapped("Enter 'HELP' for help.");
6575 
6576  // TODO: display items starting from the bottom
6577 
6578  if (ImGui::SmallButton("Add Debug Text"))
6579  {
6580  AddLog("%d some text", Items.Size); AddLog("some more text"); AddLog("display very important message here!");
6581  }
6582  ImGui::SameLine();
6583  if (ImGui::SmallButton("Add Debug Error"))
6584  {
6585  AddLog("[error] something went wrong");
6586  }
6587  ImGui::SameLine();
6588  if (ImGui::SmallButton("Clear"))
6589  {
6590  ClearLog();
6591  }
6592  ImGui::SameLine();
6593  bool copy_to_clipboard = ImGui::SmallButton("Copy");
6594  //static float t = 0.0f; if (ImGui::GetTime() - t > 0.02f) { t = ImGui::GetTime(); AddLog("Spam %f", t); }
6595 
6596  ImGui::Separator();
6597 
6598  // Options menu
6599  if (ImGui::BeginPopup("Options"))
6600  {
6601  ImGui::Checkbox("Auto-scroll", &AutoScroll);
6602  ImGui::EndPopup();
6603  }
6604 
6605  // Options, Filter
6606  if (ImGui::Button("Options"))
6607  ImGui::OpenPopup("Options");
6608  ImGui::SameLine();
6609  Filter.Draw("Filter (\"incl,-excl\") (\"error\")", 180);
6610  ImGui::Separator();
6611 
6612  // Reserve enough left-over height for 1 separator + 1 input text
6613  const float footer_height_to_reserve = ImGui::GetStyle().ItemSpacing.y + ImGui::GetFrameHeightWithSpacing();
6614  ImGui::BeginChild("ScrollingRegion", ImVec2(0, -footer_height_to_reserve), false, ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar);
6615  if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextWindow())
6616  {
6617  if (ImGui::Selectable("Clear")) ClearLog();
6618  ImGui::EndPopup();
6619  }
6620 
6621  // Display every line as a separate entry so we can change their color or add custom widgets.
6622  // If you only want raw text you can use ImGui::TextUnformatted(log.begin(), log.end());
6623  // NB- if you have thousands of entries this approach may be too inefficient and may require user-side clipping
6624  // to only process visible items. The clipper will automatically measure the height of your first item and then
6625  // "seek" to display only items in the visible area.
6626  // To use the clipper we can replace your standard loop:
6627  // for (int i = 0; i < Items.Size; i++)
6628  // With:
6629  // ImGuiListClipper clipper;
6630  // clipper.Begin(Items.Size);
6631  // while (clipper.Step())
6632  // for (int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++)
6633  // - That your items are evenly spaced (same height)
6634  // - That you have cheap random access to your elements (you can access them given their index,
6635  // without processing all the ones before)
6636  // You cannot this code as-is if a filter is active because it breaks the 'cheap random-access' property.
6637  // We would need random-access on the post-filtered list.
6638  // A typical application wanting coarse clipping and filtering may want to pre-compute an array of indices
6639  // or offsets of items that passed the filtering test, recomputing this array when user changes the filter,
6640  // and appending newly elements as they are inserted. This is left as a task to the user until we can manage
6641  // to improve this example code!
6642  // If your items are of variable height:
6643  // - Split them into same height items would be simpler and facilitate random-seeking into your list.
6644  // - Consider using manual call to IsRectVisible() and skipping extraneous decoration from your items.
6645  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(4, 1)); // Tighten spacing
6646  if (copy_to_clipboard)
6647  ImGui::LogToClipboard();
6648  for (int i = 0; i < Items.Size; i++)
6649  {
6650  const char *item = Items[i];
6651  if (!Filter.PassFilter(item))
6652  continue;
6653 
6654  // Normally you would store more information in your item than just a string.
6655  // (e.g. make Items[] an array of structure, store color/type etc.)
6656  ImVec4 color;
6657  bool has_color = false;
6658  if (strstr(item, "[error]"))
6659  {
6660  color = ImVec4(1.0f, 0.4f, 0.4f, 1.0f); has_color = true;
6661  }
6662  else if (strncmp(item, "# ", 2) == 0)
6663  {
6664  color = ImVec4(1.0f, 0.8f, 0.6f, 1.0f); has_color = true;
6665  }
6666  if (has_color)
6667  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, color);
6668  ImGui::TextUnformatted(item);
6669  if (has_color)
6670  ImGui::PopStyleColor();
6671  }
6672  if (copy_to_clipboard)
6673  ImGui::LogFinish();
6674 
6675  if (ScrollToBottom || (AutoScroll && ImGui::GetScrollY() >= ImGui::GetScrollMaxY()))
6676  ImGui::SetScrollHereY(1.0f);
6677  ScrollToBottom = false;
6678 
6679  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
6680  ImGui::EndChild();
6681  ImGui::Separator();
6682 
6683  // Command-line
6684  bool reclaim_focus = false;
6685  ImGuiInputTextFlags input_text_flags = ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory;
6686  if (ImGui::InputText("Input", InputBuf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(InputBuf), input_text_flags, &TextEditCallbackStub, (void *)this))
6687  {
6688  char *s = InputBuf;
6689  Strtrim(s);
6690  if (s[0])
6691  ExecCommand(s);
6692  strcpy(s, "");
6693  reclaim_focus = true;
6694  }
6695 
6696  // Auto-focus on window apparition
6697  ImGui::SetItemDefaultFocus();
6698  if (reclaim_focus)
6699  ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere(-1); // Auto focus previous widget
6700 
6701  ImGui::End();
6702  }
6703 
6704  void ExecCommand(const char *command_line)
6705  {
6706  AddLog("# %s\n", command_line);
6707 
6708  // Insert into history. First find match and delete it so it can be pushed to the back.
6709  // This isn't trying to be smart or optimal.
6710  HistoryPos = -1;
6711  for (int i = History.Size - 1; i >= 0; i--)
6712  if (Stricmp(History[i], command_line) == 0)
6713  {
6714  free(History[i]);
6715  History.erase(History.begin() + i);
6716  break;
6717  }
6718  History.push_back(Strdup(command_line));
6719 
6720  // Process command
6721  if (Stricmp(command_line, "CLEAR") == 0)
6722  {
6723  ClearLog();
6724  }
6725  else if (Stricmp(command_line, "HELP") == 0)
6726  {
6727  AddLog("Commands:");
6728  for (int i = 0; i < Commands.Size; i++)
6729  AddLog("- %s", Commands[i]);
6730  }
6731  else if (Stricmp(command_line, "HISTORY") == 0)
6732  {
6733  int first = History.Size - 10;
6734  for (int i = first > 0 ? first : 0; i < History.Size; i++)
6735  AddLog("%3d: %s\n", i, History[i]);
6736  }
6737  else
6738  {
6739  AddLog("Unknown command: '%s'\n", command_line);
6740  }
6741 
6742  // On command input, we scroll to bottom even if AutoScroll==false
6743  ScrollToBottom = true;
6744  }
6745 
6746  // In C++11 you'd be better off using lambdas for this sort of forwarding callbacks
6747  static int TextEditCallbackStub(ImGuiInputTextCallbackData *data)
6748  {
6749  ExampleAppConsole *console = (ExampleAppConsole *)data->UserData;
6750  return console->TextEditCallback(data);
6751  }
6752 
6753  int TextEditCallback(ImGuiInputTextCallbackData *data)
6754  {
6755  //AddLog("cursor: %d, selection: %d-%d", data->CursorPos, data->SelectionStart, data->SelectionEnd);
6756  switch (data->EventFlag)
6757  {
6758  case ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion:
6759  {
6760  // Example of TEXT COMPLETION
6761 
6762  // Locate beginning of current word
6763  const char *word_end = data->Buf + data->CursorPos;
6764  const char *word_start = word_end;
6765  while (word_start > data->Buf)
6766  {
6767  const char c = word_start[-1];
6768  if (c == ' ' || c == '\t' || c == ',' || c == ';')
6769  break;
6770  word_start--;
6771  }
6772 
6773  // Build a list of candidates
6774  ImVector<const char *> candidates;
6775  for (int i = 0; i < Commands.Size; i++)
6776  if (Strnicmp(Commands[i], word_start, (int)(word_end - word_start)) == 0)
6777  candidates.push_back(Commands[i]);
6778 
6779  if (candidates.Size == 0)
6780  {
6781  // No match
6782  AddLog("No match for \"%.*s\"!\n", (int)(word_end - word_start), word_start);
6783  }
6784  else if (candidates.Size == 1)
6785  {
6786  // Single match. Delete the beginning of the word and replace it entirely so we've got nice casing.
6787  data->DeleteChars((int)(word_start - data->Buf), (int)(word_end - word_start));
6788  data->InsertChars(data->CursorPos, candidates[0]);
6789  data->InsertChars(data->CursorPos, " ");
6790  }
6791  else
6792  {
6793  // Multiple matches. Complete as much as we can..
6794  // So inputing "C"+Tab will complete to "CL" then display "CLEAR" and "CLASSIFY" as matches.
6795  int match_len = (int)(word_end - word_start);
6796  for (;;)
6797  {
6798  int c = 0;
6799  bool all_candidates_matches = true;
6800  for (int i = 0; i < candidates.Size && all_candidates_matches; i++)
6801  if (i == 0)
6802  c = toupper(candidates[i][match_len]);
6803  else if (c == 0 || c != toupper(candidates[i][match_len]))
6804  all_candidates_matches = false;
6805  if (!all_candidates_matches)
6806  break;
6807  match_len++;
6808  }
6809 
6810  if (match_len > 0)
6811  {
6812  data->DeleteChars((int)(word_start - data->Buf), (int)(word_end - word_start));
6813  data->InsertChars(data->CursorPos, candidates[0], candidates[0] + match_len);
6814  }
6815 
6816  // List matches
6817  AddLog("Possible matches:\n");
6818  for (int i = 0; i < candidates.Size; i++)
6819  AddLog("- %s\n", candidates[i]);
6820  }
6821 
6822  break;
6823  }
6824  case ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory:
6825  {
6826  // Example of HISTORY
6827  const int prev_history_pos = HistoryPos;
6828  if (data->EventKey == ImGuiKey_UpArrow)
6829  {
6830  if (HistoryPos == -1)
6831  HistoryPos = History.Size - 1;
6832  else if (HistoryPos > 0)
6833  HistoryPos--;
6834  }
6835  else if (data->EventKey == ImGuiKey_DownArrow)
6836  {
6837  if (HistoryPos != -1)
6838  if (++HistoryPos >= History.Size)
6839  HistoryPos = -1;
6840  }
6841 
6842  // A better implementation would preserve the data on the current input line along with cursor position.
6843  if (prev_history_pos != HistoryPos)
6844  {
6845  const char *history_str = (HistoryPos >= 0) ? History[HistoryPos] : "";
6846  data->DeleteChars(0, data->BufTextLen);
6847  data->InsertChars(0, history_str);
6848  }
6849  }
6850  }
6851  return 0;
6852  }
6853 };
6854 
6855 static void ShowExampleAppConsole(bool *p_open)
6856 {
6857  static ExampleAppConsole console;
6858  console.Draw("Example: Console", p_open);
6859 }
6860 
6861 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
6862 // [SECTION] Example App: Debug Log / ShowExampleAppLog()
6863 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
6864 
6865 // Usage:
6866 // static ExampleAppLog my_log;
6867 // my_log.AddLog("Hello %d world\n", 123);
6868 // my_log.Draw("title");
6869 struct ExampleAppLog
6870 {
6871  ImGuiTextBuffer Buf;
6872  ImGuiTextFilter Filter;
6873  ImVector<int> LineOffsets; // Index to lines offset. We maintain this with AddLog() calls.
6874  bool AutoScroll; // Keep scrolling if already at the bottom.
6875 
6876  ExampleAppLog()
6877  {
6878  AutoScroll = true;
6879  Clear();
6880  }
6881 
6882  void Clear()
6883  {
6884  Buf.clear();
6885  LineOffsets.clear();
6886  LineOffsets.push_back(0);
6887  }
6888 
6889  void AddLog(const char *fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(2)
6890  {
6891  int old_size = Buf.size();
6892  va_list args;
6893  va_start(args, fmt);
6894  Buf.appendfv(fmt, args);
6895  va_end(args);
6896  for (int new_size = Buf.size(); old_size < new_size; old_size++)
6897  if (Buf[old_size] == '\n')
6898  LineOffsets.push_back(old_size + 1);
6899  }
6900 
6901  void Draw(const char *title, bool *p_open = NULL)
6902  {
6903  if (!ImGui::Begin(title, p_open))
6904  {
6905  ImGui::End();
6906  return;
6907  }
6908 
6909  // Options menu
6910  if (ImGui::BeginPopup("Options"))
6911  {
6912  ImGui::Checkbox("Auto-scroll", &AutoScroll);
6913  ImGui::EndPopup();
6914  }
6915 
6916  // Main window
6917  if (ImGui::Button("Options"))
6918  ImGui::OpenPopup("Options");
6919  ImGui::SameLine();
6920  bool clear = ImGui::Button("Clear");
6921  ImGui::SameLine();
6922  bool copy = ImGui::Button("Copy");
6923  ImGui::SameLine();
6924  Filter.Draw("Filter", -100.0f);
6925 
6926  ImGui::Separator();
6927  ImGui::BeginChild("scrolling", ImVec2(0, 0), false, ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar);
6928 
6929  if (clear)
6930  Clear();
6931  if (copy)
6932  ImGui::LogToClipboard();
6933 
6934  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(0, 0));
6935  const char *buf = Buf.begin();
6936  const char *buf_end = Buf.end();
6937  if (Filter.IsActive())
6938  {
6939  // In this example we don't use the clipper when Filter is enabled.
6940  // This is because we don't have a random access on the result on our filter.
6941  // A real application processing logs with ten of thousands of entries may want to store the result of
6942  // search/filter.. especially if the filtering function is not trivial (e.g. reg-exp).
6943  for (int line_no = 0; line_no < LineOffsets.Size; line_no++)
6944  {
6945  const char *line_start = buf + LineOffsets[line_no];
6946  const char *line_end = (line_no + 1 < LineOffsets.Size) ? (buf + LineOffsets[line_no + 1] - 1) : buf_end;
6947  if (Filter.PassFilter(line_start, line_end))
6948  ImGui::TextUnformatted(line_start, line_end);
6949  }
6950  }
6951  else
6952  {
6953  // The simplest and easy way to display the entire buffer:
6954  // ImGui::TextUnformatted(buf_begin, buf_end);
6955  // And it'll just work. TextUnformatted() has specialization for large blob of text and will fast-forward
6956  // to skip non-visible lines. Here we instead demonstrate using the clipper to only process lines that are
6957  // within the visible area.
6958  // If you have tens of thousands of items and their processing cost is non-negligible, coarse clipping them
6959  // on your side is recommended. Using ImGuiListClipper requires
6960  // - A) random access into your data
6961  // - B) items all being the same height,
6962  // both of which we can handle since we an array pointing to the beginning of each line of text.
6963  // When using the filter (in the block of code above) we don't have random access into the data to display
6964  // anymore, which is why we don't use the clipper. Storing or skimming through the search result would make
6965  // it possible (and would be recommended if you want to search through tens of thousands of entries).
6966  ImGuiListClipper clipper;
6967  clipper.Begin(LineOffsets.Size);
6968  while (clipper.Step())
6969  {
6970  for (int line_no = clipper.DisplayStart; line_no < clipper.DisplayEnd; line_no++)
6971  {
6972  const char *line_start = buf + LineOffsets[line_no];
6973  const char *line_end = (line_no + 1 < LineOffsets.Size) ? (buf + LineOffsets[line_no + 1] - 1) : buf_end;
6974  ImGui::TextUnformatted(line_start, line_end);
6975  }
6976  }
6977  clipper.End();
6978  }
6979  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
6980 
6981  if (AutoScroll && ImGui::GetScrollY() >= ImGui::GetScrollMaxY())
6982  ImGui::SetScrollHereY(1.0f);
6983 
6984  ImGui::EndChild();
6985  ImGui::End();
6986  }
6987 };
6988 
6989 // Demonstrate creating a simple log window with basic filtering.
6990 static void ShowExampleAppLog(bool *p_open)
6991 {
6992  static ExampleAppLog log;
6993 
6994  // For the demo: add a debug button _BEFORE_ the normal log window contents
6995  // We take advantage of a rarely used feature: multiple calls to Begin()/End() are appending to the _same_ window.
6996  // Most of the contents of the window will be added by the log.Draw() call.
6997  ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(500, 400), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
6998  ImGui::Begin("Example: Log", p_open);
6999  if (ImGui::SmallButton("[Debug] Add 5 entries"))
7000  {
7001  static int counter = 0;
7002  const char *categories[3] = { "info", "warn", "error" };
7003  const char *words[] = { "Bumfuzzled", "Cattywampus", "Snickersnee", "Abibliophobia", "Absquatulate", "Nincompoop", "Pauciloquent" };
7004  for (int n = 0; n < 5; n++)
7005  {
7006  const char *category = categories[counter % IM_ARRAYSIZE(categories)];
7007  const char *word = words[counter % IM_ARRAYSIZE(words)];
7008  log.AddLog("[%05d] [%s] Hello, current time is %.1f, here's a word: '%s'\n",
7009  ImGui::GetFrameCount(), category, ImGui::GetTime(), word);
7010  counter++;
7011  }
7012  }
7013  ImGui::End();
7014 
7015  // Actually call in the regular Log helper (which will Begin() into the same window as we just did)
7016  log.Draw("Example: Log", p_open);
7017 }
7018 
7019 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7020 // [SECTION] Example App: Simple Layout / ShowExampleAppLayout()
7021 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7022 
7023 // Demonstrate create a window with multiple child windows.
7024 static void ShowExampleAppLayout(bool *p_open)
7025 {
7026  ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(500, 440), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
7027  if (ImGui::Begin("Example: Simple layout", p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar))
7028  {
7029  if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
7030  {
7031  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("File"))
7032  {
7033  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Close")) *p_open = false;
7034  ImGui::EndMenu();
7035  }
7036  ImGui::EndMenuBar();
7037  }
7038 
7039  // Left
7040  static int selected = 0;
7041  {
7042  ImGui::BeginChild("left pane", ImVec2(150, 0), true);
7043  for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++)
7044  {
7045  // FIXME: Good candidate to use ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnNav
7046  char label[128];
7047  sprintf(label, "MyObject %d", i);
7048  if (ImGui::Selectable(label, selected == i))
7049  selected = i;
7050  }
7051  ImGui::EndChild();
7052  }
7053  ImGui::SameLine();
7054 
7055  // Right
7056  {
7057  ImGui::BeginGroup();
7058  ImGui::BeginChild("item view", ImVec2(0, -ImGui::GetFrameHeightWithSpacing())); // Leave room for 1 line below us
7059  ImGui::Text("MyObject: %d", selected);
7060  ImGui::Separator();
7061  if (ImGui::BeginTabBar("##Tabs", ImGuiTabBarFlags_None))
7062  {
7063  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Description"))
7064  {
7065  ImGui::TextWrapped("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. ");
7066  ImGui::EndTabItem();
7067  }
7068  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Details"))
7069  {
7070  ImGui::Text("ID: 0123456789");
7071  ImGui::EndTabItem();
7072  }
7073  ImGui::EndTabBar();
7074  }
7075  ImGui::EndChild();
7076  if (ImGui::Button("Revert"))
7077  {
7078  }
7079  ImGui::SameLine();
7080  if (ImGui::Button("Save"))
7081  {
7082  }
7083  ImGui::EndGroup();
7084  }
7085  }
7086  ImGui::End();
7087 }
7088 
7089 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7090 // [SECTION] Example App: Property Editor / ShowExampleAppPropertyEditor()
7091 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7092 
7093 static void ShowPlaceholderObject(const char *prefix, int uid)
7094 {
7095  // Use object uid as identifier. Most commonly you could also use the object pointer as a base ID.
7096  ImGui::PushID(uid);
7097 
7098  // Text and Tree nodes are less high than framed widgets, using AlignTextToFramePadding() we add vertical spacing to make the tree lines equal high.
7099  ImGui::TableNextRow();
7100  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(0);
7101  ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
7102  bool node_open = ImGui::TreeNode("Object", "%s_%u", prefix, uid);
7103  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(1);
7104  ImGui::Text("my sailor is rich");
7105 
7106  if (node_open)
7107  {
7108  static float placeholder_members[8] = { 0.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f, 3.1416f, 100.0f, 999.0f };
7109  for (int i = 0; i < 8; i++)
7110  {
7111  ImGui::PushID(i); // Use field index as identifier.
7112  if (i < 2)
7113  {
7114  ShowPlaceholderObject("Child", 424242);
7115  }
7116  else
7117  {
7118  // Here we use a TreeNode to highlight on hover (we could use e.g. Selectable as well)
7119  ImGui::TableNextRow();
7120  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(0);
7121  ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
7122  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags = ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet;
7123  ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Field", flags, "Field_%d", i);
7124 
7125  ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(1);
7126  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN);
7127  if (i >= 5)
7128  ImGui::InputFloat("##value", &placeholder_members[i], 1.0f);
7129  else
7130  ImGui::DragFloat("##value", &placeholder_members[i], 0.01f);
7131  ImGui::NextColumn();
7132  }
7133  ImGui::PopID();
7134  }
7135  ImGui::TreePop();
7136  }
7137  ImGui::PopID();
7138 }
7139 
7140 // Demonstrate create a simple property editor.
7141 static void ShowExampleAppPropertyEditor(bool *p_open)
7142 {
7143  ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(430, 450), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
7144  if (!ImGui::Begin("Example: Property editor", p_open))
7145  {
7146  ImGui::End();
7147  return;
7148  }
7149 
7150  HelpMarker(
7151  "This example shows how you may implement a property editor using two columns.\n"
7152  "All objects/fields data are dummies here.\n"
7153  "Remember that in many simple cases, you can use ImGui::SameLine(xxx) to position\n"
7154  "your cursor horizontally instead of using the Columns() API.");
7155 
7156  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(2, 2));
7157  if (ImGui::BeginTable("split", 2, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable))
7158  {
7159  // Iterate placeholder objects (all the same data)
7160  for (int obj_i = 0; obj_i < 4; obj_i++)
7161  {
7162  ShowPlaceholderObject("Object", obj_i);
7163  //ImGui::Separator();
7164  }
7165  ImGui::EndTable();
7166  }
7167  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
7168  ImGui::End();
7169 }
7170 
7171 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7172 // [SECTION] Example App: Long Text / ShowExampleAppLongText()
7173 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7174 
7175 // Demonstrate/test rendering huge amount of text, and the incidence of clipping.
7176 static void ShowExampleAppLongText(bool *p_open)
7177 {
7178  ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(520, 600), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
7179  if (!ImGui::Begin("Example: Long text display", p_open))
7180  {
7181  ImGui::End();
7182  return;
7183  }
7184 
7185  static int test_type = 0;
7186  static ImGuiTextBuffer log;
7187  static int lines = 0;
7188  ImGui::Text("Printing unusually long amount of text.");
7189  ImGui::Combo("Test type", &test_type,
7190  "Single call to TextUnformatted()\0"
7191  "Multiple calls to Text(), clipped\0"
7192  "Multiple calls to Text(), not clipped (slow)\0");
