7193  ImGui::Text("Buffer contents: %d lines, %d bytes", lines, log.size());
7194  if (ImGui::Button("Clear"))
7195  {
7196  log.clear(); lines = 0;
7197  }
7198  ImGui::SameLine();
7199  if (ImGui::Button("Add 1000 lines"))
7200  {
7201  for (int i = 0; i < 1000; i++)
7202  log.appendf("%i The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog\n", lines + i);
7203  lines += 1000;
7204  }
7205  ImGui::BeginChild("Log");
7206  switch (test_type)
7207  {
7208  case 0:
7209  // Single call to TextUnformatted() with a big buffer
7210  ImGui::TextUnformatted(log.begin(), log.end());
7211  break;
7212  case 1:
7213  {
7214  // Multiple calls to Text(), manually coarsely clipped - demonstrate how to use the ImGuiListClipper helper.
7215  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(0, 0));
7216  ImGuiListClipper clipper;
7217  clipper.Begin(lines);
7218  while (clipper.Step())
7219  for (int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++)
7220  ImGui::Text("%i The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog", i);
7221  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
7222  break;
7223  }
7224  case 2:
7225  // Multiple calls to Text(), not clipped (slow)
7226  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(0, 0));
7227  for (int i = 0; i < lines; i++)
7228  ImGui::Text("%i The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog", i);
7229  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
7230  break;
7231  }
7232  ImGui::EndChild();
7233  ImGui::End();
7234 }
7235 
7236 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7237 // [SECTION] Example App: Auto Resize / ShowExampleAppAutoResize()
7238 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7239 
7240 // Demonstrate creating a window which gets auto-resized according to its content.
7241 static void ShowExampleAppAutoResize(bool *p_open)
7242 {
7243  if (!ImGui::Begin("Example: Auto-resizing window", p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
7244  {
7245  ImGui::End();
7246  return;
7247  }
7248 
7249  static int lines = 10;
7250  ImGui::TextUnformatted(
7251  "Window will resize every-frame to the size of its content.\n"
7252  "Note that you probably don't want to query the window size to\n"
7253  "output your content because that would create a feedback loop.");
7254  ImGui::SliderInt("Number of lines", &lines, 1, 20);
7255  for (int i = 0; i < lines; i++)
7256  ImGui::Text("%*sThis is line %d", i * 4, "", i); // Pad with space to extend size horizontally
7257  ImGui::End();
7258 }
7259 
7260 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7261 // [SECTION] Example App: Constrained Resize / ShowExampleAppConstrainedResize()
7262 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7263 
7264 // Demonstrate creating a window with custom resize constraints.
7265 static void ShowExampleAppConstrainedResize(bool *p_open)
7266 {
7267  struct CustomConstraints
7268  {
7269  // Helper functions to demonstrate programmatic constraints
7270  static void Square(ImGuiSizeCallbackData *data)
7271  {
7272  data->DesiredSize.x = data->DesiredSize.y = IM_MAX(data->DesiredSize.x, data->DesiredSize.y);
7273  }
7274  static void Step(ImGuiSizeCallbackData *data)
7275  {
7276  float step = (float)(int)(intptr_t)data->UserData; data->DesiredSize = ImVec2((int)(data->DesiredSize.x / step + 0.5f) * step, (int)(data->DesiredSize.y / step + 0.5f) * step);
7277  }
7278  };
7279 
7280  const char *test_desc[] =
7281  {
7282  "Resize vertical only",
7283  "Resize horizontal only",
7284  "Width > 100, Height > 100",
7285  "Width 400-500",
7286  "Height 400-500",
7287  "Custom: Always Square",
7288  "Custom: Fixed Steps (100)",
7289  };
7290 
7291  static bool auto_resize = false;
7292  static int type = 0;
7293  static int display_lines = 10;
7294  if (type == 0) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(-1, 0), ImVec2(-1, FLT_MAX)); // Vertical only
7295  if (type == 1) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, -1), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, -1)); // Horizontal only
7296  if (type == 2) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(100, 100), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX)); // Width > 100, Height > 100
7297  if (type == 3) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(400, -1), ImVec2(500, -1)); // Width 400-500
7298  if (type == 4) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(-1, 400), ImVec2(-1, 500)); // Height 400-500
7299  if (type == 5) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX), CustomConstraints::Square); // Always Square
7300  if (type == 6) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX), CustomConstraints::Step, (void *)(intptr_t)100); // Fixed Step
7301 
7302  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = auto_resize ? ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize : 0;
7303  if (ImGui::Begin("Example: Constrained Resize", p_open, flags))
7304  {
7305  if (ImGui::Button("200x200"))
7306  {
7307  ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImVec2(200, 200));
7308  } ImGui::SameLine();
7309  if (ImGui::Button("500x500"))
7310  {
7311  ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImVec2(500, 500));
7312  } ImGui::SameLine();
7313  if (ImGui::Button("800x200"))
7314  {
7315  ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImVec2(800, 200));
7316  }
7317  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(200);
7318  ImGui::Combo("Constraint", &type, test_desc, IM_ARRAYSIZE(test_desc));
7319  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(200);
7320  ImGui::DragInt("Lines", &display_lines, 0.2f, 1, 100);
7321  ImGui::Checkbox("Auto-resize", &auto_resize);
7322  for (int i = 0; i < display_lines; i++)
7323  ImGui::Text("%*sHello, sailor! Making this line long enough for the example.", i * 4, "");
7324  }
7325  ImGui::End();
7326 }
7327 
7328 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7329 // [SECTION] Example App: Simple overlay / ShowExampleAppSimpleOverlay()
7330 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7331 
7332 // Demonstrate creating a simple static window with no decoration
7333 // + a context-menu to choose which corner of the screen to use.
7334 static void ShowExampleAppSimpleOverlay(bool *p_open)
7335 {
7336  static int corner = 0;
7337  ImGuiIO &io = ImGui::GetIO();
7338  ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDecoration | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNav;
7339  if (corner != -1)
7340  {
7341  const float PAD = 10.0f;
7342  const ImGuiViewport *viewport = ImGui::GetMainViewport();
7343  ImVec2 work_pos = viewport->WorkPos; // Use work area to avoid menu-bar/task-bar, if any!
7344  ImVec2 work_size = viewport->WorkSize;
7345  ImVec2 window_pos, window_pos_pivot;
7346  window_pos.x = (corner & 1) ? (work_pos.x + work_size.x - PAD) : (work_pos.x + PAD);
7347  window_pos.y = (corner & 2) ? (work_pos.y + work_size.y - PAD) : (work_pos.y + PAD);
7348  window_pos_pivot.x = (corner & 1) ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
7349  window_pos_pivot.y = (corner & 2) ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
7350  ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(window_pos, ImGuiCond_Always, window_pos_pivot);
7351  window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove;
7352  }
7353  ImGui::SetNextWindowBgAlpha(0.35f); // Transparent background
7354  if (ImGui::Begin("Example: Simple overlay", p_open, window_flags))
7355  {
7356  ImGui::Text("Simple overlay\n" "in the corner of the screen.\n" "(right-click to change position)");
7357  ImGui::Separator();
7358  if (ImGui::IsMousePosValid())
7359  ImGui::Text("Mouse Position: (%.1f,%.1f)", io.MousePos.x, io.MousePos.y);
7360  else
7361  ImGui::Text("Mouse Position: <invalid>");
7362  if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextWindow())
7363  {
7364  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Custom", NULL, corner == -1)) corner = -1;
7365  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Top-left", NULL, corner == 0)) corner = 0;
7366  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Top-right", NULL, corner == 1)) corner = 1;
7367  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Bottom-left", NULL, corner == 2)) corner = 2;
7368  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Bottom-right", NULL, corner == 3)) corner = 3;
7369  if (p_open && ImGui::MenuItem("Close")) *p_open = false;
7370  ImGui::EndPopup();
7371  }
7372  }
7373  ImGui::End();
7374 }
7375 
7376 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7377 // [SECTION] Example App: Fullscreen window / ShowExampleAppFullscreen()
7378 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7379 
7380 // Demonstrate creating a window covering the entire screen/viewport
7381 static void ShowExampleAppFullscreen(bool *p_open)
7382 {
7383  static bool use_work_area = true;
7384  static ImGuiWindowFlags flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDecoration | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings;
7385 
7386  // We demonstrate using the full viewport area or the work area (without menu-bars, task-bars etc.)
7387  // Based on your use case you may want one of the other.
7388  const ImGuiViewport *viewport = ImGui::GetMainViewport();
7389  ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(use_work_area ? viewport->WorkPos : viewport->Pos);
7390  ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(use_work_area ? viewport->WorkSize : viewport->Size);
7391 
7392  if (ImGui::Begin("Example: Fullscreen window", p_open, flags))
7393  {
7394  ImGui::Checkbox("Use work area instead of main area", &use_work_area);
7395  ImGui::SameLine();
7396  HelpMarker("Main Area = entire viewport,\nWork Area = entire viewport minus sections used by the main menu bars, task bars etc.\n\nEnable the main-menu bar in Examples menu to see the difference.");
7397 
7398  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground", &flags, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground);
7399  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDecoration", &flags, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDecoration);
7400  ImGui::Indent();
7401  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar", &flags, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar);
7402  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse", &flags, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse);
7403  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar", &flags, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar);
7404  ImGui::Unindent();
7405 
7406  if (p_open && ImGui::Button("Close this window"))
7407  *p_open = false;
7408  }
7409  ImGui::End();
7410 }
7411 
7412 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7413 // [SECTION] Example App: Manipulating Window Titles / ShowExampleAppWindowTitles()
7414 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7415 
7416 // Demonstrate using "##" and "###" in identifiers to manipulate ID generation.
7417 // This apply to all regular items as well.
7418 // Read FAQ section "How can I have multiple widgets with the same label?" for details.
7419 static void ShowExampleAppWindowTitles(bool *)
7420 {
7421  const ImGuiViewport *viewport = ImGui::GetMainViewport();
7422  const ImVec2 base_pos = viewport->Pos;
7423 
7424  // By default, Windows are uniquely identified by their title.
7425  // You can use the "##" and "###" markers to manipulate the display/ID.
7426 
7427  // Using "##" to display same title but have unique identifier.
7428  ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(base_pos.x + 100, base_pos.y + 100), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
7429  ImGui::Begin("Same title as another window##1");
7430  ImGui::Text("This is window 1.\nMy title is the same as window 2, but my identifier is unique.");
7431  ImGui::End();
7432 
7433  ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(base_pos.x + 100, base_pos.y + 200), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
7434  ImGui::Begin("Same title as another window##2");
7435  ImGui::Text("This is window 2.\nMy title is the same as window 1, but my identifier is unique.");
7436  ImGui::End();
7437 
7438  // Using "###" to display a changing title but keep a static identifier "AnimatedTitle"
7439  char buf[128];
7440  sprintf(buf, "Animated title %c %d###AnimatedTitle", "|/-\\"[(int)(ImGui::GetTime() / 0.25f) & 3], ImGui::GetFrameCount());
7441  ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(base_pos.x + 100, base_pos.y + 300), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
7442  ImGui::Begin(buf);
7443  ImGui::Text("This window has a changing title.");
7444  ImGui::End();
7445 }
7446 
7447 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7448 // [SECTION] Example App: Custom Rendering using ImDrawList API / ShowExampleAppCustomRendering()
7449 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7450 
7451 // Demonstrate using the low-level ImDrawList to draw custom shapes.
7452 static void ShowExampleAppCustomRendering(bool *p_open)
7453 {
7454  if (!ImGui::Begin("Example: Custom rendering", p_open))
7455  {
7456  ImGui::End();
7457  return;
7458  }
7459 
7460  // Tip: If you do a lot of custom rendering, you probably want to use your own geometrical types and benefit of
7461  // overloaded operators, etc. Define IM_VEC2_CLASS_EXTRA in imconfig.h to create implicit conversions between your
7462  // types and ImVec2/ImVec4. Dear ImGui defines overloaded operators but they are internal to imgui.cpp and not
7463  // exposed outside (to avoid messing with your types) In this example we are not using the maths operators!
7464 
7465  if (ImGui::BeginTabBar("##TabBar"))
7466  {
7467  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Primitives"))
7468  {
7469  ImGui::PushItemWidth(-ImGui::GetFontSize() * 15);
7470  ImDrawList *draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
7471 
7472  // Draw gradients
7473  // (note that those are currently exacerbating our sRGB/Linear issues)
7474  // Calling ImGui::GetColorU32() multiplies the given colors by the current Style Alpha, but you may pass the IM_COL32() directly as well..
7475  ImGui::Text("Gradients");
7476  ImVec2 gradient_size = ImVec2(ImGui::CalcItemWidth(), ImGui::GetFrameHeight());
7477  {
7478  ImVec2 p0 = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
7479  ImVec2 p1 = ImVec2(p0.x + gradient_size.x, p0.y + gradient_size.y);
7480  ImU32 col_a = ImGui::GetColorU32(IM_COL32(0, 0, 0, 255));
7481  ImU32 col_b = ImGui::GetColorU32(IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 255));
7482  draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(p0, p1, col_a, col_b, col_b, col_a);
7483  ImGui::InvisibleButton("##gradient1", gradient_size);
7484  }
7485  {
7486  ImVec2 p0 = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
7487  ImVec2 p1 = ImVec2(p0.x + gradient_size.x, p0.y + gradient_size.y);
7488  ImU32 col_a = ImGui::GetColorU32(IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));
7489  ImU32 col_b = ImGui::GetColorU32(IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255));
7490  draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(p0, p1, col_a, col_b, col_b, col_a);
7491  ImGui::InvisibleButton("##gradient2", gradient_size);
7492  }
7493 
7494  // Draw a bunch of primitives
7495  ImGui::Text("All primitives");
7496  static float sz = 36.0f;
7497  static float thickness = 3.0f;
7498  static int ngon_sides = 6;
7499  static bool circle_segments_override = false;
7500  static int circle_segments_override_v = 12;
7501  static bool curve_segments_override = false;
7502  static int curve_segments_override_v = 8;
7503  static ImVec4 colf = ImVec4(1.0f, 1.0f, 0.4f, 1.0f);
7504  ImGui::DragFloat("Size", &sz, 0.2f, 2.0f, 100.0f, "%.0f");
7505  ImGui::DragFloat("Thickness", &thickness, 0.05f, 1.0f, 8.0f, "%.02f");
7506  ImGui::SliderInt("N-gon sides", &ngon_sides, 3, 12);
7507  ImGui::Checkbox("##circlesegmentoverride", &circle_segments_override);
7508  ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x);
7509  circle_segments_override |= ImGui::SliderInt("Circle segments override", &circle_segments_override_v, 3, 40);
7510  ImGui::Checkbox("##curvessegmentoverride", &curve_segments_override);
7511  ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x);
7512  curve_segments_override |= ImGui::SliderInt("Curves segments override", &curve_segments_override_v, 3, 40);
7513  ImGui::ColorEdit4("Color", &colf.x);
7514 
7515  const ImVec2 p = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
7516  const ImU32 col = ImColor(colf);
7517  const float spacing = 10.0f;
7518  const ImDrawFlags corners_tl_br = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight;
7519  const float rounding = sz / 5.0f;
7520  const int circle_segments = circle_segments_override ? circle_segments_override_v : 0;
7521  const int curve_segments = curve_segments_override ? curve_segments_override_v : 0;
7522  float x = p.x + 4.0f;
7523  float y = p.y + 4.0f;
7524  for (int n = 0; n < 2; n++)
7525  {
7526  // First line uses a thickness of 1.0f, second line uses the configurable thickness
7527  float th = (n == 0) ? 1.0f : thickness;
7528  draw_list->AddNgon(ImVec2(x + sz * 0.5f, y + sz * 0.5f), sz * 0.5f, col, ngon_sides, th); x += sz + spacing; // N-gon
7529  draw_list->AddCircle(ImVec2(x + sz * 0.5f, y + sz * 0.5f), sz * 0.5f, col, circle_segments, th); x += sz + spacing; // Circle
7530  draw_list->AddRect(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, 0.0f, ImDrawFlags_None, th); x += sz + spacing; // Square
7531  draw_list->AddRect(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, rounding, ImDrawFlags_None, th); x += sz + spacing; // Square with all rounded corners
7532  draw_list->AddRect(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, rounding, corners_tl_br, th); x += sz + spacing; // Square with two rounded corners
7533  draw_list->AddTriangle(ImVec2(x + sz * 0.5f, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz - 0.5f), ImVec2(x, y + sz - 0.5f), col, th); x += sz + spacing; // Triangle
7534  //draw_list->AddTriangle(ImVec2(x+sz*0.2f,y), ImVec2(x, y+sz-0.5f), ImVec2(x+sz*0.4f, y+sz-0.5f), col, th);x+= sz*0.4f + spacing; // Thin triangle
7535  draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y), col, th); x += sz + spacing; // Horizontal line (note: drawing a filled rectangle will be faster!)
7536  draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x, y + sz), col, th); x += spacing; // Vertical line (note: drawing a filled rectangle will be faster!)
7537  draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, th); x += sz + spacing; // Diagonal line
7538 
7539  // Quadratic Bezier Curve (3 control points)
7540  ImVec2 cp3[3] = { ImVec2(x, y + sz * 0.6f), ImVec2(x + sz * 0.5f, y - sz * 0.4f), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz) };
7541  draw_list->AddBezierQuadratic(cp3[0], cp3[1], cp3[2], col, th, curve_segments); x += sz + spacing;
7542 
7543  // Cubic Bezier Curve (4 control points)
7544  ImVec2 cp4[4] = { ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz * 1.3f, y + sz * 0.3f), ImVec2(x + sz - sz * 1.3f, y + sz - sz * 0.3f), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz) };
7545  draw_list->AddBezierCubic(cp4[0], cp4[1], cp4[2], cp4[3], col, th, curve_segments);
7546 
7547  x = p.x + 4;
7548  y += sz + spacing;
7549  }
7550  draw_list->AddNgonFilled(ImVec2(x + sz * 0.5f, y + sz * 0.5f), sz * 0.5f, col, ngon_sides); x += sz + spacing; // N-gon
7551  draw_list->AddCircleFilled(ImVec2(x + sz * 0.5f, y + sz * 0.5f), sz * 0.5f, col, circle_segments); x += sz + spacing; // Circle
7552  draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col); x += sz + spacing; // Square
7553  draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, 10.0f); x += sz + spacing; // Square with all rounded corners
7554  draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, 10.0f, corners_tl_br); x += sz + spacing; // Square with two rounded corners
7555  draw_list->AddTriangleFilled(ImVec2(x + sz * 0.5f, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz - 0.5f), ImVec2(x, y + sz - 0.5f), col); x += sz + spacing; // Triangle
7556  //draw_list->AddTriangleFilled(ImVec2(x+sz*0.2f,y), ImVec2(x, y+sz-0.5f), ImVec2(x+sz*0.4f, y+sz-0.5f), col); x += sz*0.4f + spacing; // Thin triangle
7557  draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + thickness), col); x += sz + spacing; // Horizontal line (faster than AddLine, but only handle integer thickness)
7558  draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + thickness, y + sz), col); x += spacing * 2.0f;// Vertical line (faster than AddLine, but only handle integer thickness)
7559  draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + 1, y + 1), col); x += sz; // Pixel (faster than AddLine)
7560  draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), IM_COL32(0, 0, 0, 255), IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255), IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));
7561 
7562  ImGui::Dummy(ImVec2((sz + spacing) * 10.2f, (sz + spacing) * 3.0f));
7563  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
7564  ImGui::EndTabItem();
7565  }
7566 
7567  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Canvas"))
7568  {
7569  static ImVector<ImVec2> points;
7570  static ImVec2 scrolling(0.0f, 0.0f);
7571  static bool opt_enable_grid = true;
7572  static bool opt_enable_context_menu = true;
7573  static bool adding_line = false;
7574 
7575  ImGui::Checkbox("Enable grid", &opt_enable_grid);
7576  ImGui::Checkbox("Enable context menu", &opt_enable_context_menu);
7577  ImGui::Text("Mouse Left: drag to add lines,\nMouse Right: drag to scroll, click for context menu.");
7578 
7579  // Typically you would use a BeginChild()/EndChild() pair to benefit from a clipping region + own scrolling.
7580  // Here we demonstrate that this can be replaced by simple offsetting + custom drawing + PushClipRect/PopClipRect() calls.
7581  // To use a child window instead we could use, e.g:
7582  // ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, ImVec2(0, 0)); // Disable padding
7583  // ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ChildBg, IM_COL32(50, 50, 50, 255)); // Set a background color
7584  // ImGui::BeginChild("canvas", ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f), true, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove);
7585  // ImGui::PopStyleColor();
7586  // ImGui::PopStyleVar();
7587  // [...]
7588  // ImGui::EndChild();
7589 
7590  // Using InvisibleButton() as a convenience 1) it will advance the layout cursor and 2) allows us to use IsItemHovered()/IsItemActive()
7591  ImVec2 canvas_p0 = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos(); // ImDrawList API uses screen coordinates!
7592  ImVec2 canvas_sz = ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail(); // Resize canvas to what's available
7593  if (canvas_sz.x < 50.0f) canvas_sz.x = 50.0f;
7594  if (canvas_sz.y < 50.0f) canvas_sz.y = 50.0f;
7595  ImVec2 canvas_p1 = ImVec2(canvas_p0.x + canvas_sz.x, canvas_p0.y + canvas_sz.y);
7596 
7597  // Draw border and background color
7598  ImGuiIO &io = ImGui::GetIO();
7599  ImDrawList *draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
7600  draw_list->AddRectFilled(canvas_p0, canvas_p1, IM_COL32(50, 50, 50, 255));
7601  draw_list->AddRect(canvas_p0, canvas_p1, IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 255));
7602 
7603  // This will catch our interactions
7604  ImGui::InvisibleButton("canvas", canvas_sz, ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonLeft | ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonRight);
7605  const bool is_hovered = ImGui::IsItemHovered(); // Hovered
7606  const bool is_active = ImGui::IsItemActive(); // Held
7607  const ImVec2 origin(canvas_p0.x + scrolling.x, canvas_p0.y + scrolling.y); // Lock scrolled origin
7608  const ImVec2 mouse_pos_in_canvas(io.MousePos.x - origin.x, io.MousePos.y - origin.y);
7609 
7610  // Add first and second point
7611  if (is_hovered && !adding_line && ImGui::IsMouseClicked(ImGuiMouseButton_Left))
7612  {
7613  points.push_back(mouse_pos_in_canvas);
7614  points.push_back(mouse_pos_in_canvas);
7615  adding_line = true;
7616  }
7617  if (adding_line)
7618  {
7619  points.back() = mouse_pos_in_canvas;
7620  if (!ImGui::IsMouseDown(ImGuiMouseButton_Left))
7621  adding_line = false;
7622  }
7623 
7624  // Pan (we use a zero mouse threshold when there's no context menu)
7625  // You may decide to make that threshold dynamic based on whether the mouse is hovering something etc.
7626  const float mouse_threshold_for_pan = opt_enable_context_menu ? -1.0f : 0.0f;
7627  if (is_active && ImGui::IsMouseDragging(ImGuiMouseButton_Right, mouse_threshold_for_pan))
7628  {
7629  scrolling.x += io.MouseDelta.x;
7630  scrolling.y += io.MouseDelta.y;
7631  }
7632 
7633  // Context menu (under default mouse threshold)
7634  ImVec2 drag_delta = ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(ImGuiMouseButton_Right);
7635  if (opt_enable_context_menu && ImGui::IsMouseReleased(ImGuiMouseButton_Right) && drag_delta.x == 0.0f && drag_delta.y == 0.0f)
7636  ImGui::OpenPopupOnItemClick("context");
7637  if (ImGui::BeginPopup("context"))
7638  {
7639  if (adding_line)
7640  points.resize(points.size() - 2);
7641  adding_line = false;
7642  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Remove one", NULL, false, points.Size > 0))
7643  {
7644  points.resize(points.size() - 2);
7645  }
7646  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Remove all", NULL, false, points.Size > 0))
7647  {
7648  points.clear();
7649  }
7650  ImGui::EndPopup();
7651  }
7652 
7653  // Draw grid + all lines in the canvas
7654  draw_list->PushClipRect(canvas_p0, canvas_p1, true);
7655  if (opt_enable_grid)
7656  {
7657  const float GRID_STEP = 64.0f;
7658  for (float x = fmodf(scrolling.x, GRID_STEP); x < canvas_sz.x; x += GRID_STEP)
7659  draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(canvas_p0.x + x, canvas_p0.y), ImVec2(canvas_p0.x + x, canvas_p1.y), IM_COL32(200, 200, 200, 40));
7660  for (float y = fmodf(scrolling.y, GRID_STEP); y < canvas_sz.y; y += GRID_STEP)
7661  draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(canvas_p0.x, canvas_p0.y + y), ImVec2(canvas_p1.x, canvas_p0.y + y), IM_COL32(200, 200, 200, 40));
7662  }
7663  for (int n = 0; n < points.Size; n += 2)
7664  draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(origin.x + points[n].x, origin.y + points[n].y), ImVec2(origin.x + points[n + 1].x, origin.y + points[n + 1].y), IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), 2.0f);
7665  draw_list->PopClipRect();
7666 
7667  ImGui::EndTabItem();
7668  }
7669 
7670  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("BG/FG draw lists"))
7671  {
7672  static bool draw_bg = true;
7673  static bool draw_fg = true;
7674  ImGui::Checkbox("Draw in Background draw list", &draw_bg);
7675  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("The Background draw list will be rendered below every Dear ImGui windows.");
7676  ImGui::Checkbox("Draw in Foreground draw list", &draw_fg);
7677  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("The Foreground draw list will be rendered over every Dear ImGui windows.");
7678  ImVec2 window_pos = ImGui::GetWindowPos();
7679  ImVec2 window_size = ImGui::GetWindowSize();
7680  ImVec2 window_center = ImVec2(window_pos.x + window_size.x * 0.5f, window_pos.y + window_size.y * 0.5f);
7681  if (draw_bg)
7682  ImGui::GetBackgroundDrawList()->AddCircle(window_center, window_size.x * 0.6f, IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 200), 0, 10 + 4);
7683  if (draw_fg)
7684  ImGui::GetForegroundDrawList()->AddCircle(window_center, window_size.y * 0.6f, IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 200), 0, 10);
7685  ImGui::EndTabItem();
7686  }
7687 
7688  ImGui::EndTabBar();
7689  }
7690 
7691  ImGui::End();
7692 }
7693 
7694 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7695 // [SECTION] Example App: Documents Handling / ShowExampleAppDocuments()
7696 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7697 
7698 // Simplified structure to mimic a Document model
7699 struct MyDocument
7700 {
7701  const char *Name; // Document title
7702  bool Open; // Set when open (we keep an array of all available documents to simplify demo code!)
7703  bool OpenPrev; // Copy of Open from last update.
7704  bool Dirty; // Set when the document has been modified
7705  bool WantClose; // Set when the document
7706  ImVec4 Color; // An arbitrary variable associated to the document
7707 
7708  MyDocument(const char *name, bool open = true, const ImVec4 &color = ImVec4(1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f))
7709  {
7710  Name = name;
7711  Open = OpenPrev = open;
7712  Dirty = false;
7713  WantClose = false;
7714  Color = color;
7715  }
7716  void DoOpen()
7717  {
7718  Open = true;
7719  }
7720  void DoQueueClose()
7721  {
7722  WantClose = true;
7723  }
7724  void DoForceClose()
7725  {
7726  Open = false; Dirty = false;
7727  }
7728  void DoSave()
7729  {
7730  Dirty = false;
7731  }
7732 
7733 // Display placeholder contents for the Document
7734  static void DisplayContents(MyDocument *doc)
7735  {
7736  ImGui::PushID(doc);
7737  ImGui::Text("Document \"%s\"", doc->Name);
7738  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, doc->Color);
7739  ImGui::TextWrapped("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.");
7740  ImGui::PopStyleColor();
7741  if (ImGui::Button("Modify", ImVec2(100, 0)))
7742  doc->Dirty = true;
7743  ImGui::SameLine();
7744  if (ImGui::Button("Save", ImVec2(100, 0)))
7745  doc->DoSave();
7746  ImGui::ColorEdit3("color", &doc->Color.x); // Useful to test drag and drop and hold-dragged-to-open-tab behavior.
7747  ImGui::PopID();
7748  }
7749 
7750  // Display context menu for the Document
7751  static void DisplayContextMenu(MyDocument *doc)
7752  {
7753  if (!ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem())
7754  return;
7755 
7756  char buf[256];
7757  sprintf(buf, "Save %s", doc->Name);
7758  if (ImGui::MenuItem(buf, "CTRL+S", false, doc->Open))
7759  doc->DoSave();
7760  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Close", "CTRL+W", false, doc->Open))
7761  doc->DoQueueClose();
7762  ImGui::EndPopup();
7763  }
7764 };
7765 
7766 struct ExampleAppDocuments
7767 {
7768  ImVector<MyDocument> Documents;
7769 
7770  ExampleAppDocuments()
7771  {
7772  Documents.push_back(MyDocument("Lettuce", true, ImVec4(0.4f, 0.8f, 0.4f, 1.0f)));
7773  Documents.push_back(MyDocument("Eggplant", true, ImVec4(0.8f, 0.5f, 1.0f, 1.0f)));
7774  Documents.push_back(MyDocument("Carrot", true, ImVec4(1.0f, 0.8f, 0.5f, 1.0f)));
7775  Documents.push_back(MyDocument("Tomato", false, ImVec4(1.0f, 0.3f, 0.4f, 1.0f)));
7776  Documents.push_back(MyDocument("A Rather Long Title", false));
7777  Documents.push_back(MyDocument("Some Document", false));
7778  }
7779 };
7780 
7781 // [Optional] Notify the system of Tabs/Windows closure that happened outside the regular tab interface.
7782 // If a tab has been closed programmatically (aka closed from another source such as the Checkbox() in the demo,
7783 // as opposed to clicking on the regular tab closing button) and stops being submitted, it will take a frame for
7784 // the tab bar to notice its absence. During this frame there will be a gap in the tab bar, and if the tab that has
7785 // disappeared was the selected one, the tab bar will report no selected tab during the frame. This will effectively
7786 // give the impression of a flicker for one frame.
7787 // We call SetTabItemClosed() to manually notify the Tab Bar or Docking system of removed tabs to avoid this glitch.
7788 // Note that this completely optional, and only affect tab bars with the ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable flag.
7789 static void NotifyOfDocumentsClosedElsewhere(ExampleAppDocuments & app)
7790 {
7791  for (int doc_n = 0; doc_n < app.Documents.Size; doc_n++)
7792  {
7793  MyDocument *doc = &app.Documents[doc_n];
7794  if (!doc->Open && doc->OpenPrev)
7795  ImGui::SetTabItemClosed(doc->Name);
7796  doc->OpenPrev = doc->Open;
7797  }
7798 }
7799 
7800 void ShowExampleAppDocuments(bool *p_open)
7801 {
7802  static ExampleAppDocuments app;
7803 
7804  // Options
7805  static bool opt_reorderable = true;
7806  static ImGuiTabBarFlags opt_fitting_flags = ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyDefault_;
7807 
7808  bool window_contents_visible = ImGui::Begin("Example: Documents", p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar);
7809  if (!window_contents_visible)
7810  {
7811  ImGui::End();
7812  return;
7813  }
7814 
7815  // Menu
7816  if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
7817  {
7818  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("File"))
7819  {
7820  int open_count = 0;
7821  for (int doc_n = 0; doc_n < app.Documents.Size; doc_n++)
7822  open_count += app.Documents[doc_n].Open ? 1 : 0;
7823 
7824  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Open", open_count < app.Documents.Size))
7825  {
7826  for (int doc_n = 0; doc_n < app.Documents.Size; doc_n++)
7827  {
7828  MyDocument *doc = &app.Documents[doc_n];
7829  if (!doc->Open)
7830  if (ImGui::MenuItem(doc->Name))
7831  doc->DoOpen();
7832  }
7833  ImGui::EndMenu();
7834  }
7835  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Close All Documents", NULL, false, open_count > 0))
7836  for (int doc_n = 0; doc_n < app.Documents.Size; doc_n++)
7837  app.Documents[doc_n].DoQueueClose();
7838  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Exit", "Alt+F4"))
7839  {
7840  }
7841  ImGui::EndMenu();
7842  }
7843  ImGui::EndMenuBar();
7844  }
7845 
7846  // [Debug] List documents with one checkbox for each
7847  for (int doc_n = 0; doc_n < app.Documents.Size; doc_n++)
7848  {
7849  MyDocument *doc = &app.Documents[doc_n];
7850  if (doc_n > 0)
7851  ImGui::SameLine();
7852  ImGui::PushID(doc);
7853  if (ImGui::Checkbox(doc->Name, &doc->Open))
7854  if (!doc->Open)
7855  doc->DoForceClose();
7856  ImGui::PopID();
7857  }
7858 
7859  ImGui::Separator();
7860 
7861  // About the ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument / ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument flags.
7862  // They have multiple effects:
7863  // - Display a dot next to the title.
7864  // - Tab is selected when clicking the X close button.
7865  // - Closure is not assumed (will wait for user to stop submitting the tab).
7866  // Otherwise closure is assumed when pressing the X, so if you keep submitting the tab may reappear at end of tab bar.
7867  // We need to assume closure by default otherwise waiting for "lack of submission" on the next frame would leave an empty
7868  // hole for one-frame, both in the tab-bar and in tab-contents when closing a tab/window.
7869  // The rarely used SetTabItemClosed() function is a way to notify of programmatic closure to avoid the one-frame hole.
7870 
7871  // Submit Tab Bar and Tabs
7872  {
7873  ImGuiTabBarFlags tab_bar_flags = (opt_fitting_flags) | (opt_reorderable ? ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable : 0);
7874  if (ImGui::BeginTabBar("##tabs", tab_bar_flags))
7875  {
7876  if (opt_reorderable)
7877  NotifyOfDocumentsClosedElsewhere(app);
7878 
7879  // [DEBUG] Stress tests
7880  //if ((ImGui::GetFrameCount() % 30) == 0) docs[1].Open ^= 1; // [DEBUG] Automatically show/hide a tab. Test various interactions e.g. dragging with this on.
7881  //if (ImGui::GetIO().KeyCtrl) ImGui::SetTabItemSelected(docs[1].Name); // [DEBUG] Test SetTabItemSelected(), probably not very useful as-is anyway..
7882 
7883  // Submit Tabs
7884  for (int doc_n = 0; doc_n < app.Documents.Size; doc_n++)
7885  {
7886  MyDocument *doc = &app.Documents[doc_n];
7887  if (!doc->Open)
7888  continue;
7889 
7890  ImGuiTabItemFlags tab_flags = (doc->Dirty ? ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument : 0);
7891  bool visible = ImGui::BeginTabItem(doc->Name, &doc->Open, tab_flags);
7892 
7893  // Cancel attempt to close when unsaved add to save queue so we can display a popup.
7894  if (!doc->Open && doc->Dirty)
7895  {
7896  doc->Open = true;
7897  doc->DoQueueClose();
7898  }
7899 
7900  MyDocument::DisplayContextMenu(doc);
7901  if (visible)
7902  {
7903  MyDocument::DisplayContents(doc);
7904  ImGui::EndTabItem();
7905  }
7906  }
7907 
7908  ImGui::EndTabBar();
7909  }
7910  }
7911 
7912  // Update closing queue
7913  static ImVector<MyDocument *> close_queue;
7914  if (close_queue.empty())
7915  {
7916  // Close queue is locked once we started a popup
7917  for (int doc_n = 0; doc_n < app.Documents.Size; doc_n++)
7918  {
7919  MyDocument *doc = &app.Documents[doc_n];
7920  if (doc->WantClose)
7921  {
7922  doc->WantClose = false;
7923  close_queue.push_back(doc);
7924  }
7925  }
7926  }
7927 
7928  // Display closing confirmation UI
7929  if (!close_queue.empty())
7930  {
7931  int close_queue_unsaved_documents = 0;
7932  for (int n = 0; n < close_queue.Size; n++)
7933  if (close_queue[n]->Dirty)
7934  close_queue_unsaved_documents++;
7935 
7936  if (close_queue_unsaved_documents == 0)
7937  {
7938  // Close documents when all are unsaved
7939  for (int n = 0; n < close_queue.Size; n++)
7940  close_queue[n]->DoForceClose();
7941  close_queue.clear();
7942  }
7943  else
7944  {
7945  if (!ImGui::IsPopupOpen("Save?"))
7946  ImGui::OpenPopup("Save?");
7947  if (ImGui::BeginPopupModal("Save?", NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
7948  {
7949  ImGui::Text("Save change to the following items?");
7950  float item_height = ImGui::GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing();
7951  if (ImGui::BeginChildFrame(ImGui::GetID("frame"), ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 6.25f * item_height)))
7952  {
7953  for (int n = 0; n < close_queue.Size; n++)
7954  if (close_queue[n]->Dirty)
7955  ImGui::Text("%s", close_queue[n]->Name);
7956  ImGui::EndChildFrame();
7957  }
7958 
7959  ImVec2 button_size(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 7.0f, 0.0f);
7960  if (ImGui::Button("Yes", button_size))
7961  {
7962  for (int n = 0; n < close_queue.Size; n++)
7963  {
7964  if (close_queue[n]->Dirty)
7965  close_queue[n]->DoSave();
7966  close_queue[n]->DoForceClose();
7967  }
7968  close_queue.clear();
7969  ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
7970  }
7971  ImGui::SameLine();
7972  if (ImGui::Button("No", button_size))
7973  {
7974  for (int n = 0; n < close_queue.Size; n++)
7975  close_queue[n]->DoForceClose();
7976  close_queue.clear();
7977  ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
7978  }
7979  ImGui::SameLine();
7980  if (ImGui::Button("Cancel", button_size))
7981  {
7982  close_queue.clear();
7983  ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
7984  }
7985  ImGui::EndPopup();
7986  }
7987  }
7988  }
7989 
7990  ImGui::End();
7991 }
7992 
7993 // End of Demo code
7994 #else
7995 
7996 void ImGui::ShowAboutWindow(bool *)
7997 {}
7998 void ImGui::ShowDemoWindow(bool *)
7999 {}
8000 void ImGui::ShowUserGuide()
8001 {}
8002 void ImGui::ShowStyleEditor(ImGuiStyle *)
8003 {}
8004 
8005 #endif
8006 
8007 #endif // #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE
